column1:
2176,Mimi Traiteur,"

Restaurant located in the heart of the 17th district of Paris.

column2: • You will be warmly received at Mimi traiteur's by a young, dynamic, and family team.
• With their vast culinary experience since 1989, Mimi traiteur is the right place to get your Shabbat meals, for takeaway or home delivery.
• Every Friday, Mimi traiteur makes your life easier by concocting the best traditional dishes and kémia for Shabbas.
• A large choice is offered: fish, meatballs, couscous, roast chicken in all forms and all sauces.
• Mimi traiteur makes all types of Shabbas, according to individual preferences: Moroccan, Israeli, Tunisian.
• Their menu is well known for its Oriental salads festival, its Tunisian or Moroccan dishes, halots kneaded and braided by hand, but especially with authentic taste at affordable prices.
• The restaurant is located in the heart of the 17th district of Paris if you want to take your order away. Mimi traiteur also has delivery service.
• You can compose your Chabbas as you wish, but you can also enjoy the menus proposed by Mimi traiteur: a generous Chabat with 2 dishes, 8 salads and 2 halottes for € 40.
• During the week, you will discover daily lunch menu for €9.90 and a variety of meals to choose.
• Did we miss anything? Let us know in the comments below!
• Have you been here before? Share your tips with us!
• Are you the owner? Claim your listing!
• La Délicieuse welcomes you to its 3 boutiques in Paris: Voltaire, Belleville and Marais.
• Affordable prices.
• La Délicieuse is the first artisan to offer you banette Kosher! You will also find a complete range of traditional and speacial breads.
• Mastering the techniques of French and Oriental pastry, this bakery has a varied menu if you want a quick lunch break, or delicious dishes of the day.
• They offer Shabbat meals to takeaway on Thursdays.
• They can also cater your small receptions in the room of your choice or for takeaway.
• This restaurant is permanently closed.

column2: • They offer a rich and varied range of Italian, Japanese and American cuisine.
• Indeed, a very large choice is available to you: salads, pasta, pizza, pancakes, fish, sandwiches, bagels, sushi, california maki, tartar... and many other surprises.
• Open even on Saturday night Motseh Chabbas, when you can taste all the specialities that make Aroma restaurant one of the most halavi Kosher restaurants in the 19th arrondissement of Paris.
• Aroma delivers for free at home or your office for a minimum order of € 15 in Paris 3rd, 11th, 18th, 19th, 20th, but also Pantin, Les Lilas, Le Pré Saint Gervais, Romainville, etc.
• With its trendy and cosy framework, Aroma can be privatised to celebrate all your family or business events.

• A few steps away from the Place de Mexicoq, it is in a rural setting that you are offered a concept of restaurant-rotisserie.
• Retro furniture, red and white checkered tablecloths, figurines of gallinaceae proudly reigning in the 4 corners of the room.

• Here, all the pieces of poultry are part of the meals: poultry liver salad, chicken wings with caramelised sauce, pestles with hot sauce, the top of leg (parguit) marinated and grilled, schnitzel and chicken steak in a burger.
• There are 2 classic set menus from 16 € that include starter and main course or main course and dessert.

column1: Haeche, Ten Bis restaurant is located in the heart of the 19th arrondissement on Manin Street. You will discover a real typical Israeli restaurant in Paris. And finally a restaurant where everything is done in front of you, from the manufacture of the LAFA to your aperitif. The first quality of this restaurant is the freshness of all its products and obviously the cleanliness.

column2: <li>

column1: Ten Bis offers Israeli specialties such as falafels, shawarmas, parguites, keftas, fresh homemade schnitzels ... Lafa and pita are made on site.

column2: <li>

column1: All dishes are accompanied by Israeli salads, hummus, red cabbage, white cabbage and all the ingredients worthy of an Israeli restaurant! There are dozens of sauces available (tehina, amba, barbecue, mayonnaise, ketchup ...).

column2: <li>

column1: Ten bis is a kosher restaurant under the supervision of the Lubavitch Rabbinate of France.

2336,Dizengoff Pizza,"

A Kosher pizza restaurant in the heart of the 17th.

column2: • For cheese lovers, discover the cheesy crust option with its edges stuffed with delicious melting cheese.
• You will get through the best gourmet experiences of Italian food with pizzas of any type: fine dough, thick dough, classic format or family size, and pizzas that you can compose by yourself, .
• Dizengoff 17ème offers you a new perfect menu with unlimited consumption at the price of € 11 per child and € 22 per adult. The room can accommodate up to 12 people.
• Whether for a pizza longing on Saturday night or Sunday, the Dizengoff will serve you until 2:00 am on Saturday evening even in summer. It is also open non-stop on Sundays.
• Delivery service is assured also.

1843,Le Beverly,"

Restaurant offering plenty of varied dishes.

column2: • Beverly is located in a picturesque place, passage of Cairo, the oldest covered passage of Paris.
• Led by a young chef graduated from the Ecole hôtelière and surrounded by a dynamic and welcoming team, the Beverly offers you many specialities.
• Main course + dessert + drink: 18 €.
• Every day of the week, the chef prepares you a dish of the day that will keep you coming back.
• They also prepare Shabbat meals on order and caters special events on site.
• Delivery is provided in the neighbouring districts and arrondissements (minimum order 15 €).

column2: • Nice and casual restaurant with friendly staff.
• Pleasant environment.
• Try the 4 cheese pasta!
• Fish and vegetables are amazing too.

• One of the first Halavi Kosher restaurants in Paris .
• The secret of their success is the priority given to the quality of the raw materials and their freshness, plus the professionalism of its team.
• The menu is very varied (sushi, pizzas, salads, homemade pasta, gratins, fish, salted or gratinated pancakes, desserts, and more).

1946,Japan Eat,"

Perfect restaurant for Asian food lovers.

column2: • Asian food lovers will be satisfied with Japan Eat. Japanese, Chinese, Thai and Vietnamese cuisine are gathered at the same address and prepared by a sushi chef and a Chinese chef respectively.
• Japan Eat offers the complete panel of a sushi bar worthy of the name.
• With the 12 Japanese trays, you will inevitably find the combination that stirs your taste buds at attractive prices.
• To ""compete"" with the Japanese, the chef dedicated to the other cuisines will not disappoint you! From egg rolls and spring rolls, to pad thai and lemon chicken.
• At lunch choose from 18 meals: € 10 only.
• Japan Eat delivers for free in the 11th and numerous arrondissements and bordering communes (minimum order 15 € lunch / 20 € the evening).
• Shabbat meals forms in their facebook page.
• Did we miss anything? Let us know in the comments below!
• Have you been here before? Share your tips with us!

2385,Darjeeling La Boutique,"

Restaurant full of Indian flavours.

column2: • Specialising in Indian food, Darjeeling offers rich dishes of a refined civilization dating back several centuries.

• More than 32 traditional spices such as cardamom, garam Bengal, curry leaves, nutmeg, poppy, mango, curcumin, garam masala, fenugreek... slowly and carefully prepared to tempt your tastebuds with a flavourful menu.
• Delivers to most of districts of Paris and Ile de France.
• There is also another branch called Darjeeling Le Restaurant, located at Rue des Colonels Renard 1 Île-de-France FR.

• It is also known for being the restaurant of celebrities, you can have a look at the guestbook signed by famous people.
• Nini, is also famous for its fish and couscous in all its forms: couscous dumplings, couscous chicken, bkaila, couscous mechoui of lamb, and more.

• Located in the heart of the 17th arrondissement of Paris and a stone's throw from the Parc Monceau, their restaurant welcomes you warmly in a casual setting.
• La Citadelle is the perfect place for a one-on-one meeting or for anyone wishing to be welcomed by a team of professionals.
• The Citadelle can organise your business meals, and all your family celebrations. 52 seatings available.
• Gourmet restaurant with traditional French cuisine. You can taste many hearty dishes based on the speciality of foie gras.

column1:
2619,LeKavod,"

Great restaurant in the heart of Paris.

column2: • Seating available for 60 people, and a buffet reception for 100.
• Serves Nine Days menu.
• Not open for Pesach and Succah on Succot.
• Takeaway and catering services available.
• Le Kavod comes from the Hebrew, meaning to honour; the name conveys the bistro’s famed hospitality and warm welcome of their guests.  Fittingly, the Israeli Embassy is also nearby.
• The restaurant is a cosmopolitan yet cozy space, with a bar tucked in the back. The walls are decorated with cheerful arrangements of photographs, and the setting warmed with fresh flowers.

• Polished, elegant furniture and floor-to-ceiling windows add to its magnificent visual impact. Its traditional yet trendy ambience makes it ideal for families, and business meetings, as well as super-romantic dates.
• Le Kavod’s diverse menu includes a range of French classics, which are constantly refined by the talented chef, as well as more sophisticated, inventive cuisine in astounding flavours and variety.

column1:
14455,Cosy Fresh,"

They use fresh products to guarantee the quality of their dishes.

column2: • Cozy Fresh offers a great atmosphere with its black brick decoration in its underground version, it has a sushi bar and a banquet area.
• Cosy Fresh's menu offers offers 3 different specialties: American, Japanese and Chinese. Each chef specialized in his field.
• Within its wide menu you can find: Salads, hamburgers, bagels, wraps, classic or special sushi and Chinese dishes.
• They offer delivery service, check the zones here.
• Check the full menu here.
• Also you can book a table here.

<li>

column1: In the heart of the 17th arrondissement, a few steps from Place Pereire, travel back in time, to the heart of the Roaring Twenties, in a chic & relaxed atmosphere where abundance and gluttony mingle.

column2: <li>

column1: The two owners, Franck & Helena will show you that pleasure and sharing are the watchwords of the house!

column2: <li>

column1: From the first rays of sunshine, you will have the opportunity to taste dishes to share around a good glass of wine on the south-facing terrace!

column2: <li>

column1: At Franck, they offer revisited French cuisine with seasonal products, carefully selected by the chef who learned his skills with Joël Robuchon or at the Plaza Athénée alongside Alain Ducasse.

column2: • “Chez Franck” is a kosher restaurant under the supervision of Beth Din of Paris.
• This place is permanently closed.
• L'Inte caffe , an Italian restaurant in Paris especialised in fish and Italian cuisine.
• It has giant screens for live TV shows as well as rhythmic evenings to the sound of singers and other entertainment.

• The restaurant is composed of a first large room and a second room in front of the bar with a small living room that can welcome up to 14 people, with a large table and a video projector, perfect for all your meetings.

• Welcoming environment.

• Ideally located between République and Bonne Nouvelle, Poulet Hoff welcomes you in a warm and family atmosphere.
•  Its charm catches you from the doorway: woodwork, mosaics, soft colours, leather benches and New York poster; old and modern intermingle in harmony.
• From your table you can see the chickens roast gently to the pin-turners behind the bar.
• The gentle emanations will emanate will tickle your nostrils and sharpen your taste buds.
• The best time is obviously that of the tasting: the chicken will arrive fondant and tasty on your plates, a treat! Crack for a tiramisu or a chocolate fondant to finish with a sweet note...
• Please note: the property has an upstairs room to celebrate a birthday or a group meal. Enjoy special menus at football evenings and children's menus on Sundays.

1968,Il Vantaggio,"

A Kosher restaurant that offers authentic, original and gourmet Italian specialities.

column2: • Succumb to the pizzas prepared by our pizzaiolo, whose ancestral recipe and maturation of the dough for 72 hours offer an incomparable crunch and lightness.
• For pasta, the chef also reserves nice surprises. The majority of their ingredients are imported directly from Italy.
• Finally, discover the homemade desserts.
• Come dance, sing and make beautiful encounters during their karaoke evenings.
• Il Vantaggio also offers you to privatise the restaurant for your events! All the reasons are good to come to discover this amazing restaurant...
• You can either dine in, make a reservation, and order for takeaway or delivery.
• Seating available outside.
• Great option for big families or groups.
• Catering services available.
• Check their Facebook page for more details.
• A few steps from the Palais des Congres, Kfé Benson is the new Kosher restaurant that offers a unique and varied cuisine.
• Dine in or takeaway, you will discover amazing burgers, club sandwiches, or various salads.
• Enjoy a quality meal with friends and family in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere.
• The restaurant can be fully privatised for any kind of event, whether it is a private matter or professional, do not hesitate to contact them.

3844,Tavlini e Massala,"

An Indian restaurant with a great menu.

column2: • The change of scenery will be announced from the front of the restaurant, whose solid wood door looks like the entrance to an Indian palace.

• Inside, a typical decoration cohabits with the contemporary. The carved wooden walls reveal hangings in shimmering colours, whilst the modern banquettes and led spots bring a cozy and up-to-date touch to this 47-seater restaurant.

• The Indian dishes are made up of various spices that the cook mixes according to ancient laws and know-how, with the aim of bringing to each meal a very specific flavour and medicinal virtues that make it more digestible and more harmonious on the energy plan.

• Indian lovers will not be disappointed by the offer of Tavlini and Massala, which offers a gourmet tour of India with a multitude of specialities: samousas, pakoras, naans, tandoori, curry, and more.
• You can view their full menu here.

14007,Bozen Marseille,"

Sushi and high-end bagel restaurant chain.

column2: • Parve.
• Bozen is a chain of sushi restaurants, salads, and a high-end bagel.
• Between tradition and innovation, you will succumb to their delicious creations.
• Bagels and hot dogs are also included in the menu, the second trend product of the moment: the bagel whose bread and sauce are directly imported from the USA.
• The product is always oriented ""luxury"" with compositions with pastrami, grilled chicken, foie gras, sausage mix.
• Delivery and takeaway services available.
• Modern and contemporary, casual environment, good for groups, couples or solo dining.
• They can also cater your event.
• Located 2 miles southeast of downtown Marseille.

column2: • Dairy. Bakery.

• Modern and comfortable.

• Dairy. Parve.
• Traditional bakery, offering sandwiches, pizzas, bread, baked goodies, and sweets.
• Stools and bar tables available
• Located 2 miles south of downtown Marseille.

• Allo Sarina is the Shabbat specialist that bring your meals to your home. A special menu dedicated to Shabbat allows you to choose between a multitude of kemias (10 different kinds) and a huge choice of dishes (different couscous, tafinas, chicken with olives, nikitouche).

• It is no coincidence that the restaurant Allo Sarina has been an institution since 1993! Heirs to the know-how of their dear mother Sarina (zal), the Benmoussa children continue the family tradition and offer you an Oriental cuisine that is fragrant, joyous, rich, colourful, and will remind you of the flavours of your childhood dishes.
• Allo Sarina is a lively and welcoming place. Besides deliveries you can either dine in or order to takeaway as well.

column1:
13986,La Kantine - Espace du Judaisme,"

Restaurant inside Jewish centre.

column2: • Glatt.
• La Kantine is the restaurant of the EDJ and was reopened on February 2018.
• The restaurant menu average price is 16€.
• Casual and group friendly. Takeaways are available.
• Heshcher.

column1:
2314,Grill Bar,"

Israeli and American atmosphere all in one place.

column2: • Grill Bar is located at the very heart of the 16th - very close to the Mall ""les belles feuilles"" and not very far from the Arc de Triomphe and the Trocadero gardens next to the Eiffel Tower
• The menu presents a beautiful selection of burgers (cheeseburger, bacon burger, burger bar grill), bagels, sandwiches and various platters (shawarma, steak, rib steak).
• You will discover, with an unavoidable pleasure, the American and Israeli street food flavours made from fresh products.
• More than 30 ingredients await you to prepare your salad according to your taste!
• Grill Bar delivers you in Paris 15, 16, 17, 7, 8, and in Neuilly, Levallois, Boulogne Billancourt.

column1:
2263,Kahn Famous Deli -Boulogne,"

Restaurant with a New York vibe.

column2: • Glatt.
• In the heart of the most chic areas of the capital, Khan brings the deli spirit from New-York back to Paris.
• The place welcomes you every day (except for Saturdays) in its cosy and warm space to interact with the flavours and tastes of an authentic and refined cooking.
• A successful combination of savour, ambience & design.
• Kahn reproduces the chic New York deli together with the French refinement, delicates gourmets flavours in a friendly and beautiful setting.

column1:
2298,Guest,"

A gourmet break sitting in Ternes Avenue.

column2: • As the name suggest, Guest has everything to make you feel like a star: a royal decoration with gold and coffee colours, a modern and chic design, sumptuous and magical environment, that will take you, in your tasting time, to another world.
• For your lunch break, Guest have a lot of solutions for eating on the run and remaining classy by concocting toasted sandwiches, salads, sushi, and daily specials.
•  Offers a delicious and generous menu at a very affordable price for a refined Shabbat.
• Has a parking valet.

• For more than 15 years, Le Manhattan has been appreciated for its homemade cuisine and varied daily menus. You will be welcomed by Mélanie and Joelle.
• Starter + main course + dessert: 15 €. The dish of the day: 11,50 €.
• Le Manhattan has a varied menu full of amazing dishes of the day, French or Oriental.
<li>Available meals for takeaway on Shabbat is 38 € for 2 people:
• 4 kemias options.
• 2 couscous beef / balls.
• 1/4 of wine.
• 2 small halots.
• 2 fruit salads.
• Discover the incredible ""pack kemias"" at 20 € for 10 salads of Shabbat!
• Catering services available.

<li>Whether you're in Paris or in the suburbs, there's bound to be a Nina Sushi near you or ready to deliver! Here are other locations:

column2: • The Safrane restaurant invites you to an experience in a luxury setting in the heart of Paris.

• Inspired by saffron, the Safrane restaurant invites you to an experience in a luxury setting in the heart of Paris. In terms of cuisine, no compromises, our Indian chef has managed for over 10 years the stoves of ""Kohinoor"", the most famous Indian restaurant in Jerusalem.
• The whole concepts revolves around an indian kosher menu.

• The menu is an overview of the best dishes of North and South India which will let you can discover India most emblematic specialties. You will be able to discover starters like the the ""momos"" ( steamed ravioli stuffed with meat or vegetables ), traditional ""naan"" breads, , authentic tandoor dishes, tasty curries, appetizing ""biryani"" ...

14433,Bassar Restaurant,"

Bassar Restaurant owner, Benjamin, with over 15 years of experience in Kosher cuisine.

column2: • The appearance of the restaurant is charming for its visitors, a mixture of contemporary and vintage, adequate lighting and the most attractive: Its wall of butterflies.
• The place is described as comfortable, they can accommodate up to 73 seats, they have XXL velvet armchairs, so that customers feel at home.
• Bassar offers a specialized traditional cuisine with titles that flourish in the terroir: ""bone marrow"", fried mushrooms with parsley juice "","" veal puree and truffle ""
• The menu includes many more daring dishes, such as ""the herb-flavoured pepper carpaccio,"" the pistachio-crusted chicken escalope and aniseed carrot puree ""or"" chicken teriyaki pasta "".
• They offer pizzettas. His recipes are highlighted with original compositions: ""pizzetta with fried beef and barbecue sauce"" or ""pizzetta with lamb goulash and black truffle cream"".
• You can make your private events, with prior notice.
• You can see the full menu here.
• You can contact them here.
• Also, in their web site you have the option to book a table.

column1:
13442,Les Kiffeurs,"

Casual restaurant with varied menu. Seating available outside.

column2: • Glatt restaurant.
• This place has a large menu with an option for everyone, salads, pitas, falafels, burgers, and pasta.
• Serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Drinks and desserts.
• Good location, dine on the sidewalk.
• Located 1 mile east of downtown Marseille.
• Heschcher.
• This place is permanently closed.

column1:
1644,Nina Sushi Saint-Mandé,"

Kosher sushi chain of restaurants.

column2: • Since 2001, Nina Sushi offers a classic range of sushi in harmony with the new trends.
• At Nina Sushi, they also innovate in the way to order! Download the free Iphone Nina Sushi app and call the restaurant directly to order.
<li>Whether you're in Paris or in the suburbs, there's bound to be a Nina Sushi near you or ready to deliver! Here are other locations:
• Nina Sushi Voltaire.
• Nina Sushi Saint Didier.
• Nina Sushi Villiers.
• Nina Sushi Montparnasse.
• Nina Sushi Neuilly.
• Nina Sushi Levallois.
• Nina Sushi Boulogne.

column2: • Its owner wanted to pay tribute to his grandmother from Roma by opening this authentic ""Bistrattoria"" located in the 12th arrondissement of Paris.
• From the antipasti to the pizza, pasta and other dishes, come and discover a generous and tasty cuisine prepared every day in the restaurant.
• Meals based on fresh and quality products coming directly from Rungis.
• Between Rome and Paris, there is now only one step separating them and it is called 'Nonna Rita'.

column1:
13970,Le 26,"

Casual and contemporary environment. Seating available outside.

column2: • Glatt.
• The 26th is a Glatt Kosher brewery under the strict supervision of the Rabbinate of Grenoble. The establishment offers a resolutely modern and varied cuisine.
• Casual environment, serves breakfast, lunch, dinner, drinks, and coffee.
• Catering services, good for groups and families with children.
• Seating available outside.
• Located half a mile walk from downtown Grenoble.

13101,Shawarma City,"

Shawarma shop. Dine in or takeaway.

column2: • Meat.
• Small shawarma spot, also offering hot dogs and hamburgers.
• Cozy and friendly environment, good for family or groups.
• Located 1 mile southeast of downtown Marseille.
• Heschcher.
• This place is permanently closed.

column1:
13532,Le 49 Street,"

Cozy and contemporary decoration. Takeaway available.

column2: • Glatt deli restaurant.
• The founders of Le 49 Street are passionate about fresh and quality catering. Inspired by the Delis that make the reputation of New York or Los Angeles whilst keeping their French Touch.
• They work with butchers who make culinary traditions famous throughout Europe and have selected products that you will not find elsewhere.
• All preparations are homemade, from sandwiches to salads and desserts.
• Casual and friendly environment. Good for groups, family or solo dining.
• Located 1 mile south of downtown Nice.
• Heschcher.
• Small and friendly Glatt falafel kiosk.
• No seating available so eat standing or takeaway.
• Located 2 miles south of downtown Marseille.
• Heschcher.
• Glatt.
• Opened 25 years ago and since the family owners select and accompany you the best meats. With a butchers know-how, they choose for you the best pieces and grill them charcoal.
• Cozy and casual serves lunch and dinner.
• Located less than 2 miles towards the north from downtown Marseille.
• Heschcher.
• This place is permanently closed.
• Dairy.
• Traditional pizzeria, takeaway and delivery only, no seating available.
• Located 2 miles southeast of downtown Marseille.
• hechsher.

13957,La Fabrique à Miam,"

Family-friendly restaurant. Casual environment.

column2: •  Restaurant offering fish and dairy products.
• Casual, family-friendly place with seating available outside.
• French cuisine, pizzas, and vegetarian options. Serves lunch and dinner.
• Takes reservations and is good for groups.
• Located a mile and a half walk south of downtown Strasbourg.
• Heschcher.

column1:
13526,Le Kirenet,"

Cozy, home-style deli. Catering and takeaway services available.

column2: • Glatt restaurant.
• Since 1997, Le Kineret is at the heart of the Jewish community of Nice, as restaurant, caterer, but also bakery and pastry specialists.
• Whether for buffets, a Shabbat or your receptions, they will be there to ensure you a nice meal.
• Deli, salads, bread and pastries. Nice decoration, casual environment.
• Takeaway services available.
• Located 1 mile south of downtown Nice.
• Heschcher.

13448,Au Falafel,"

Cozy, casual Israeli menu and vegetarian options.

column2: • Glatt restaurant.
• This place offers an Israeli menu with vegetarian options.
• Cozy, friendly and casual.  Good for family and groups.
• Located 2 miles southeast of downtown Marseille.
• Heschcher.

column1:
2062,Carmel Délice,"

Sandwiches and Israeli cuisine all in one place.

column2: • Carmel Délice offers all the Israeli specialities. From falafel from Northern Israel to shawarma parguit, from the hummus plate to the olive oil and turkey shawarma.
• You can find different types of bread: pita, baguette and laffa. The laffas are handmade on site to offer you an optimal freshness.
• In order to meet the repeated demands of our customers, Carmel Délice offers vegetarian falafel as well as different vegetarian sandwiches.

column1:
1630,Nina Sushi Levallois,"

Kosher sushi chain of restaurants.

column2: • Since 2001, Nina Sushi offers a classic range of sushi in harmony with the new trends.
• At Nina Sushi, they also innovate in the way to order! Download the free Iphone Nina Sushi app and call the restaurant directly to order.
<li>Whether you're in Paris or in the suburbs, there's bound to be a Nina Sushi near you or ready to deliver! Here are other locations:
• Nina Sushi Voltaire.
• Nina Sushi Saint Didier.
• Nina Sushi Villiers.
• Nina Sushi Saint-Mandé.
• Nina Sushi Boulogne.
• Nina Sushi Montparnasse.
• Nina Sushi Neuilly.

column1:
2118,Wang's,"

Great restaurant located at Porte de Charenton.

column2: • This restaurant will put your taste buds to travel all around the world thanks to its various specialities.

• Wang's will take you to Japan with its traditional sushi in all its forms. It will also take you to China, with its traditional Chinese appetisers. Finally, it will take you to the Middle-East for your grill cravings.
• They offer 4 kinds of lunch menu and an attractive student one.
• For on time delivery, we suggest you to order before 12.30pm and 7.30pm for dinner.
• Open on Saturday after Shabbath.
• Dairy. Parve.
• Bakery with products made from a yeast-leavened dough in a manner similar to bread or from puff pastry, giving them a richer, sweeter character, approaching that of pastry.
• Seating available.
• Located 3 miles northeast of downtown Marseille.
• Heschcher.

column1:
13390,Ago Paris,"

Italian and Japanese menu. Good for families with children.

column2: • Dairy. Parve.
• This place specialises in Italian and Japanese food.
• Seating available outside and inside.
• Modern and contemporary decoration.
• Good for families with children, and groups.
• Located 3.6 miles walking north from Notre Dame.
• Heschcher.
• This restaurant makes ""pure butter"" breakfast Halav Israel (pastries, pancakes, confectionery, cheesecake, etc).
• Chez Akol also offers you lunch on site or takeaway pizzas, paninis, salads, sandwiches, and more.
• Catering services available.

column1:
1590,O'Woks Levallois,"

One of the very first hidden chains of Kosher sushi.

column2: • The success of O'Woks is due to strict control of the raw materials: traceability of the fish, compliance with food safety standards, daily supplies, preparation of products at the order, etc.
• Compliance with all these requirements allows O'Woks to offer you products with a freshness and an optimal quality.
<li>The public has not been mistaken and for 10 years, O'Woks has been expanding constantly with its 4 establishments in Ile de France:
• O'Woks 19th.
• O'Woks 11th.
• O'Woks 17th.
• O'Woks delivers to you in many boroughs and in some suburbs (consult the zones of delivery and minimums of order).

• They offer an ultra-full Japanese menu in which the whole range of sushi is represented with a wide range of dishes (sushi and makis and classics, californias surrounded by avocado, salmon, turkey, and more).
• The restaurant also offers a Chinese food menu with many Asian specialities (spring rolls, sautéed noodles and rice, caramelised chicken or cashew nuts, beef basil, and more).

column1:
13312,Chez Jackinot,"

Family-style and casual restaurant. Contemporary decoration.

column2: • Glatt restaurant and butchery.
• Lunch and dinner only.
• Takeaway and delivery services available.
• Casual environment, contemporary decoration.
• Suitable for families.
• Located 2 miles south of downtown Marseille.
• Heschcher.
• Did we miss anything? Let us know in the comments below!
• Have you been here before? Share your tips with us!
• Are you the owner? Claim your listing!

column1:
13129,Le Toaster Bar,"

Cozy and casual burger bar.

column2: • Glatt restaurant.
• Le Toaster Bar offers burgers, sandwich, and salads, in a fast food style.
• Casual, friendly environment. Good for groups and late night dining.
• Located 2 miles south of downtown Marseille.
• Heschcher.
• Dairy.
• This place offers Italian fresh food & fine French cuisine. Their pasta is all produced in their own pasta workshops and according to their own recipes, authentic and traditional.
• They have vegetarian options on their menu.
• Cozy, casual and family friendly.
• Located at a 2 miles walk north of downtown Strasbourg.
• Heshcher.

column1:
14429,Aroma Kosher,"

Specialized cuisine with a wide menu.

column2: • Aromas Kosher is not only characterized by its homemade pizzas, but also by its warm and friendly atmosphere.
• You can see the antipasti menu here.
• Savour their variety of pizzas and calzones, see the menu here.
• They offer bagels, paninis, burguers and chips. See the menu here.
• Different pasta and gratins options. Menu here.
• A variety of fish based recipes. You can see the menu here.
• In the menu of this restaurant you can also find a great choice of Japanese dishes that comply Kosher standards. See the menu here.
• And you cannot leave behind the delicious desserts, the full menu here.
• Delivery service. Ask for the shabbat meals service.
• Dairy.
• The hotel restaurant offers Kosher pizzas of all kinds, pasta dishes, and various salads. They have a panel of Italian desserts to be enjoyed by big and small.
• The restaurant has a terrace to enjoy the sun on sunny days and a patio for smokers.
• Join the Kosher restaurant for a full Sabbath, seminar, Bar Mitzvah or other events.

• Their team cooks for you a custom-made Shabbat meal, you can place your order from Monday to Thursday, as soon as it is ready we contact you to pick it up! Friday night: 58€ and Saturday meals: 55€.

14439,Burger Delight,"

Nice place serving lunch and dinner.

column2: • Burger Delight is characterized by the variety on their menu; they offer burgers, hot dogs and also bagles. Good service and friendly staff.
• BD Offers take out, delivery and waiter Service.
• Good portions and good prices.
• Ask for the dessert of the day.
• Here you can see the burgers full menu with their sauces and supplements.
• The bagels are served with French fries; also you can choose a sauce and other complement. You can see the Bagels menu here.
• Here you have a mixed menu.
• You can choose your favorite salad here.
• Complete your meal whit a drink.
• You can contact them for your event. Make order 24h in advance.

column2: • The success of O'Woks is due to strict control of the raw materials: traceability of the fish, compliance with food safety standards, daily supplies, preparation of products at the order, etc.
• Compliance with all these requirements allows O'Woks to offer you products with a freshness and an optimal quality.
<li>The public has not been mistaken and for 10 years, O'Woks has been expanding constantly with its 4 establishments in Ile de France:
• O'Woks 11th.
• O'Woks Levallois.
• O'Woks 17th.
• O'Woks delivers to you in many boroughs and in some suburbs (consult the zones of delivery and minimums of order).

• They offer an ultra-full Japanese menu in which the whole range of sushi is represented with a wide range of dishes (sushi and makis and classics, californias surrounded by avocado, salmon, turkey, and more).
• The restaurant also offers a Chinese food menu with many Asian specialities (spring rolls, sautéed noodles and rice, caramelised chicken or cashew nuts, beef basil, and more).
• This restaurant is permanently closed.
• This place is permanently closed.

Israeli eat in and take away restaurant. In house party room available.

6689,Bonjour Bakery & Patisserie,"

Friendly and welcoming bakery with tables on the sidewalk.

column2: • All products are Pas Yisrael and milk products used are Chalav Yisrael.
• At Bonjour Bakery & Patisserie friendly and welcoming staff will be there to spoil you with breads, desserts and ready made cakes, with coffee to top it off.
• Seat in and takeaways are available.
• Located at Brent Street, 9 miles north from the Big Ben.

6833,Kaifeng,"

Glatt Kosher Chinese Cuisine. Can host parties of up to 100 in the restaurant or deliver finest Glatt food to your choice of venue.

column2: • Glatt Meat restaurant.
• You can host a get-together of 4 to up to 100 people in the restaurant.
• Kaifeng has been working for more than 30 years and has tons of good reviews.
• Every kind of event can be catered for, such as: special days, celebrations, sheva brochot, engagements, pidyan ha ben, exam results, new employment, leaving do's, and chuppah.
• If you are in London, this place is a must. You can find it in Hendon, 8 miles north from the Big Ben.
• Classical Chinese decor, fascinating environment.
• For more information about the menu click here: Lunch and dinner.
• Booking & Take Away Hotline: 020 8203 7888.

6772,Orli´s Café,"

Casual bakery with tables on the sidewalk. Bread, bagels and more.

column2: • Dairy bakery and restaurant. Chalav Yisrael.
• Traditional bakery, catering for small and large parties, providing freshly baked goods, birthday cakes and food.
• Nice decor, friendly environment, with comfortable seats.
• They offer pizzas, bagels, sushi, coffee and drinks.
• Located at Hendon, 7 miles from the Big Ben, heading north.
• Plenty of good reviews.

6760,"Sami's Restaurant, Edgware","

Glatt Meat Restaurant, with a varied menu. Seats inside.

column2: • Glatt Meat Restaurant.
• Friendly and casual well-known restaurant, with three different locations in the city of London.
• This branch, in particular, has a wide variety on its takeaway menu. For more information click here.
• It is located at Hale Ln. Edgware, 12 miles north from the Big Ben.
• Plenty of good reviews.

column1:
6785,Novellino Restaurant,"

Italian food with subtle hints of flavours and styles from around the world. Private parties for up to 80 people.

column2: • Dairy Restaurant. Chalav Yisrael.
• Established in 2005, Novellino has been offering a large variety of styles and flavours, beautifully presented and at affordable prices.

• Apart from the Jewish Sabbath and festivals, Novellino Kosher Restaurant is open every day for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. It is also available to hire privately for any occasion and can cater to all events.
• Located at Golders Green Rd., 7 miles north from Big Ben.
• For more information about the menu, click here.

A steak house in London offering quality meat and trendy twists on much loved favourites.

column2: • Glatt Meat restaurant.
• Casual South American style grill. A fine place to enjoy quality meat with good service and ambience.
• Located at Golden Greens Rd., 7 miles north from the Big Ben.
• For more information about the menu, click here.

6743,Taboon,"

Casual restaurant with rustic decor, renowned for their pita bread and falafels.

column2: • Dairy Restaurant. Chalav Yisrael.
• Casual and friendly falafel and pita joint.
• The restaurant was refurbished after a fire accident and opened again for business.

9844,Tish Bar & Restaurant,"

A Kosher bar and restaurant serving European cuisine, opening 29th July 2018.

column2: • Glatt meat.
• Tish opens for breakfast at 7 am and serves small plates, main dishes and drinks throughout the day until late in the evening.

• The extensive all-day menu – delivered by Head Chef, John Ellison – offers a fantastic range of tasty options for any hour, best enjoyed with a handcrafted drink from the bar whilst enjoying the lovely dining room or lounging on the charming terrace.
• Taught to cook by his Hungarian-Jewish mother and grandmother, the menu includes some of David’s traditional family recipes, including Grandmother Anny’s famous Hungarian bean soup.
• A special Shabbat menu is served for Friday dinner and Saturday lunch. The restaurant also offers a children’s menu.
• Located in Belsize Park, 5 miles north of Big Ben, London, UK.
• For detailed information about their service times, please visit the reservations page.
• KLBD Kosher Certification.

4198,LChaim's Restaurant,"

Restaurant offering French baguettes, and more.

column2: • The Jewish community of Glasgow, Scotland now has for the first time a Glatt Kosher restaurant under the supervision of Lubavitch of Scotland Shluchim Rabbi and Mrs Chaim Jacobs and the West of Scotland Kashrus Commision.

• It is currently open every Tuesday and Thursday evening and by arrangement. This now makes it possible for hundreds of Jewish tourists that visit Scotland each year to enjoy a real exciting Kosher vacation.
• See the website for info about accommodation, Shuls, Kosher food, Golf and tours to whiskey distilleries. It’s Salt beef and Latkes are amongst its most popular items on its menu.
• When you walk into L’Chaim’s restaurant you are invited to dine in one of two candle-lit dining rooms each with their own decorative ambience.
• For more information click here.

6672,Crème de la Crème,"

Friendly and welcoming bakery, known as the UK’s truly authentic French Kosher patisserie.

column2: <li style=""list-style-type: none;"">
• All products are Pas Yisrael and dairy products used are Chalav Yisrael.
• Located at the Temple Fortune Parade, 9 miles north from the Big Ben.
• This place has been open for years and is very well known for its catering services.
• They have an extensive range of delicious French Patisserie, Croissants, Hand-made Chocolates, Ice Creams, and Sorbets.
• For more information about their menu and services, you can contact them directly here.

6666,Daniels Bagel Bakery,"

Casual and friendly bagel bakery with tables on the sidewalk.

column2: • All products are Pas Yisrael and dairy products used are Chalav Yisrael.
• They produce traditional and handmade products.
• Kosher bakery in London since 1989.
• They offer bread rolls, both sweet and savory, traditional challahs, filled sandwiches, pastries, cakes and well-known real bagels – plain or stuffed with fresh fillings.
• Counters display a wide selection of freshly cooked traditional foods, quiches, salads and many other vibrant desserts, and vegetarian portions.
• Located in North London, Hallswelle Parade, Finchley Road near Golders Green. 8 miles away from the Big Ben.
• For information about their Dairy, Parev or Meaty menus, click here.

6802,Mr. Baker,"

Cozy bakery and cafe. Tables on the sidewalk. Sushi Place.

column2: • Dairy bakery. Chalav Yisrael. Parev.
• Classic bakery and café that offers a wide selection of pastries, cakes, desserts, and organic coffee.
• Sushi joint.
• Located at Hendon, 7 miles north from Big Ben.
• Breakfast, deli, and dinners can be enjoyed. Takeaways available.

6926,Hendon Bagel Bakery,"

Self-service coffee shop and café with a bakery offering freshly baked breads and delicacies.

column2: • Dairy. Chalav Yisrael.
• Self-service coffee shop and café with a bakery offering freshly baked bread and delicacies.
• Located in Hendon, 8 miles away from the Big Ben, heading north.
• Their menu consists of salads, sandwiches, quiches, burekas, cream cakes, bagels, and bread.
• Established in 1983.
• You can contact them directly here.

New York style pizzeria and pasta restaurant, offering milkshakes and more.

column2: • Dairy restaurant. Chalav Yisrael.
• New York style pizzeria and pasta restaurant, offering milkshakes, soft serve ice creams, frozen yoghurts and much more.
• Located at Shenley Rd., 14 miles north from Big Ben.
• For more information about the menu, click here.
• You can contact them directly here.

12789,One Ashbourne,"

Modern, contemporary, european-style restaurant. Seating available inside.

column2: • Glatt Kosher restaurant.
• A brand new upscale restaurant in Golders Green, London.
• An upscale restaurant with a menu including beef ribs, chicken Milanese, seared sea bass, roasted duck breast, glazed halibut, coq au vin, and confit salmon, and more.
• Modern, european style, ""dressy"" environment.
• Check their menu here.
• Located 8 miles north of Big Ben.
• Heschcher.

6748,"Sami's Restaurant, Hendon","

Glatt Meat Restaurant, with a varied menu. Seats inside.

column2: • Glatt Meat Restaurant.
• Friendly and casual well-known restaurant, with three different locations in the city of London.
• This branch, in particular, has a wide variety on its takeaway menu. For more information click here.
• It is located at Brent St., 7  miles north from the Big Ben.
• Plenty of good reviews.

column1:
6676,Carmelli Bakeries,"

Traditional bakery serving the local Jewish community.

column2: • All products are Pas Yisrael and dairy products used are Chalav Yisrael.
• They offer traditional and innovative delights, and old favourites that you can enjoy anytime.
• Carmelli Bakeries is still baking their bagels by hand, faithfull to traditional methods.
• Products can be bought in store from a selection of hand-made items or can be pre-ordered with a tailor-made menu.
• Located at Golders Green Rd., 7 miles north from the Big Ben.
• Established in 1987.

6904,Burger Bar London,"

Indoor seated Burger Bar. Open for lunch and dinner.

column2: • Glatt Meat restaurant.
• Burger specialists with a selection of delicious sides.
• Tasty wraps, salads, and a kids menu.
• Located at Bridge L, 7 miles away from the Big Ben, heading north.
• For more information about the menu, click here.
• This place is permanently closed.

6934,Bagels Bar,"

Coffee store with seating available outside.

column2: • Dairy restaurant, Chalav Yisrael.
• Located at Brent St., 8 miles away from the Big Ben. Near to Hendon United Synagogue.
• Bagels Bar offers ice cream, milkshakes, deli, burgers, salads, and bagels are their offer. Takeout is available.
• Nice and friendly place, worth the visit if you are nearby.
• Shabbat orders! They are open until 4 pm on Friday and from 7 pm onwards on motzai shabbat.

Parisian atmosphere, with French paintings, dark wood floors and dim lighting.

column2: • Glatt meat restaurant.
• Located at Brent St, 7 miles north from the Big Ben.
• Well known for their great steaks and their European delicacy, foie gras.
• Eighty Six also has a variety of daily specials.
• 86 could be your lucky number if you are planning to visit the area.

2694,Las Tias Gourmet,"

Restaurant offering Sahbbat meals deliveries.

column2: • There is always plenty to choose from at Las Tias Gourmet.
• Fresh ingredients and rotating weekly selections help keep their menu colourful.
• They provide both food and service with care, and an attention to detail that will make your mealtime a delight.
• They have meat, dairy and parve products, from main dishes to different types of desserts.
• Las Tias also provide catering, food deliveries to hotel, shabbat meals, takeaway, and more.
• Email them at: lastias@lastias.cl.

2739,Carlos & Gabby's - Queens,"

Vibrant branch of a local chain dishing up Glatt Kosher Mexican dishes like burritos & nachos.

column2: • Carlos and Gabby’s in Queens is particularly well-situated on a quieter stretch of Main Street.
• Within walking distance of Queens College, the restaurant is a convenient stop on the way to the U.S. Open, a Mets game, or to enjoy a siesta from shopping along the hub of Kew Garden Hills.
• This is the third location of the successful Glatt Kosher Mexican grill chain. This jaunty and cheerful space is done up in spicy orange and brown tones, and accented with Mexican décor.
• The bright, spicy cuisine is served on multi-coloured striped tables.
• The crowd is a nice mixture of young students, 20’s and 30’s and families.  All are savouring the taste and flavor of authentic and affordable Mexican dishes.

• Recommended starters include their chicken zingers or buffalo fingers.  You can also find your favourite deli sandwiches and barbecue stalwarts, along with American fare done up in a Southwestern flair.
• Some of the lighter items includes chicken burgers and salads. There is a great kids menu for those that do not enjoy Mexican flavour quite yet.
• You can also create a champion taco combo: choose one of five varieties, customized with your pick of soft, crisp or soft-grilled shell.
• Or go for a signature sub packed with deli and barbecued meat, flame-grilled burger or jumbo potato with chili, vegetables, or steak strips.

• The service is friendly and efficient, a trademark of Carlos & Gabby’s restaurants. And if you find yourself craving Mexican fare late at night, it is good to know they are open late and ready to please you.
• For more information click here.
• Other locations: Carlos & Gabby's - Riverdale, Carlos & Gabby's - Miami, Carlos & Gabby's Long Island and Carlos & Gabby's - Coney Island.

4902,Sushi Tokyo (Queens),"

Late-night Kosher sushi restaurant showcasing creative speciality rolls & sushi, plus daily specials.

column2: • Inspired by the Brooklyn and Lawrence location of same name, the newest location of this chain restaurant in Queens, NY proves that same great food and atmosphere can travel all the way to Queens.
• Symbolic of Japan, their modern red, black and white decor follow a great fun theme giving young couples and their friends a place to enjoy.
• Their ambience is one of a mix between takeaway, and quick dine-in with comfortable booths and stools by their full sushi bar with lunch and dinner specials.
• For more information click here.
<li>Other locations:
• Sushi Tokyo (Kings Highway).
• Sushi Tokyo (Coney Island).
• Sushi Tokyo (Lawrence).

12662,Stix Kosher Restaurant,"

ASK YOUR RABBI IF CUP-K IS OK FOR YOU

column2: • ASK YOUR RABBI IF CUP-K IS OK FOR YOU.
• Heschcher: Rabbi Israel Mayer Steinberg of Vaad Harabonim Lameshmeret Hakashrut.
• We reached out to Rabbi Israel but couldn't get a hold of him.

• Stix Kosher Restaurant offers a Middle-Eastern style cuisine. Their menu will take you on a journey, from Bukhara, Israel, Uzbekistan, Turkey, Ukraine, and beyond. They specialise in kebabs, pilaf or samsas.
• Stix Kosher Restaurant has a casual environment, family-friendly and good for kids.
• Located in Queens, 12 miles east of downtown NYC.
• 360 View.

4918,MeO Japanese Hibachi,"

Restaurant with a futuristic setting.

column2: • Step into MeO Japanese Hibachi restaurant and be transported to a place both futuristic in style and modern in cuisine.
• The restaurant décor gives off a neon glow and ultra-cool vibe at night, unlike anything the Kosher Queens scene has had before.
• There is both Hibachi seating and regular seating, in case you’re just there for the food and not the show.
• Their sleek black leather chairs and floors give place a very modern, trendy look which may explain why the restaurant is frequented by celebrities.
• They have a large staff and owners Mike and Rafi are constantly walking the floor, keeping an eye on everything.
• The waitresses are very friendly while handing out a set of printed menus and an iPad with the entire menu of pictures.
• For more information click here.

2735,Cho-Sen Garden,"

Modest option in a strip-mall setting serving Kosher Chinese dishes plus kid-friendly bites.

column2: • Since 1990, owner Neil Wallin “chose” to start his Cho-Sen restaurant adventure in Forest Hills, Queens. He felt that the community would love a restaurant that was comfortable, friendly and would provide top-notch service with outstanding food. To put it simply, the neighbours are very happy.
• Centrally located in Forest Hills, Cho-Sen Garden is a few blocks from the LIE and Queens Boulevard, as well as a few minutes from Main Street and Union Turnpike.
• There is plenty of parking in front and to the sides of the restaurant.
• Decorated with Chagall-style paintings on teal coloured walls and cozy booths in the corners, this modern Asian restaurant has a full service cocktail bar in front and a full sushi bar in the back.
• The staff, led by general manager Michael Mo, is extremely warm and gracious, greeting every visitor personally and quite often, by name.
• As mentioned, Cho-Sen Garden is a neighbourhood institution and is an excellent and affordable choice for Chinese cuisine in Queens.
• The restaurant prepares everything with the freshest, top-of-the line quality meats, poultry, fish and vegetables.
• There are a number of choices including veal, chicken, beef, vegetarian, Japanese, and sushi dishes. Recommendations include House Special Lamb and Crisp Sea Bass.
• Cho-Sen Garden is also a great place to host parties and events for your families and organizations in their private room to the side.

• Cho-Sen Garden is a sure winner for anyone looking for superb food at reasonable prices.  It is a fine restaurant that you will want to visit often.  Indeed, after all these years, they are still the Cho-Sen “one”.
• For more information click here.
• Other locations: Cho-Sen Village & Cho-Sen Island.

<li>They have seven other locations:
• Lakewood.
• Baltimore.
• Lawrence Express.
• Lawrence.
• Clifton.
• Manhattan.
• Scarsdale.
• This place is permanently closed.

4907,Sushi Fussion (Forest Hills),"

Local sushi chain serving classic & creative rolls, plus fusion dishes, in a relaxed, stylish space.

column2: • Sushi Fussion is dedicated to offer the freshest and most artistic sushi to all of its clientele. Out of their one hundred items, there are a few that definitely need mentioning.
• The jumbo Zodiac Rolls all different, one for each sign are cut into ten pieces each. The XO Roll gives you a little sweet and a little spice with spicy salmon, mango, avocado, caviar, and salmon.
• Tickle Me Tuna Roll packs a lot of goodness: spicy tuna, avocado, soybean wrap, seared pepper tuna, with sweet & spicy sauce.
• To get out of the ordinary, enjoy a Tempura Sandwich which comes with salmon, avocado, kani and three sauces.
• Another big bite size treat is the Special Sandwich Roll filled with spicy salmon, spicy tuna, avocado topped with crunch and caviar.
• A fan favourite includes the Tokyo Roll: Tempura fried spicy salmon, tuna, avocado, and sweet & spicy sauce.
• For more information click here.
• Other locations: Sushi Fussion (Flushing) & Sushi Fussion (Great Neck).

2726,Elite Cafe,"

Relaxed, compact Kosher dairy spot offering everyday cafe fare & sushi, plus espresso drinks.

column2: • Elite Café, conveniently located on the popular Main Street in Flushing Queens, opened its doors in 2013.
• Ever since, the dairy cafe stands out amongst the many surrounding eateries.
• The décor is clean, neat, and unpretentious, yet appealing to the eye with interesting artwork on the walls.
• A great place to catch up with a friend, have a business meeting or enjoy any meal with the family.
• Owner Benjamin Haimoff, who resides both in the US and Israel, took over Elite Cafe in September 2016.
• He wanted to bring high quality dairy cuisine to Queens and creates all the menu items and recipes himself.
• The food cooked and served at Elite Café is the ideal combination of Israeli favourites with an American touch.
• For more information click here.

2714,Marani Georgian,"

Tranquil location offering classic Kosher Georgian specialities alongside unique cocktails & wine.

column2: • Marani is New York’s first authentic Kosher Georgian restaurant.
• In 2013 the owner, Ana, realised that the New York Kosher scene was sorely lacking some variation. She knew how delicious Georgian cuisine is, so she decided to share it with the world.
• While you may not be able to pronounce some of the names, every dish on their menu is expertly crafted to ensure your experience with Georgian cuisine is an unforgettable one.

• Start your meal off with the Pelmeni, a Georgian fried beef wonton topped with onions and vegetables or the Marani sampler, a choice of three Spinach with walnuts, green beans with walnuts, baby beet leaves with walnuts or red bean with walnuts which goes perfectly with the Shotis Puri, a Georgian bread.

• Move on to the Khinkhali, Georgian style dumplings filled with lamb, beef and herbs. Another entrée to try for an authentic Georgian taste you just can’t get anywhere else is the Chanaxi, beef braised with eggplants, potatoes and tomatoes, served in a clay pot.
• You simply cannot leave without trying their homemade Napoleon for dessert.
• Since “marani” means “wine cellar” in Georgian, Marani has a wide selection of wines, as well as beer and speciality cocktails.
• Located in Rego Park, a neighbourhood in Queens that has a significant Georgian and Russian Jewish population, Marani is a must-try.
• The simple but elegant blue and wooden décor is as aesthetically pleasing as their beautifully plated food.
• Marani also has a small dairy section in the basement, where they serve Khachapuri, a cheese-filled bread, and other Georgian dairy delights.
• For more information click here.

3045,Holy Schnitzel (Queens),"

Kosher fast-food joint offering a wide range of casual eats, including burgers, salads & schnitzels.

column2: • In each of their locations they greet their customers the same friendly and warm way.
• The chain was started by a brother and sister team Ofeer & Sivan Benaltaba, who opened two other successful locations in Staten Island (in 2008) and the Five Towns (2011).
• Fast-food restaurant offering an American-Mediterranean menu.
• Fresh food and friendly ambience.
• Healthy options at affordable prices.
• For more information click here.
<li>Other locations:
• Holy Schnitzel (Cedarhurst).
• Holy Schnitzel (Staten Island).
• Holy Schnitzel in Brooklyn and Lakewood is CLOSED.

10785,Citi Field Kosher Food,"

Kosher stand at the Home Stadium of the Mets Baseball Team.

column2: • Meat restaurant.
• Kosher food including hot dogs, knishes, pretzels, etc. are available at Citi Field.
• These foods can be purchased near Sections 115 and 130 on the Field Level as well as Section 408 on the Promenade Level.
• The Kosher stands operate Sunday - Thursday.
• Located in the Home Stadium of the Mets Baseball Team. 10 miles by car east of Manhattan.
• KOF-K Heschcher.

4897,Bistro Burger,"

Kosher, neighbourhood nook offering gourmet burgers, sides & other sandwiches along with beer & wine.

column2: • Great Neck residents who fondly remember Bistro Grill, a French steakhouse that closed in 2011 after a decade of success, can now rejoice since Serge and Yardena Gorge are back in the neighbourhood with their upscale burger bar, aptly named Bistro Burger.

• Since its opening in December 2013, the restaurant has already gained a following with both families and a younger crowd, including students from local schools, for whom they offer $8 student specials from 10 am to 3 pm.
• It has also been featured in New York Times as one of the selected Long Island restaurants to serve “classy burgers in relaxed settings”.
• The contemporary bright décor in yellow, orange and grey colours, adds to the youthful vibe and casual atmosphere of the place.
• The restaurant features an open kitchen, offering a view of how their homemade dishes are being created.
• The seating is the combination of chairs and cushioned booths, with some outdoor seating in the front in the summer.
• Bistro Burger also has a liquor license for wine and beer and can accommodate private parties for up to 50 people.
• For more information click here.

2926,Carlos & Gabby's - Long Island,"

Kosher Mexican grill with a varied menu of traditional fare in a casual, colourful setting.

column2: • In 2006, Carlos & Gabby's opened their original Cedarhurst location - a modest shop on Rockaway Turnpike near the Long Island Rail Road crossing. It wasn't glamorous, or spacious (they have since moved to their new location - see below).

• Unlike their Kosher-Mexican predecessors, Carlos & Gabby's managed to combine a delicious and extensive menu of Mexican favourites, fused with a handful of American classics... not to mention all those great sauces (Tangy BBQ, Avocado Ranch, Creamy Caesar, Mmmm!).
• This culinary excellence, combined with reasonable prices, turned Carlos & Gabby's into so much more than a novelty. In fact, it has now become a landmark on the map of eateries in the area.
• Despite the coincidence, it is not named after two actors from a television show but after a famous restaurant in Mexico, called Carlos & Charlies.
<li>Other locations:
• Carlos & Gabby's - Coney Island.
• Carlos & Gabby's - Queens.
• Carlos & Gabby's - Riverdale.
• Carlos & Gabby's - Miami.

4739,Mountain Top Steakhouse at Chalet Hotel,"

    Open during summer only

column2: • Executive Chef Chaim Levi has created an excellent menu with trendy dishes Sous Vide meats, chicken and waffles, and specials that change daily.
• Call in advance for reservations at (845) 434-5124. They are open for dinner Sunday through Thursday, 5PM-11PM. Mountain Top is under the supervision of Rabbi Shmiel Berger (Mishkoltz Rav).

4807,Fireside,"

A bistro specialising in amazing appetisers, burgers & steaks.

column2: • Established in the summer of 2015, Fireside is a steakhouse located in the Evergreen Shopping Market.
• Upon entering you will walk into a multi-level modern space, with a fireplace at the entrance of the restaurant.
• Its dim lighting allows it to be classy, but its diverse menu assures that it still has a family-friendly atmosphere.
• You will enjoy a selection of well-seasoned foods with a large variety of appetisers, sandwiches, and classic entrees and steaks.
• Renowned Chef Alexander Remer has worked under Chef Seth warshaw at Etc. Steakhouse, as well as many other Kosher restaurants throughout his years.
• He was then invited to be the executive chef at Fireside, where he has been creating amazing dishes that keeps diners constantly returning for more.
• Chef Remer’s goal is to cook using ingredients that he would eat solo, and to combine classical techniques with the kind of “provincial” fare he ate in his youth.
• For more information click here.

column2: • Dougie's BBQ & Grill is an American Jewish original; the United States only Kosher barbeque food chain. Dougie's serves popular cuisine as Kosher as it is American.
• Burgers and steaks, salads and soft drinks, hot dogs and fries, deli sandwiches and onion rings, wraps and laugh-it-up good times with family and friends, Dougie's got it all.
• Other locations: Dougie's BBQ Teaneck and Dougie's Baltimore.

13611,Pizza'Le,"

Traditional pizzeria. Takeaway and delivery services available.

column2: • Dairy.
• Traditional pizzeria where you can dine in, order to takeaway or call for delivery.
• Casual environment, good for family and kids.

4849,Eden Wok Westchester,"

Storefront venue offering basic, Glatt Kosher sushi & Asian dishes with a Monday night buffet.

column2: • Eden Wok’s signature brand of Chinese, Japanese and Asian fusion has made it a dining (and delivery/takeout/catering) destination for almost two decades.
• Their easily accessible Westchester location is just 20 minutes from White Plains, NY and Stamford, CT.
• With a combination of “made fresh to order” quality, innovative menu items and the welcoming warmth and ambience, owner/manager Josh Berkowitz infuses into every dining experience.
• It's easy to understand why Eden Wok’s “regulars” feel it’s worth the trip from Manhattan, Monsey, Riverdale & North Jersey (to name but a few).

• Whilst other venues would be scared to “rock the boat”, Josh, in his ongoing quest to “raise the bar” worked with Executive Chef Ming to develop one of the first Kosher Thai menus in the US. Chef Ming- a graduate of the Culinary Arts School of Malaysia, rose to the challenge by creating/adapting a full range of Thai favourites.
• For more information click here.

2869,Prime Bistro,"

Elevated French fare served in a classic, sophisticated setting with banquette seating & a cozy bar.

column2: • A butcher and a high-end French steakhouse. Glatt Kosher.
• Refined dining area and two private rooms for 30-60 people.
• Meat is aged at their aging room.
• Full bar experience.
• Reservation recommended.

2917,Cho-Sen Island,"

Casual spot offering Kosher Chinese & Japanese classics, including sushi.

column2: • After a successful start in Queens, it made perfect sense for owner Neil Wallin to show the Long Island residents how good Chinese food can be.

• Since the year 1990 and still going strong, the restaurant has much to offer for your dining pleasure in their newly renovated dining room, as well as for special occasions in their spacious party room upstairs.
• Every detail from the moment you walk in the door to your final sip of tea, has been considered and perfectly planned.
• Other locations: Cho-Sen Village and Cho-Sen Garden.

4880,Colbeh - Roslyn,"

Persian restaurant serving kebabs, dips & other traditional dishes in an elegant setting.

column2: • There should be a Colbeh in every town and soon enough, there may be. But in the meantime, Colbeh has followed its success in Great Neck, Queens and Manhattan by opening another fine restaurant in the town of Roslyn Heights.
• Conveniently located off the Long Island Expressway (Exit 37) and Northern Parkway West (Exit 28), Colbeh is the furthest Kosher restaurant out East in Long Island.
• This is, indeed, good news to all the Kosher diners living in Hicksville, Syosset, Plainview and surrounding areas, which had a much farther drive to a Kosher restaurant than now.
• The elegance and exquisite ambience of this new restaurant is among the best on Long Island. Tall tapered candles on each table radiate a soft glow and live piano music adds to the romantic mood.
• Pink brocade tablecloths and handmade napkins are the backdrop for the fine silver service that adorns the tables.

• Burgundy drapes over French windows, comfortable upholstered chairs, walls covered with lush fabric, oil paintings on heavy gold frames, graceful brass chandeliers, a wood burning fireplace and a handsome bar complete the formal decor.
• For more information click here.
• Other locations: Colbeh - Great Neck & Colbeh - Manhattan.

• Lawrence.

• Clifton.
• Manhattan.

column2: • Thyme & Tonic is a gastropub serving fresh produce and vegetable dishes.
• The menu is primarily vegan, with dairy, organic eggs, and fresh fish in select dishes.
• The menu is gluten free and most dishes do not contain nuts.

column1:
4873,Sushi Fussion (Great Neck),"

Unfortunately, this business closed due to the COVID-19 Pandemic.
Local sushi chain serving classic & creative rolls, plus fusion eats, in a relaxed, stylish space.

column2: • Sushi Fussion came about when its two owners decided to bring a variety of delicious and affordable sushi to New York clientele and added an “s” to Fussion to give it some “s”tyle.
• They opened two locations in Queens in 2011, followed by the sit-down restaurant in Great Neck in April 2012, and the newest sushi bar in Manhattan in February 2014.
• While all locations are dedicated to offering spectacular-looking sushi creations, the Great Neck location also offers Hibachi and Yakitori Japanese meat and chicken dishes on their menu.
• The menu blends well with the Japanese-inspired décor of the restaurant in red tones, with mahogany furniture and Japanese paintings on the walls.
• For more information click here.
• Other locations: Sushi Fussion (Forest Hills) & Sushi Fussion (Flushing).

4892,Cho-Sen Village,"

This casual restaurant serving Kosher Chinese food & sushi is closed Friday until sundown Saturday.

column2: • Cho-Sen Village, the third installment in the Chinese takeover of the Queens and Long Island area by restaurateur Neil Wallin, has completed its first year to rave reviews by the people of Great Neck.
• They are busy, not only because they are the only Chinese restaurant in town, but because they make everyone's experience a memorable one.
• This colourful and stylish restaurant, decorated by Neil's wife, Bucky, boasts a large private dining room as well as a private party room to the side and a VIP dining area.
• They also have a full service drink and sushi bar. For your convenience, there is ample parking in the municipal parking lot next door.
• The master chef of all three restaurants is Chef Cheng. Born in Taiwan, he has worked for the last 30 years with Glatt Kosher Asian cuisine.
• When Neil opened up Cho-Sen Garden, he became Head Chef and is now approaching his 16th year.

• His cooking style is a fusion of traditional Cantonese, Mandarin, Szechuan and Japanese, which has earned him the Queensboro President's Award as well as the Governor Pataki Community Service Award.

• Chef Cheng has now brought a delightful Chinese cuisine to Great Neck that artfully surpasses guests' expectations. At Cho-Sen Village be prepared to experience traditional Chinese fare at its best.
• For more information click here.

2884,Holy Schnitzel (Cedarhurst),"

Kosher fast-food joint offering a wide range of casual eats, including burgers, salads & schnitzels.

column2: • In each of their locations they greet their customers the same friendly and warm way.
• The chain was started by a brother and sister team Ofeer & Sivan Benaltaba, who opened two other successful locations in Staten Island (in 2008) and the Five Towns (2011).
• Fast-food restaurant offering an American-Mediterranean menu.
• Fresh food and friendly ambience.
• Healthy options at affordable prices.
• For more information click here.
<li>Other locations:
• Holy Schnitzel (Staten Island).
• Holy Schnitzel (Queens).
• Holy Schnitzel in Brooklyn and Lakewood is.

13621,David´s Famous Pizza,"

Dairy Cholov Yisroel Traditional Pizza Store

column2: • Dairy Cholov Yisroel Pizza Store.

• David's Famous Pizza and Borekas is the most popular Kosher Pizza Restaurant in the Five Towns amongst children, teens, and adults. Everybody Loves Dave's!!! Featuring Pizza, Falafel, Bourekas, Salads, Fish, Pasta and so much more.
• Casual environment, family-friendly. Seating available, takeouts and delivery.
• Located 8 miles southwest of JFK International Airport.
• Heschcher.

24701,J-Joe Berrylicious,"A cafe serving smoothies, fro-yo, pizza, paninis, and more, is the latest kosher establishment in the region, opening in White Plains, NY.

column2: • Berrylicious is a great kid-friendly spot to grab brunch or lunch. With offerings ranging from waffles to egg and cheese bagels to a tuna melt panini, everyone will find something to enjoy. Moreover, who doesn’t love having lunch and dessert under one roof? Self-serve fro-yo is just steps away from your table at Berrylicious.
• Berrylicious is located at 55 Church St, White Plains, NY. It is kosher certified by Rabbi Chaim Marder of the Hebrew Institute of White Plains.Berrylicious is open daily 8am-8pm

20768,Siena,"Siena Ristorante Bar is a fine Kosher Italian restaurant, which brings the best of Italy to the Gravesend section of Brooklyn. This neighborhood restaurant offers house-made pasta, pizzas, whole-grilled fish, and seasonal vegetable sides. The cuisine is complemented by an extensive kosher wine and premium liquor offerings.

Brick-oven pizza & wide-ranging Italian dishes are the draw at this family-friendly Kosher eatery.

column2: • Upper Crust, a popular Italian restaurant first opened its doors in the Cedarhurst neighbourhood in March 2012 and it hasn’t stopped swinging.
• Nestled between a bank and a stationary store right in the middle of Central Avenue, Upper Crust is a perfect lunch spot upon completion of your errands.
• The owner decided to open up this upper class pizza store as a change from the regular fast food venues.
• With a pizza maker from Sicily and the head chef from Verona, a city near Milan, you are guaranteed high quality authentic Italian cuisine.
• Their modern decor, featuring classy booths and regular seating options with paintings and mirrored walls, will enhance the fine dining experience.
• Upper Crust's pizza is currently the first and only Kosher brick oven style pizza available in Cedarhurst, and they offer many different selections to choose from.

• The ""Melanzana"" made with eggplant Milanese, fire-roasted tomato, mozzarella cheese, and fresh basil is suitable for just about anyone, and there's the ""Santa Fe"" which is made with spicy marinara sauce, mozzarella cheese, pepper jack, taco crumble, ricotta, and jalapeno peppers, an option that will knock your socks off.
• The ingredients are always fresh, and there's plenty of personal attention for your every order- so you will feel that your pizza has been designed just for you.
• For more information click here.

column2: • Eighteen offers more dining options by offering a wide range of delicious meals at great prices in a beautiful setting for your family.
• Main courses include sushi pizza, Yemeni soup, Moroccan cigars, fried cauliflower and artichokes, fresh Mediterranean salads, kebab bar, and premium beef burgers.
• Eighteen Restaurant is Glatt Kosher;under OK Kosher certification and supervision.

4796,Kosher Castle,"

Fast-food restaurant offering a varied selection, including American, Chinese & Mexican fare.

column2: • Yanky Grunzweig and Tuly Buchinger always wanted to have their own restaurant.  But first they had to make sure that would be the right restaurant, a place that people would enjoy and have fun.

• In the early part of 2006, everything came together. When they decided to open up Kosher Castle, Yanky and Tuly understood that the neighbourhood, which is populated with large families, needed a family-oriented, no-frills, reasonably priced establishment.
• With fast service, a clean environment and terrific food, they have fulfilled that need with local residents and businesses flocking every day.
• Kosher Castle is conveniently located on Route 59 in a large shopping mall where parking is never a problem.

• The casual restaurant is spacious and the ideal locale for families to bring their kids.  Yet because of their large, varied and, most of all, tasty menu, couples and singles have been frequenting as well.
• Whether it's savoury Chinese (they do not use MSG), their famous deli or an entree from their charbroil grill, with over one hundred menu items there's something for everyone.
• The food is fresh and flavourful. Yanky is highly experienced in the Kosher restaurant industry, so he knows what it takes to run a restaurant and what it means to make the customer happy.
• For more information click here.

column2: • The word “doma” translates loosely to “house or dwelling” in Russian and Latin, and is evident in the design of the space. Each area resembles one’s home and offers the most intimate dining experience.
• The swank atmosphere is illuminated with hundreds of Edison lightbulbs, whilst walls are adorned with bright and stimulating pieces from the collection of rising pop artist, Elizabeth Sutton.

• Executive Chef Oscar Martinez sweeps guests away on an epicurean adventure whilst manning the Grillworks Infierno wood grill. High-end cuts of USDA-grade meat are dry-aged in-house and sushi is hand-rolled to order.
• Desserts are amazing in both taste and presentation.
• Check their Facebook page for more details.

3484,Chop Chop,"

Classic Chinese dishes & sushi with Kosher modifications, all served in a colourful space.

column2: • Glatt Kosher restaurant.
• Open since March 2010, Chop Chop is an excellent fast-food Chinese and Sushi restaurant in the “Heights” of Manhattan.
• Whilst located uptown in Washington Heights, across the street from Yeshiva University, they deliver to anywhere in Manhattan, Riverdale and parts of New Jersey.
• The stylish interior is colourful and animated - no wonder the chef's name is Sunny. Owned by the Rutta Family from Scranton, PA & NYC, the menu is a mix of Szechuan, Cantonese and Asian Fusion.

• The house specialities include: “Mongolian Beef,” - sliced beef with green & red peppers, onions in a sweet and spicy brown sauce; “Spanish Salmon” - grilled salmon with scallions and fresh ginger in a brown sauce.

• Dishes are easily made to the individuals' taste. On the sushi side, the Chop Chop Roll of spicy tuna, cucumber and sweet potato tempura with avocado on top is an outstanding choice as well as the Sleeping Beauty roll which consists of Cajun salmon & avocado inside, spicy salmon, and a crunchy outside.
• The restaurant offers private parties on premises and off-site with great expertise. There are also special Shabbat packages for takeaway and Sunday nights feature live jazz music.
• Any chinese food or sushi craving you may have as well as any event, Chop Chop is sure to satisfy.

column2: • Seasons is a Kosher supermarket that invites you to shop for a wide variety of gourmet Kosher foods available at their stores. Including online shopping and delivery
• They offer Kosher grocery and gourmet food, fresh meat and fish, deli, bakery, fresh fruits and vegetables, dairy, yoghurt, cheese, ice cream, and more.
<li>They have seven other locations:
• Lakewood.
• Baltimore.
• Lawrence Express.
• Queens.
• Clifton.
• Manhattan.
• Scarsdale.

column1:
4886,Colbeh - Great Neck,"

Adventurous Kosher Persian dishes served in plentiful portions in a vibrant contemporary setting.

column2: • Founded in 1983, Pejman Toobian, owner and mastermind of Colbeh, has been able to rapidly turn the restaurant franchise into a renowned hot spot for both locals and tourists alike.
• When one enters Colbeh, they are immediately whisked away into a Persian journey that starts with the elegant, yet welcome decor.
• Lively and festive, with Persian music playing in the background, Colbeh adds a touch of class with towering arrangements of fresh cut flowers and tall candles glowing on the tables.
• Plush burgundy carpeting and subdued lighting complete the scene in their two dining rooms.
• For more information click here.
• Other locations: Colbeh - Manhattan & Colbeh - Roslyn.

The meals we serve at Chow Down are the freshest ingredients, with the finest herbs and spices. Our basic recipes, which are Glatt Kosher Chinese and Japanese Cuisines, were handed down from generations and have been improved and enhanced to bring out the best possible flavors.

2907,Cork & Slice,"

Rustic-chic locale offering artisanal pizza & pasta, plus craft beers on tap, wine & cocktails.

column2: • Walk into Cork & Slice, and it's like you have just stepped into a five star restaurant in the heart of Italy.
• Owners and brothers Ed & Boris Safaniev wanted to open a restaurant that offered traditional yet innovative Italian cuisine.

• At the heart of it, Cork & Slice is an American fare restaurant, heavily influenced by Italian cuisine. Their executive Chef, Oscar Martinez has previously worked at The Old Homestead in NYC. He has also worked on the Northshore of Long ISland at Hendricks,BAr Frites & Cipollini.

• Martinez uses his fine culinary skills to compose exquisite dishes, using only the freshest, seasonal, high quality ingredients, thus resulting in one of most delicious Kosher Italian restaurants in Cedarhurst, Long Island.
• The restaurant offers a rustic atmosphere, with their distressed wood tables, beautiful exposed brick walls and urban lighting.
• Diners can be seated at either the front of the restaurant or the bar, where they can watch the chefs at work, making homemade, fresh pizzas.
• They also have an upstairs dining room, with a modern fire place included, that sits up to 70 people for extra seating and parties.

13495,Liebman's Deli,"

Deli restaurant and takeaways. Opens on Shabbat. Kosher certification not found.
We reached out for more information.

column2: • Even though they serve only Kosher meat they are open on Shabbat. No Kosher certification could be found whatsoever.
• Meat deli restaurant and takeaways.

• This place opened in 1953, there were over 100 Jewish delis in the Bronx. Today, Liebman’s is the only one standing. For too many people, stepping into Liebman’s is a time warp — from its simple neon sign to the Formica tabletops and padded booths.
• Kosher Without Borders is designed to help you find Kosher food made to Orthodox standards anywhere on Earth.
• We also list non-Orthodox providers and closed establishments to clear up any doubts you might have, if you come across them while searching online.

column2: • Mandarin, located off busy Route 59, is an elegant restaurant with waiter service, white tablecloths, and a culinary gem of a menu.
• Opened in 2012, it has since been known for great Chinese food, and now it is also earning its reputation as one of the best steakhouses north of NYC.
• With its full selection of beer and wine to accompany the fabulous meal, and a pleasant modern décor, it is an ideal setting for a date or a romantic night out.
• Oversized mirrors along the walls, orb chandeliers, and a choice of table or booth seating, creates a chic, yet intimate atmosphere.
• Sunday clientele is mostly comprised of families enjoying bonding times accompanied by great food.
• On weekdays, Mandarin offers great value lunch and combo specials, as well as daily soup and entrée specials.

• If you have a special celebration a unique feature is available with advance reservation – a cake is brought to your table with all the theatrics - the lights go down, the disco lights come up and special music is played just for you - it’s quite a spectacle.
• For more information click here.
