column2: • Traditions have been satisfying stomachs and souls for almost 20 years. For some it brings to mind memories of a warm conversation over dinner with Grandma and Grandpa (who appreciatively bit into their flavour-filled sandwiches while they watched you enjoy your chicken marsala) or a homey sheva brachos with extended family.
• Now its new owner Scott Fagan picking up the tradition and improving on what was already good, or shall we say, he’s keeping the “Traditions” alive.
• If you’re looking for the perfect match to the main dishes, a side of mashed potatoes is a good option, and the red potato salad is addictive.
• If you still have room when you’re done, you can order hot soufflé topped with parve vanilla ice cream. Or fill your heart with their home made apple strudel.

• On a street with different kinds of eateries to choose from, Traditions has what it takes to deliver that all-important deli fix. This classic deli will bring out old family traditions or create new ones.
• The restaurant also has a large party room on the side for large events and affairs. So make sure the next time to you go out to eat to Traditions, that you ask Scott about his party room.
• For more information click here.

2789,The Coffee Bar,"

Multi-cuisine restaurant serving breakfast, lunch, dinner, and coffee.

column2: • With its soothing cream coloured walls, classic paneling and matching wood tables and bright crystal chandeliers, the Coffee Bar in Lawrence is a comforting and welcoming dairy restaurant located in a prime shopping district.
• Owner Tuly Wolcowitz has brought to the Five Towns an establishment that is both an upscale coffee house and a casual dining restaurant.
• The Coffee Bar proudly serves exclusively Starbucks coffee, putting a Cholov Yisroel twist on many Starbucks favorites. Particularly popular amongst regulars is the caramel macchiato.
• The Coffee Bar is open until 10pm weeknights and is open after Shabbos until 1am, at which time it is a popular destination for both coffee and sushi!
• It is a great choice for either a light dairy lunch or a satisfying dinner at night.
• For more information click here.

3366,Mocha Burger,"

Modern, casual bistro with a Kosher menu offering grass-fed burgers & steaks, plus sides & desserts.

column2: • Everyone knows that Manhattan is full of Kosher restaurants, but much to the chagrin of New York’s Kosher diners, they’re mostly clumped in Midtown, the Upper West Side or even the Financial District.
• But what about SoHo, or the Village? Thankfully, Mocha Burger stepped up to fill the gap in these meccas of cool in New York City.
• The owners of Mocha Bleu in Teaneck opened this Godsend for NYU students in the summer of 2015 to much excitement, and the hype never really died down.
• The décor is an eclectic mix of Western meets modern NYC meets Old World European, but it all comes together very well.
• Not wanting to limit the Kosher scene in SoHo/NoHo/The Village to just burgers, they also have steaks and other sandwiches.
• Their mock-cocktails, such as the Blueberry Mojito or Strawberry Daiquiri are also a delicious treat.
• Wine and other alcoholic beverages are available as well. So the next time you’re ready to venture out below Midtown, be sure to stop by Mocha Burger!

• They also have a 2nd branch, Mocha Burger + Sub Express located at 1603 2nd Avenue (Between 83rd and 84th)New York, NY 10028 with opening hours (Sunday- Thursday: 10:00 AM- 11:00 PM and Saturday Night: 1.5 Hours after Shabbat- 1:00 AM).

4866,Holy Schnitzel (Staten Island),"

Fast-food joint serving an all-Kosher menu, with items such as burgers, salads & wraps.

column2: • In each of their locations they greet their customers the same friendly and warm way.
• The chain was started by a brother and sister team Ofeer & Sivan Benaltaba, who opened two other successful locations in Staten Island (in 2008) and the Five Towns (2011).
• Fast-food restaurant offering an American-Mediterranean menu.
• Fresh food and friendly ambience.
• Healthy options at affordable prices.
• For more information click here.
<li>Other locations:
• Holy Schnitzel (Queens).
• Holy Schnitzel (Cedarhurst).
• Holy Schnitzel in Brooklyn and Lakewood is CLOSED.

• It offers pizzas and artisan pasta rolled by hand.

Restaurant offering Thai cuisine.

column2: • Kai Fan Asian Cuisine offers delicious dining, takeaway and delivery to Bronx, NY.
• This restaurant is a cornerstone in the Bronx community and has been recognised for its outstanding Thai cuisine, excellent service and friendly staff.
• Their Thai restaurant is known for its modern interpretation of classic dishes and its insistence on only using high quality fresh ingredients.

2805,Sushi Tokyo (Lawrence),"

Late-night Kosher sushi restaurant showcasing creative speciality rolls & sushi.

column2: • Inspired by the Brooklyn location of same name, this chain restaurant in Lawrence, NY proves that same great food and atmosphere can travel all the way to Five Towns.
• Symbolic of Japan, their modern red, black and white decor follow a great fun theme giving young couples and their friends a place to enjoy.
• Their ambience is one of a mix between takeaway, and quick dine-in with comfortable booths and stools by their full sushi bar with lunch and dinner specials.

• Sushi Tokyo’s menu is colour coded for your convenience by their vegetable/fruit rolls, low carb, non-raw fish, raw fish, spicy, and heart shaped rolls. Krispy Kosara, a delicious appetiser with a great crunchy bite, as well as the Taco Sushi (lettuce, avocado, tomato, salmon, spicy tuna and sweet sauce) are highly suggested.
• You can then turn to their Hand Rolls, Nigiri, Sashimi, or Sushi Rolls like the Coney Roll (spicy salmon, avocado, crunch, and spicy kani).

• Their three main chefs, offer a number of enticing rolls (all parve) especially the most popular Leo Roll, which includes spicy tuna, crunch, spicy kani, wrapped with avocado, spicy mayo, and fried onion.
• Get real creative with your rolls when you go for the Yamato, consisting of spicy salmon and kani, crunch, chopped lemon, wrapped in black pepper tuna, avocado, and spicy-sweet sauce.

• Higher end rolls include the tempura rolls, deep fried with sweet sauce like the Splendid Roll (salmon, spicy tuna, avocado, spicy salmon, crunch, and fried onion) and Phenomenal Roll (salmon, Portobello mushroom, avocado, crunch, wrapped with avocado and tempura tomato).
• They even have tempura-style Dessert Roll, made with fruits, nuts and served with chocolate syrup – who said you can’t have dessert for dinner?
• For more information click here.
<li>Other locations:
• Sushi Tokyo - Kings Highway.
• Sushi Tokyo - Coney Island.
• Sushi Tokyo - Queens.

4859,Carlos & Gabby's - Riverdale,"

Mexican eatery with a few American dishes, all Kashruth-compliant, in simple, colourful digs.

column2: • Carlos & Gabby’s is just a fun, cool place to dine out. Some of the decorations bear out the whimsical spirit of the eatery, from the barbershop-striped awning to a cactus or jalapeño souvenir atop a cabinet or two.
• The vivid, copper-hued interior features booth seating, and the retro-blue bar stools at a counter, these are the perfect setup for an express meal.

• The Riverdale restaurant, which opened in March 2010, is the fourth outpost of the popular chain, and opened only when owner Avram Klein felt he mastered the perfect pairing of American-style Tex-Mex with authentic south of the Border cuisine.

• “With Gabby's, we succeeded in combing an extensive menu of Mexican favourites, fused with a handful of American classics, and all the great sauces,” he said “This is culinary excellence, combined with a reasonable price point.”
• The tried and true appetisers are spun in piquant Mexican sauces such as Tangy BBQ, Avocado Ranch and Creamy Caesar.
• Other interesting elections include hot dogs in creamy jalapeno sauce, and juicy chicken wings, seasoned and cooked to a golden brown in a honey barbecue sauce.
• The creamed spinach dip with pita chips is pitched as supreme.  They are the prime taco spot - a variety of five flavours with several shell picks (soft, crispy or soft grilled).

• The portions of some of the dishes are packed, and make excellent stand-alone meals.  The nacho bowls brim to the rim, as do the oversized potatoes with either chili, vegetables, chives or thin strips of rib-eye steak.
• Flame-grilled burgers are full with crisp lettuce, ripe tomato, grilled onions, and pickles.
• For more information click here.
• Other locations: Carlos & Gabby's - Miami, Carlos & Gabby's - Queens, Carlos & Gabby's Long Island and Carlos & Gabby's - Coney Island.

• The success of Simply Sushi is simple: Quality, quality, quality and personal and individual attention to each one of their customers.

• Established in June of 2006, owners Chaim Goldman and Shmuel Ungar wanted to provide a unique experience for Kosher consumers, and give them the opportunity to taste gourmet quality sushi. Whether you stop by in the 5 Towns or upstate you’ll notice the Simply Sushi difference.
• They have worked with the finest caterers, halls, hotels, & country clubs. Simply Sushi stands for the utmost in elegance, quality, and superb one on one service.
• Serves the entire tri-state area and are available for Bar-Bat mitzvah’s, weddings, Sheva Brachot, engagement parties, private parties, wholesale, retail & supermarkets.
• For more information click here.
• Other location: Simply Sushi Cedarhurst.

13640,Wok Tov Chinese Restaurant,"

Traditional Chinese Restaurant, Dine in, takeouts and delivery

column2: • Glatt Restaurant.
• At Wok Tov, you will find Chinese cuisine and sushi. Whether you’re heading in with friends or family, Wok Tov is the perfect spot to be.
• Glatt Kosher Chinese Food, adapting these delicacies to the American way of life.
• Casual and Friendly, good for family, groups or solo dining.
• Located 6 miles southeast of JFK International airport.
• Heschcher.

2816,Simply Sushi Cafe,"

Kosher restaurant in Cedarhurst, NY.

column2: • The success of Simply Sushi is simple. Quality, quality, quality and personal and individual attention to each one of their customers.
• Established in June of 2006, owners Chaim Goldman and Shmuel Ungar wanted to provide a unique experience for Kosher consumers, and give them the opportunity to taste gourmet quality sushi.
• Whether you stop by in the 5 Towns or upstate you’ll notice the Simply Sushi difference. They have worked with the finest caterers, halls, hotels, & country clubs.
• Simply Sushi stands for the upmost in elegance, quality, and superb one on one service.
• They serve the entire tri-state area and are available for Bar-Bat mitzvah’s, weddings, Sheva Brachot, engagement parties, private parties, wholesale, retail & supermarkets.
• For more information click here.
• Other location: Simply Sushi Monticello.

25849,Narruto bowl,"

Kosher Pan-Asian and Latin American Restaurant

column2: • Naruto is the restaurant for Asian and Latin American street food, soul food, home cooking and home cooking.
• You can try their classic handcrafted ramen bowls, handcrafted rice noodle udon, with your choice of broth and protein; all the asian flavor is there.
• Roadhouse takes the traditional cuisine of a gastropub and adds a creative flair.
• Roadhouse is sure to delight even the most discriminating guests.

• The restaurant offers you a carefully selected cocktail menu that includes favorites like Llama-Colada, Blueberry Cooler, the classic Moscow Mule, and even some special non-alcoholic drinks just for kids.

column2: • Don’t let the name fool you as this restaurant sits across from Century Village. Century Grill is a hip place with tasteful decor and cool music.
• If you’re looking for excellent service and a flavourful meal, look no further than Century Grill in Boca Raton.
• The wait staff is available and eager to please. This chef is a wiz at making ordinary sounding items beautifully blended with taste and presentation for the fine dining experience.
• For more information click here.

column2: • Certified by a non-Orthodox organization.
• Kosher Without Borders is designed to help you find Kosher food made to Orthodox standards anywhere on Earth.
• We also list non-Orthodox providers and closed establishments to clear up any doubts you might have, if you come across them whilst searching online.
• Fast-food style restaurant, located at Town Center Mall, Boca Raton.
• Maoz Vegetarian offers 15 signature salads and sauces made with ingredients from local farmers and purveyors.
• Their menu is based on gluten-free falafel, vegan & GMO-free shawarma, salad bar, juice bar, with belgian and sweet potato fries.
• You can contact them here.

4344,Butcher Block Grill,"

Contemporary option for elevated dining with a kosher menu featuring steaks, pasta dishes & tapas.

column2: • If you are ever in Boca Raton, Florida and are in the mood for a top quality steakhouse, Butcher Block Grill should be on your list.
• It’s the perfect place to catch dinner with the family after spending the day at the beach which is only a fifteen-minute drive away.
• The cuisine can be characterised as a mix of Mediterranean flavours and the classic American steakhouse.

• The rustic, trendy interior at Butcher Block Grill combines rich, dark wood and warm inviting colors to create the ideal setting for romantic dinners, family meals, corporate functions, and special occasions alike.
• For more information click here.

2863,Asia Restaurant,"

Casual stop for Kosher Chinese classics, sushi, burgers, ribs, fried chicken buckets & more.

column2: • It all got started with three local business professionals, who went to shul together, deciding this town needed a good Kosher food establishment.
• This partnership brought us Asia, an upscale restaurant offering Chinese, sushi, and traditional cuisine.

• From their quick service, modern interior, chic food presentation and large portions, Asia Sushi Wok Grill, led by General Manager Larry Edelstein, will make you feel like you are on a permanent vacation in Boca Raton.
• For more information click here.

4303,Ditmas Kitchen Boca,"

Newest kosher restaurant to serve in Boca Raton.

column2: • Top Chef Alumnus Alex Reznik’s latest creation, Ditmas Boca, has become the newest kosher hot spot in Boca Raton since it opened in December 2016.

• His wildly popular Ditmas in Los Angeles has been a favourite of locals ever since it opened in 2014. The Boca location shares some of the original Ditmas menu’s classic items while introducing some innovative concoctions.
• Ditmas gets its name from the avenue in Brooklyn on which Reznik grew up, and nostalgia drove him to name the original Ditmas in LA as a tribute to his upbringing.
• Ditmas Boca is designed with lots of detail and love as Alex and his brother custom designed and built practically every inch of it.

• The decor is upscale contemporary with beautiful red banquettes lining the inside dining area, striking high back comfortable chairs and a large communal table that seats up to twenty in a semi-private room.
• Copper piping, restored wood, white subway tile, and exposed brick can also be found inside. The outdoor dining patio is nothing short of spectacular.
• The outside incorporates torches, white tablecloths, candles and exquisite chairs with a Palm Tree backdrop.
• The food is a conglomeration of different styles from various cultures - making it contemporary American food , but done with their own flair, with a solid culinary foundation.
• Everything is as farm-to-table-fresh as possible, including locally grown produce, freshly caught Floridian fish and exclusively American meat.
• Ditmas classics such as the Tony Fries, Signature Short Rib dish and Kale Caesar salad are just some of the most popular menu items.
• For more information click here.

2846,Mozart Cafe,"

Unfortunately, this business closed due to the COVID-19 Pandemic.
Cholov Yisroel Restaurant offering Kosher bistro fare in a contemporary space with outdoor seating & Sunday brunch.

column2: • Dairy. Cholov Yisroel.
• The concept of Mozart Cafe is quality fresh ingredients, detailed hospitality in a contemporary artistic atmosphere.
• The interior design features a casual, yet sleek, modern look, with ambient light and space with a  magnificent view of Fountains Plaza backdrop outside.
• The outdoors feature a wrap-around terrace seating with a view of gorgeous pools, fountains, and palm trees.
• In the evening, the pools’ and trees’ lighting sparkle creating an ambiance of charm and magic.
• For more information click here.
• Located 3 miles west Exit 44 I-95.
• ORB Kosher Certification.

• The menu is based on pizza, soup, pasta, wraps, and bagels.
• Casual environment.
• Heschcher: Rabbi Amrom Roth. 1227 50th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11219. Phone: (718) 438-6418.

3126,China Glatt,"

White-tablecloth venue for classic & modern kosher Chinese fare, plus sushi & American options.

column2: • China Glatt, located in the heart of Borough Park’s 13th Avenue shopping district, has been offering generous portions of delectable Chinese food in an upscale atmosphere for the last ten years.

• When owner Sholom Witriol started this venture, he used his expertise and knowledge as a frequent diner to come up with Chinese cuisine that customers couldn’t find anywhere else. Once you try their fare, you will agree that he has succeeded.

• Besides the staple of Kosher Chinese dishes such as Sesame Chicken and Pepper Steak, which are always fantastic here, he and his well-trained chefs, with over 40 years of combined experience, came up with exotic and innovative dishes like Grilled Chicken Singapore Style, Ong’s Fong Won Gai and Blai Zing Beef. The special spices and sauces that they use are distinct and flavourful.
• By Sholom living in the neighbourhood, he has gotten to know his customers and what they like.
• They’re glad to modify the dishes to suit your taste or special diet. The vegetables are constantly checked and everything is made with the finest ingredients.
• The attentive and efficient staff are always ready to advise and recommend from their abundant variety and selections.

• China Glatt is also highly experienced and has a wonderful reputation in catering minor to major events. From your weekly learning program in shul, office parties at work or Sheva Brachot in their private dining room upstairs, Shalom’s constant care is evident with amazing assortment of Chinese and sushi platters.

• A full selection of wines from countries all over the world, classical music playing in the background, Asian paintings on the walls, flowers on each of the tables, all makes for an elegant and exciting meal.

3016,Sushi Tokyo (Coney Island),"

Kosher spot serving up classic & inventive sushi rolls in a storefront space with late-night hours.

column2: • “Bringing a little bit of Tokyo to Brooklyn” is how owners Chaim Lipsitzi and Schneior Harel describe their sushi establishment.
• Approaching the two year mark in January 2011, Sushi Tokyo has made quite a name for itself.  And get used to it, because they plan to open more locations all over New York.
• Customers are accustomed to getting fast service and a wide variety of flavours at very reasonable prices.

• Whether you’re eating in or having them enhance your event with sushi platters, they aim to make sure every customer is satisfied. In fact, they focus heavily on large catering events and school accounts.
• You will enjoy the cool ambience of this sushi restaurant, with its large mural of the Tokyo city skyline. It casts a sense of drama and sparkle to this otherwise calm and clean environment.
• There’s a small sushi bar and a few places to sit at the banquette, with its leather finish and a seatback spiced up with Japanese writing.
<li>Other locations:
• Sushi Tokyo - Kings Highway.
• Sushi Tokyo - Lawrence.
• Sushi Tokyo - Queens.

column2: • Located off 13th Avenue, in the centre of Borough Park, lies a trendy new restaurant called Urbana, that is worthy of Manhattan.
• Just recently opened in July of 2016, they are serving upscale, dairy dishes that are not the average.
• The brick walls, wooden tables and hanging light bulbs provide a dim, romantic lighting to serve a very modern atmosphere.
• Power couple, Ben and Sarah Grossman, also the owners of Sub Express around the block, have much experience in restaurant managing.

KWB's Highlights:

column2: • Glatt Kosher restaurant.
• PHO-MEN on Troy is a groundbreaking Asian noodle-centric restaurant offering a variety of authentic Kosher noodle-based dishes: Pho, Ramen, Udon, Soba, Nabe, and Sukiyaki.
• Casual environment, great contemporary decoration.
• Located 6 miles southeast of downtown NYC.
• Heschcher.

24880,Munch chef,"If you want a crunchy Schnitzel sandwich, Brooklyn’s best burgers, or quality comfort food

column2: • From hearty soups to healthy salads, plus meat pizzas and other tasty plates with a twist, whatever you’re craving, we have you covered.
• Munch is fast food deliciously redefined. Just place your order online or on one of our easy-to-use kiosks and enjoy our palatable plates for yourself or your party of any size.

• Located in the heart of Midwood, Munch brings contemporary flair and fun fare to the neighborhood, and more importantly, your taste buds. Get ready to chow down on our crunchy chicken fingers, savor our chicken soup or sink your teeth into our schnitzel combos and specialty sandwiches.

2987,The Loft Steakhouse,"

Upscale Kosher destination presenting steaks & creative sushi in a stylish bi-level space.

column2: • The Loft Steakhouse is an upscale restaurant in Boro Park, yes Boro Park and not Soho in The City!
• Opened in 2013, the owner Yossi Gluck welcomes a sophisticated clientele, dressy, and perfect for romantic evenings for two and plenty of room for a table of ten.

• Its walls of glazed exposed brick and warm chestnut and russet colors create an inviting Old World ambience, while the metal-encased lanterns and a glass waterfall wall, set in Jerusalem stones, form a contemporary aesthetic decor.
• There is an upper “loft” which yields ample space to accommodate up to 75 people for a family gathering, party or business function.

• Meanwhile, manager, Mattis and his team work hand in hand for elegantly prepared dishes with the highly acclaimed top-rated Executive Chef Boris Poleschuk. Chef Poleschuk graduated from the French Culinary Institute and went on to appear on the popular TV series, Hell's Kitchen.

• The restaurant has two kitchens: the downstairs prep kitchen, where the butchering is done, vegetables are chopped, sauces and stocks are prepared, and the upstairs kitchen, which is used for finishing and plating dishes.

12203,Jay & Lloyd's Kosher Deli,"

Certified but open on Shabbat and no Mashgiach.

column2: • This place offers meat cured in-house, including Kosher pastrami, corned beef, brisket, and others.
• Butcher and Deli with a casual environment.
• Located 11 miles south of downtown NYC.

• While we lack first-hand knowledge, this is what we know so far, based on what we have heard privately from experts in the field: We feel the standards of Vaad Harabonim Lemeshmeret Hakashrut (Rabbi Israel Mayer Steinberg - Cup K) do not meet up to the standards which most of our users would choose to observe, including: Open on Shabbat, no mashgiach.
• Need more info? Cup K (Rabbi Israel Mayer Steinberg) 6 East 45th Street, Suite 209, New York, NY 10017. Phone: (718) 232-4275.

3028,Sushi K Bar (Moisha's Supermarket),"

Kosher sushi joint offering more than 150 rolls, including vegetarian options.

column2: • Sushi K Bar started out as one of the first pioneers of the Kosher sushi market. Way before the many Kosher sushi joints you see around today, Sushi K Bar was providing the community with their sushi fix.
• Other locations: Sushi K Bar (KRM Kollel Supermarket) and Sushi K Bar (Williamsburg).
• Their stores & concessions are all certified by either R' Yechiel Babad or R' Shmuel Berger.
• Having opened its first sushi restaurant in Boro Park in 2008, the Sushi K Bar network currently includes six sushi counters in supermarkets from Crown Heights to Monsey.

• With Sushi K Bar expanding into Williamsburg in August 2013 it became the only dedicated sushi restaurant in the neighbourhood and it was something the local community had long been yearning for years.
• The modern white-and-steel design features a brick wall and limited counter seating.
• Although it is mostly a grab-and-go place, it also offers extensive off-premise catering. This location features two sushi chefs assuring there is never an order backup.
• They are open from early morning to very late at night so that your sushi cravings can be accommodated at almost any time.
• Online ordering, free delivery and takeaway are offered.

2944,Wolf & Lamb Steakhouse,"

Unfortunately, this business closed due to the COVID-19 Pandemic.
Elegant steakhouse with an industrial-chic vibe, serving Kosher meats & sides, plus beer & wine.

column2: • Building on success of their Midtown Manhattan location, Wolf & Lamb opened its Brooklyn branch in May 2011.
• Located in the heart of the vibrant Midwood neighbourhood, the steakhouse occupies a dramatic 3-level structure with several dining rooms and a seasonal outdoor patio.

• The modern industrial design of the restaurant in deep-grey, white and copper tones features vintage lighting, high and exposed ceilings, and a spectacular main dining room floor made of 220,000 copper pennies, hand-laid for stunning effect.

• While delicious food is at the centre at Wolf & Lamb, other aspects of dining, such as attentive warm service, stylish décor, and pleasant atmosphere, are equally emphasised to further enhance the fine dining experience.
• As part if its holistic approach, the restaurant often hosts live music events, as well as offers a large wine and beer selection.
• Rather than following prevailing trends, Wolf & Lamb has been redefining them by having created not a just a fine dining destination, but an oasis of enjoyment and relaxation.
• W&L is owned and operated by a Shomer Shabbos family.
• There is a Kosher Supervisor (Mashgiach Temidi) present at all hours of operation.
• All their meats are Glatt Kosher (Chassidish Shechita) and Bet Yosef.
• Lubavitch Shechita is also available upon request. Please request when making your reservation.
• Their quality meats and poultry are sourced from Alle Meats, Agri Meats, & Solomon’s Glatt.
• Bread is Pas Yisroel and wine is Mevushal.

2996,T Fusion Steakhouse,"

Upscale Kosher option serving aged beef, charcuterie & seafood, in a stylish setting with a full bar.

column2: • Kosher meats servings (Bet Yosef Meats, Agri, Shor Habor, Chk Meats, Alle, Solomons, as well as Kiryas Joel Chickens).
• Vegetables are checked by their Mashgiach/Rabbi all day long.
• Breads, pastas and grains are all Yoshon.
• Simply stated, T Fusion Steakhouse Executive Chef Daniel Rivera offers one of the best looking and tasting menus in Brooklyn and beyond.
• The Marine Park restaurant, opened in 2007, is now a veteran of the Kosher restaurant industry.

• The neighbourhood corner establishment with French door windows, a magnificent glass chandelier in the centre of the room, a full liquor bar and comfortable seating, promises to open your eyes and excite your taste buds.

3148,Bordeaux,"

Upscale-casual venue offering steaks & fish in a refined space with white tablecloths & a wine bar.

column2: • On a block lined with fast food and fast cars sits Bordeaux Steakhouse, a French-American fusion steakhouse that opened in May of 2015.
• This elegant, high-end fine dining restaurant has Chef Arick Fachler at the helm. Fachler is a graduate of the CIA Cooking School and worked under Jean George, Danny Meyer and at the Ritz Carlton.
• The dim lighting and exposed brick wall give Bordeaux an ambience befitting of their expertly crafted food.
• Bordeaux has different menus for lunch, from 12PM to 4PM, and dinner, from 5PM to 11:30PM so be sure to check out both.

• The main dining room has three huge square booths with comfortable chairs and tables, the bar room with a long wooden bar, cushioned ottomans and couch seating, and the back patio room with casual outdoor seating.
• Bordeaux also has a private side room for parties, business meetings, and as extra seating room when the restaurant is full.

3137,Brooklyn Artisan Bakehouse,"

Bakehouse known for their fresh cinnamon buns

column2: • With its rustic decor, down to earth ambience and flavourful menu, Brooklyn Artisan Bakehouse in Crown Heights has been around for almost a year with their breads available in most supermarkets.
• Owner, Levy Krinsky started the bakery several years ago after a bread-making hobby, while working in real estate, turned into a full-time gig.

• Krinsky wanted to utilise the front of his store which has a simple decor along with a long ""L"" shaped bar. His goal was to open a cafe that specialises in the finest homemade breads topped with the finest ingredients. And so the cafe was born.

column2: • In the heart of Borough Park, there’s a trendy new café called Bleu Modern Kitchen.
• Opened in early 2015 by Chayim Kornbluh, previously of Bleu Dish Café and Blue Dish Kosher Catering, the name accurately describes this ever-popular restaurant.
• The exposed brick wall on one side, and bright orange and blue chairs, walls and chandeliers, Bleu Modern Kitchen’s colorful décor is the perfect complement to its vibrant menu.

• The Bleu Modern Kitchen has everything you could want from a dairy café, and more. Very popular and served all day long is the Mediterranean Shakshuka off the Brunch menu. Served with bread in a cast-iron pan, the two poached eggs in flavourful tomatoes, peppers, onions and garlic spicy medley is a real hit.
• Another highly recommended menu item is the Bleu Sushi Tower, a tower of rice, kani, avocado, cucumber and cooked salmon, and topped with crispy onions.
• Their “Fish and Chips Bleutique” has three different types of fish and chips dishes to choose from, along with a full fish, pasta and pizza menu (Little Italy on the Bleu).

• Bleu Modern Kitchen occasionally features “Out of the Bleu” dishes, like the Grape Pizza, a white pizza topped with green and purple grapes, so keep an eye out for those unexpected items! And with desserts like Crème Brulee and Churros, how could you not order something sweet?

• Bleu Modern Kitchen is available for in-house and outside catering for all kinds of events, such as a sheva brachot or bris, as well as breakfast gift packages - a package of various Breakfast menu items.
• Open daily from 10 AM – 9 PM, step out of the Borough Park bustle and into the cool quiet of Bleu Modern Kitchen.

10723,"Kosher concession Stand at MCU Park, Brooklyn","

Kosher certified kiosk at ballpark.

column2: • Meat kiosk.
• Kosher concession that sells hot dogs, peanuts, pretzels, etc.
• Prices aren't that bad, definitely cheaper than major leagues. You are still at a ballpark, though. Price range around 9 dollars for a hot dog and soda.
• You can use your credit card at the Kosher stand, unlike the other vendors, and they serve other foods, like salad and sushi. They also have candy and snacks.
• Located at Coney Island Beach, 21 miles south of Manhattan.
• KOF-K Heschcher.

column2: • Dairy.
• Table 40 is a Brooklyn restaurant with a cozy environment and a varied menu.
• They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner.
• Casual restaurant suitable for families.
• Takeaway and delivery services available.
• Located 7 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Heschcher.

12224,Mint Brooklyn,"

Kosher health-food hub offering a broad menu, including sushi, pizza, salads & housemade breads.

column2: <li style=""list-style-type: none;"">
• Dairy / Fish. Alcohol served.
• Mint is an original restaurant where Kosher California cuisine, rooted in Mediterranean style, converges on an attractive trendy space.
• A fresh to table menu was developed by acclaimed chef Mark Strausman, executive chef of famed Fred’s at Barneys and formerly Campagna and Coco Pazzo.
• Check their menu here.
• Located 9 miles south of downtown NYC.

3131,Cafe Renaissance,"

White-tablecloth eatery serving a kosher menu featuring popular Italian dishes as well as sushi.

column2: • Hugely popular and spacious, Cafe Renaissance offers delectable Italian dishes and one of the best assortment of gourmet pizzas you will ever try- it’s made the way pizza was originally made and supposed to taste.
• With three different pasta sauces, pizza dough made from four different kinds of flour and various cheeses, the restaurant is keeping the food as Italian as possible.

• An emphasis on excellence is instilled by owners Shaul and Tikva Ashkenazi.  They started in this business 33 years ago with a restaurant in Israel and it was the quality of the food that made them successful.

• When they moved to America over 20 years ago, Shaul was in the clothing business.  His true love and aspiration, however, was to open a restaurant here. So in June 2001, they began another adventure that their customers have been enjoying ever since.
• This cafe has been a hit with families, friends, dates and, it seems, everyone else.  Some recommendations for starters are the Mozzarella Basket and Renaissance Bruschetta.
• The Penne a la Vodka is quite different here because the chef makes the vodka sauce himself.  The Chilean Sea Bass is fantastic as is their famous L & B Style Pizza, with the sauce on top.
• They have a separate sushi menu with all your favourites and all the desserts are made on premises. An absolute must is their oozing hot chocolate souffle with cold ice cream.

3039,Izzy's BBQ Addiction,"

Kosher BYOB barbecue restaurant serving platters, sandwiches, sides & desserts in hip digs.

column2: • Open since the summer of 2015, Izzy’s BBQ boldly made its mark on the map as New York City’s first Kosher smokehouse.
• Stepping inside Sruli “Izzy” Eidelman’s unassuming Brooklyn storefront is like stepping inside an aromatic, warm and cozy food haven.

• With its clean and simple décor, you quickly realise and appreciate that this place is all about the food. And boy, that food!! Go ahead and get your hands dirty – this food begs to be devoured with abandon.

• The mood is laid-back, intimate and jovial and will ensure this spot soon becomes one of your favourite places to meet up with close friends to kick back with a craft beer and some serious Texas Style BBQ.

12917,Moti's Cafe,"

Pizza and sushi restaurant. Casual and contemporary.

column2: • Dairy. Parve.
• Moti's coffee has been in its neighbourhood for over three decades, serving freshly brewed coffee throughout the day. The coffee beans are ground daily.
• A casual place in a contemporary decoration. Seating available.
• Takeaway and delivery services available.
• Menu consists of pizza, knishes, fries, falafel, soup, pasta, fish, and salads.
• Located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Heschcher: Rabbi Yechiel Babad, (Tartikover Rav) 718-951-0952/3 5207 19th Ave. Brooklyn, NY 11204.

3084,Falafel Off The Korner,"

Kosher Middle Eastern fare, such as falafel and shawarma, turned out in small, basic quarters.

column2: • Shechitat Bet Yosef. Kemach Yashan.

• Authentic Middle Eastern cuisine.
• Only uses freshest ingredients.
• Open for lunch and dinner.
• Dishes and sandwiches include a variety of salads.
• Homemade breads.

column1:
3022,Sushi K Bar (Williamsburg),"

Modern sushi bar serving Kosher & vegetarian rolls, sashimi & salads for takeaway or delivery.

column2: • Sushi K Bar started out as one of the first pioneers of the Kosher sushi market. Way before the many Kosher sushi joints you see around today, Sushi K Bar was providing the community with their sushi fix.
• Other locations: Sushi K Bar (KRM Kollel Supermarket) and Sushi K Bar (Moisha's Supermarket).
• Their stores & concessions are all certified by either R' Yechiel Babad or R' Shmuel Berger.
• Having opened its first sushi restaurant in Boro Park in 2008, the Sushi K Bar network currently includes six sushi counters in supermarkets from Crown Heights to Monsey.

• With Sushi K Bar expanding into Williamsburg in August 2013 it became the only dedicated sushi restaurant in the neighbourhood and it was something the local community had long been yearning for years.
• The modern white-and-steel design features a brick wall and limited counter seating.
• Although it is mostly a grab-and-go place, it also offers extensive off-premise catering. This location features two sushi chefs assuring there is never an order backup.
• They are open from early morning to very late at night so that your sushi cravings can be accommodated at almost any time.
• Online ordering, free delivery and takeaway are offered.

3007,Sushi Tokyo (Kings Highway),"

Sushi & Japanese small plates crafted in sleek surroundings for takeaway & dine in.
KWB's Highlights:

column2: • When Chaim Lipsitz and Shneior Harel opened their first Sushi Tokyo location in Brooklyn on Coney Island Avenue back in 2008, their goal was to make every person a sushi lover.
• The beautifully renovated venue features sleek modern design in black-and-white color scheme with stainless steel, brown and red accents.
• The contemporary look is further enhanced by a brick wall and full-length windows. Much of the décor has been custom-made by Shneior, including the glass tabletops.
• The seating is a combination of booth-style and bar-height tables with leather chairs and an additional cozy corner booth to accommodate a group of friends.
• The restaurant is open early and closes late, including on Saturday nights, making it a convenient spot to get a sushi fix at almost any time of day.
• In the evening the restaurant transforms with a dimly lit, lively vibe. It is a great place for both an informal date night and a family or friends get-together.
• The top quality of their sushi is a result of using only the highest-grade fresh fish and the superb skills of their sushi chefs. Sushi Tokyo offers all types of sushi and a variety of appetisers.
<li>Other locations:
• Sushi Tokyo - Coney Island.
• Sushi Tokyo - Lawrence.
• Sushi Tokyo - Queens.

3033,Sushi K Bar (KRM Kollel Supermarket),"

Kosher sushi joint offering more than 150 rolls, including vegetarian options.

column2: • Sushi K Bar started out as one of the first pioneers of the Kosher sushi market. Way before the many Kosher sushi joints you see around today, Sushi K Bar was providing the community with their sushi fix.
• Other locations: Sushi K Bar (Moisha's Supermarket) and Sushi K Bar (Williamsburg).
• Their stores & concessions are all certified by either R' Yechiel Babad or R' Shmuel Berger.
• Having opened its first sushi restaurant in Boro Park in 2008, the Sushi K Bar network currently includes six sushi counters in supermarkets from Crown Heights to Monsey.

• With Sushi K Bar expanding into Williamsburg in August 2013 it became the only dedicated sushi restaurant in the neighbourhood and it was something the local community had long been yearning for years.
• The modern white-and-steel design features a brick wall and limited counter seating.
• Although it is mostly a grab-and-go place, it also offers extensive off-premise catering. This location features two sushi chefs assuring there is never an order backup.
• They are open from early morning to very late at night so that your sushi cravings can be accommodated at almost any time.
• Online ordering, free delivery and takeaway are offered.

2978,Upside Craft Burgers,"

Cool corner stop dishing up inventive burgers, plus tacos, sandwiches & creative sides.

column2: • Upside Craft Burgers came onto the Borough Park scene in November 2016.  Now, the restaurant is not a burger joint nor is it fancy.

• Owner Yanky Mayer who has years of experience in the Kosher food industry, as well as a background in music, combines his hobbies in order to bring a fresh and new type of eatery to the Kosher world.
•  Upside is a fun and cool place to enjoy delicious comfort food. They also have vegetarian options to appease any type of diner.

3060,Glatt-A-La Carte,"

Upscale Kosher restaurant with a varied menu of global fusion items, including steaks & sushi.

column2: • Glatt-A-La Carte has been the first of its kind, providing Continental and fine Grill cuisine to the Brooklyn community.

• Yet, it’s not only a local place, as over 60% of our customers hail from the Five Towns, Manhattan and New Jersey. That’s because their dishes can compete with any of the top restaurants in the New York area.
• Established in 2000, Glatt-A-La Carte is a NYC-style steakhouse located right in the heart of Boro Park.
• Owner Binem Naiman and Chef Mark Green have worked together for over a decade to bring elegance and sophistication to their diners.
• The chic upscale venue that can be mistaken for a catering hall, features elegant décor, with the dim glow of the lights and the white winter branches warmly lit from below against the back wall.

• Their large private party room makes it a perfect location to host a family celebration or a professional meeting, while inconspicuous white screens between some of the tables in the main dining room assure a sense of privacy for a romantic night out that no other busy restaurant can offer.

• Combined with a welcoming invite from the owner and flawless presentation of each of the dishes (even children’s menu is presented with a flair), Glatt-A-La Carte, has become one of Brooklyn’s finest dining attractions.

3161,Boeuf & Bun,"

Innovative, handcrafted burgers pair with a variety of craft beers at this upbeat locale.

column2: • When Chef and Owner Tzemach Woolstone opened Boeuf & Bun in Janaury of 2015, he had one goal in mind: to bring a totally new Kosher dining experience to Brooklyn, NY.

• Despite the culinary advancements made in New York in recent years, there was still a gaping hole where fine dining should have met comfort and convenience. Boeuf & Bun has thankfully closed that gap.

• The shabby-chic décor of Boeuf & Bun, with the exposed brick and wood walls, cement floors, and pops of bright blue, allows for a more relaxed environment where diners can feel at ease enjoying top-notch food.

• The name of the restaurant implies the comfortable contradiction that is Boeuf and Bun – the elegant sounding French word for “beef” paired with “bun,” a simple word for something elemental to human survival – connotes an upscale, fine dining experience, coupled with down to earth service, ambience and pricing.
• Boeuf & Bun also has an extensive drinks menu, including wines and craft beer from around the US, Spain, Israel and Australia.

• This restaurant doesn’t take reservations, but anyone will tell you that the wait is worth it. Well lit with natural light in the day time and romantically dimmed during dinner hours, Boeuf & Bun is the perfect place for any meal, for any occasion.

3181,Bison & Bourbon,"

Contemporary kosher steakhouse in a former warehouse with an expansive patio & craft cocktails.

column2: • Even before you step foot into Bison and Bourbon, you know you’re somewhere different. Glimpses of cobblestone and bold industrial workshops colour this area just off the Gowanus Expressway.

• A Mediterranean­-style courtyard is visible from the street. Still unspoiled by mainstream hipster intrusion, the neighbourhood—and the new space—fills an unsated void in the Jewish world: unaffected casual yet smartly sophisticated dining and lounging.

• At Bison and Bourbon, you’re free to relax and have a good time. They have a great cocktail menu made with fresh herbs from their rooftop garden, so you don’t have to go to separate places for your bar chill and Kosher food. It’s all in one gorgeous destination, with multiple spaces to stretch out.
• Seat yourself at a table repurposed from 1920s wood found on location, or relax at the lounge loft or indoor­-outdoor bar.
• Their Mediterranean courtyard seats 100, and a separate party area upstairs seats 50­-70 people.
• With a total of 250 seats spread throughout the restaurant, whichever you choose, you’ll enjoy something totally new in their young, hip, urban setting.

3196,Basil Pizza & Wine Bar,"

Kosher pizzeria & wine bar offering wood-fired pies & other Italian fare in a homey-sleek setting.

column2: • Basil, Brooklyn’s one of a kind pizza and wine bar, is making headlines.
• Located in Crown Heights, Basil is an Italian bistro specialising in unique menus for breakfast, lunch, dinner and late night specialities.
• Basil’s ambience tantalises all of your senses with smells tickling your nose, tastes dancing on your tongue, music flowing through the air, and the sight of perfection on your plate.

• Basil’s trendy cuisine has enticed Kosher diners, vegetarian diners & non-Kosher diners alike. Basil’s menu, Kosher (Cholov Yisroel), includes appetisers, salads, fresh fish, entrees, homemade desserts & Basil’s famous wood burning oven creations.
• Basil features one of a kind wood burning oven pizza creations as well as wine and beer selections that will keep you coming for more.

3268,Reserve Cut,"

High-end Kosher steakhouse with a wine room & French-Asian menu that includes sushi & Wagyu beef.

column2: • Reserve Cut is a modern steakhouse that fills the void of an upscale Kosher restaurant in Downtown New York City.

• The Wall Street restaurant opened in October 2013 and is located in The Setai, just steps from the 9/11 Memorial, Battery Park City, NY Stock Exchange, and many of the world’s major financial institutions.
• A unique feature of Reserve Cut is the glass enclosed open kitchen when you can see their chefs preparing your dishes.

• One of them being, Executive Chef Hok Chin who has created a menu of French and Asian inspired dishes such as Glazed Veal Sweetbreads, Salt Baked Mediterranean Branzino, and prime aged Cote de Boeuf.

• Drawing on the Eastern influence of The Setai, the beautiful venue features Asian inspired décor in the 200-seat main dining room, sushi bar, wine room, and two additional spaces available for private events.

• The vision of the owner Albert Allaham, who also owns a high-end butcher shop, The Prime Cut in Brooklyn, and who himself continues a long-standing family tradition of master butchers, is to redefine the Kosher dining landscape and to serve his superior cuisine to Kosher and non-Kosher clientele alike.
• Reserve Cut’s menu features over 10 types of prime steak sourced from The Prime Cut and dry aged in the restaurant’s private aging room.

column2: • Glatt Kosher restaurant with takeaway and delivery services available.

• Located 9 miles south of downtown NYC.

column2: • Dairy.

• Heschcher.

Sushi available for takeaway, deliveries or dine in.

column2: • Pareve.
• Noribar is an innovative sushi joint located in Brooklyn, New York.
• This place has been creating high-quality sushi meals using fresh ingredients and skilled preparation techniques.
• Contemporary decoration, great for groups, family or solo dining.
• This store is located 7 miles south of downtown NYC.
• They have another location at Boro Park, Brooklyn.
• Heschcher.

11786,Glatt Kosher Family - Brooklyn,"

Traditional Chinese restaurant with a casual environment.

column2: • Glatt (Chassidishe Shechita / Pas Yisroel).
• Traditional Chinese restaurant offering an extensive Oriental menu.
• Casual and family-friendly environment.
• Located 7 miles south of downtown NYC.
• OK Hechsher.

column1:
11979,"Kosher Bagel Hole - Avenue J, Brooklyn","

Traditional bakery offering homemade bagels, and more.

column2: • Dairy. Parve.

• For over 25 years, the family-run Kosher Bagel Hole has provided the greater Brooklyn community with delicious bagels, fresh vegetable salads and a large selection of mouth-watering fish and cheese products.
• They also offer a variety of sandwiches, wraps, and soups that satisfy the most discerning tastes and preferences.

• With two convenient locations in the heart of Flatbush, Coney Island Av. and Avenue J in Brooklyn, New York, the Kosher Bagel Hole’s customers can be found ordering breakfast/lunch/supper, purchasing a quick snack or even just running in to buy one of their multi-flavoured (hot or ice) coffees!
• Located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Kehilah Kashrus (Flatbush Community Kashrus Organization) Rabbi Zechariah Adler. 718-951-0481 / 1294 E. 8th St. Brooklyn, NY 11230.

13585,Jus by Julie - Brooklyn Av. U.,"

Health-focused outfit, featuring blended fruit & vegetable juices. NOT CERTIFIED, ONLY AVENUE M LOCATION.

column2: • Parve.
• JUS by Julie is a top Brooklyn-based blended juice and health food company that is transforming people's lives with their delicious approach towards eating well.
• Cozy environment, you inmediately feel at home.
• Takeaway services available.
<li>Locations:
• Cedarhurst.
• Brooklyn Av. M.
• Allenhurst (Seasonal).
• Heschcher.

3098,Estihana Brooklyn,"

Glatt kosher sushi bar, great contemporary environment

column2: • Glatt Kosher restaurant.
• The menu offers culinary creations from Japan, Malaysia, Vietnam, and the Canton area of China.
• They are also located in Teaneck, New Jersey.
• Fresh delicious cooked on the spot food.
• Casual dress code.
• Speciality liquors.

11720,Ice Cream House - Boro Park,"

Casual store with a huge selection of Kosher ice cream, toppings, bagels and a salad bar.

column2: • All dairy products are Cholov Yisroel.
• Ice Cream House has two other locations: Flatbush and Williamsburg.
• Each of the three stores offers a large selection of soft ice cream flavours, with an array of customised toppings.
• Fruits and milkshakes are on their menu too.
• You can choose from non-dairy, dairy, fat-free or sugar-free ice cream.
• Famous for its vegan approved ice creams that are ideal for lactose intolerant consumers.
• In addition to the ice cream, they also offer a buffet-style salad bar and fresh sandwiches.
• Heschcher / Heschcher.

11896,Pizza World Café,"

Casual, quick bite, sushi and pizza shop.

column2: • Dairy. Parve.
• This place is a pizza and sushi shop. A Japanese and Italian menu in one.
• Casual and family friendly, located 9 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Kehilah Kashrus (Flatbush Community Kashrus Organization) Rabbi Zechariah Adler. 718-951-0481 / 1294 E. 8th St. Brooklyn, NY 11230.

12940,Dagan Pizza,"

Cholov Yisroel Italian pizzeria. Free delivery.

column2: <li>
<li>
<li>
<li>
<li>
<li>
• Dairy. Chalav Israel (they use Haolam Kosher cheese). Pat Israel. Kemach Yashan.
• Dagan Pizza offers pizza and much more: They carry sandwiches, falafel, fish and chips, and many other dishes.
• Located in a busy strip mall on the main streets in Mill Basin.
• Located 7 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Heschcher.

11480,Strauss Bakery,"

High-standard bakery, cake specialists, no seating available.

column2: • Dairy bakery, with no seating available.
• Strauss Bakery was selected to produce the cookies for the New Guinness Book World Record of the Largest Cookie Mosaic of a Flag.
• Strauss Bakery has been a standard bearer of superb quality Kosher baked goods.
• Orders and takeaways available.
• Located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Heschcher.

13029,Schnitzi - Boro Park,"

Casual and friendly schnitzel specialist.

column2: • Glatt Kosher restaurant and food truck.
• Schnitzi was established in 2007.
• Their meals are based on childhood lunches and dinners.
• They offer grilled chicken, steak, pastrami, roast beef, and homemade sauces.
• Modern, casual and family-friendly in a contemporary decoration.
• Located 7 miles south of downtown NYC.
• They have another location at Coney Island Av. and a food truck.
• Heschcher.

12984,Sprinkles - Wallabout St. Brooklyn,"

Kid-friendly ice cream store.

column2: • Dairy/Parve.
• Open since 2005, Sprinkles lineup more than 300 ice cream products produced by their owners on their state-of-the-art factory in Hackensack, New Jersey.
<li>They have other three locations:
• Boro Park, 13th. Avenue.
• Boro Park, 18th. Avenue.
• Madison Avenue #12, Lakewood, NJ.

12114,Munch Chef,"

Brooklyn’s best burgers, or quality comfort food, you will want to come to Munch for lunch or dinner!

column2: • From hearty soups to healthy salads, plus meat pizzas and other tasty plates with a twist, whatever you’re craving, we have you covered.

• With our mouthwatering menu items and fresh ingredients, Munch is fast food deliciously redefined. Just place your order online or on one of our easy-to-use kiosks and enjoy our palatable plates for yourself or your party of any size.

• Located in the heart of Midwood, Munch brings contemporary flair and fun fare to the neighborhood, and more importantly, your taste buds. Get ready to chow down on our crunchy chicken fingers, savor our chicken soup or sink your teeth into our schnitzel combos and specialty sandwiches.

11793,Kaff Kafe - Brooklyn,"

Dairy restaurant with a contemporary environment.

column2: • Dairy restaurant.
• A newly-renovated local cafe located in Brooklyn’s Borough Park, offering affordable food in a cozy, yet unpretentious atmosphere.
• Open for breakfast and have a variety of sandwiches, omelets, french toast, pancakes, and freshly-squeezed juice.
• Good for family, friends, or just a quiet night out.
• Their menu has a full line of fish, pasta, panini, soups, gourmet pizza, wraps, desserts, hot and cold drinks, and a salad bar with a selection of over 27 fresh vegetables.
• Check their menu here.
• Located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Owner Lubavitcher Shneur Goodman.
• Certified by Crown Heights Kosher (CHK), and Rabbi Babad.

11449,Yossi's Bakery and Sweet House - New Utrecht Avenue,"

Traditional bakery. Cholov Yisroel.

column2: • Dairy Cholov Yisroel. Yoshon.
• Traditional bakery offering sweets, sandwiches, and more.
• At this store, each unique item is made by hand and guaranteed 100% satisfaction. Being in business since 1995.
• No seating available, but you can order to takeaway.
• Located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.

12867,Noribar - Boro Park,"

Sushi available for takeaway, deliveries or dine in.

column2: • Pareve.
• Noribar is an innovative sushi joint located in Brooklyn, New York.
• This place has been creating high-quality sushi meals using fresh ingredients and skilled preparation techniques.
• Contemporary decoration, great for groups, family or solo dining.
• This store is located 7 miles south of downtown NYC.
• They have another location at Crown Heights, Brooklyn.
• Heschcher.

column2: • Glatt restaurant.
• This place serves at the counter, they offer chicken & steak subs, tacos, burgers, and Chinese plates.
• Working since 2005.
• Casual and family friendly place, with a Chinese environment.
• Located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Heschcher.

column1:
11533,Hot Bagels - Brooklyn,"

Casual and small bagel shop. No seating available.

column2: • Dairy.
• Hot Bagels has been a fixture on 13th Avenue and 49th Street for years.
• Hand-rolled, rustic bagels, boiled the old-fashioned way. The recipe hasn’t changed since 1936.
• No seating, casual environment.
• Located 8 miles southeast of downtown NYC.
• Heschcher.

column2: • Glatt Kosher restaurant.

• Kehilah Kashrus (Flatbush Community Kashrus Organization) Rabbi Zechariah Adler. 718-951-0481 / 1294 E. 8th St. Brooklyn, NY 11230.

11823,Crawford's Café,"

Casual dairy Cholov Yisroel restaurant with contemporary environment.

column2: • Dairy establishment Halav Yisrael and Bishul Yisrael.
• Sephardim on request.
• Crawford's is known for their fresh salads, gourmet sandwiches, and��desserts.
• They offer high-grade coffee, and speciality hot and cold drinks. Fat and sugar free Parve muffins, sushi is also available.
• Located 9 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Jsor Hechsher.

• Casual environment and family friendly.
• Located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Hechsher.

• Open since 2005, Sprinkles lineup more than 300 ice cream products produced by their owners on their state-of-the-art factory in Hackensack, New Jersey.
<li>They have other three locations:
• Boro Park, 13th. Avenue.
• Madison Avenue #12, Lakewood, NJ.
• Wallabout Street, Brooklyn.
• Check their menu here.

12806,Zoom Kosher Food Station,"

Jewish history surrounded by awe-inspiring scenery.

column2: • Parve / Dairy food to takeaway.

• No seating available.

11841,Spoons - Flatbush,"

Family friendly Cholov Yisroel dairy and sushi!

column2: • Cholov Yisroel Dairy. Parve.
• Spoons Cafe is a place where you can enjoy breakfast, casual lunch or dinner. Can be ideal for when you need a quick grab-n-go spot. They offer quick delivery and curbside pick-up.
• Casual and family-friendly environment, with another location in Boro Park.
• Check their menus here.

12801,Davry Kosher Sports Bar,"

Unfortunately, this business closed due to the COVID-19 Pandemic.

column2: • Glatt Kosher restaurant.
• Davry Kosher Sports Bar is located at the heart of Kings Highway in Brooklyn.
• Offers a polished-style sports bar and a Kosher restaurant scene.
• Their menu brings to life typical bar-fare with a twist of refinement along with a list of signature cocktails that reflect the character of their space.
• Contemporary environment, good for groups, couples or solo-dining.
• Check their menu here.
• Heschcher: Rabbinical Council of Bergen County, Rabbi Binyomin Taub. Phone: 201-287-9292. PO Box 1233 Teaneck, NJ 0766.

11831,That Sushi Spot,"

Extensive sushi menu including speciality rolls & party platters.

column2: • Parve.
• This place offers seats for over 20 people, free local delivery, and curbside pickup.
• Over 100 items to choose from, their menu includes cooked sushi rolls, tempura, and speciality rolls, original sushi themed appetisers, sashimi, nigiri, maki, and handrolls.
• A casual and family-friendly environment in a contemporary decoration.
• Located 9 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Kehilah Kashrus (Flatbush Community Kashrus Organization) Rabbi Zechariah Adler. 718-951-0481 / 1294 E. 8th St. Brooklyn, NY 11230.

• No seating. Casual environment.

11624,Orwasher's Bakery,"

Bakery inside a supermarket with seating available.

column2: • Parve bakery.
• New York's original artisan bakery. Handmade in NYC since 1916.
• Check their bread and pastries here.
• At this store, you can find bread, bagels, pastries, cookies, sandwiches, espresso & coffee bar, salads.
• Seating available.
• Located inside Whole Foods Market 365, 4 miles southeast of downtown NYC.
• Hechsher.

Kid-friendly ice cream store. Seating available.

column2: • Dairy/Parve.
• Open since 2005, Sprinkles lineup more than 300 ice cream products produced by their owners on their state-of-the-art factory in Hackensack, New Jersey.
<li>They have other three locations:
• Boro Park, 18th. Avenue.
• Madison Avenue #12, Lakewood, NJ.
• Wallabout Street, Brooklyn.
• Check their menu here.
• Heschcher.

11735,Ice Cream House - Flatbush,"

Casual store with a huge selection of Kosher ice cream, toppings, bagels and a salad bar.

column2: • All dairy products are Cholov Yisroel.
• Ice Cream House has two other locations: Williamsburg and Boro Park.
• Each of the three stores offers a large selection of soft ice cream flavours, with an array of customised toppings.
• Fruits and milkshakes are on their menu too.
• You can choose from non-dairy, dairy, fat-free or sugar-free ice cream.
• Famous for its vegan approved ice creams that are ideal for lactose intolerant consumers.
• In addition to the ice cream, they also offer a buffet-style salad bar and fresh sandwiches.
• Heschcher / Heschcher.

• Check their menus here.

12974,"Chocolatte - Coney Island, Brooklyn","

Modern cafe offering roasted coffee, smoothies, breakfast & sandwiches.

column2: • Dairy.
• Serving Brooklyn since 2013, Chocolatte is a cafe and espresso bar offering locally roasted coffee and fresh, gourmet Kosher food.
• Modern and contemporary environment, great place for family, groups or solo dining.
• Located 6 miles south-east of downtown NYC.
• They have another store at Eastern Parkway, Brooklyn.
• Heschcher.

11484,Shlomy's Bake Shop - 16th. Avenue,"

High-scale quality bakery, no seating available.

column2: • Dairy.
• This place is a high-quality bakery offering a large list of baked goods.
• There is no seating available. Orders and takeaways available.
• Heschcher.
• This shop is located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.
• They are also located in 13 Green Ave Ext Woodridge NY (Summer only) and 5104 12th Ave Brooklyn.
<li>These are their 9 supermarket concessions:

• 1630 Reisterstown Rd Pikesville MD 21208. Located in the Season Supermarket.
• 50 Doughty Blvd Lawrance NY 11559. Located in Seasons Express.

12861,Freund's Sushi & Grill Fish Market,"

Fish market, sushi takeaway specialist.

column2: • Parve.
• For nearly 70 years and three generations, the Freund family has been Brooklyn’s staple for uncompromisingly fresh, certified-Kosher seafood.
• They place a continual focus on quality products and customer service that makes you feel like family, and it’s their goal to provide that type of experience on every visit.
• Everything they serve here is as fresh as can be, including our house-made gefilte fish, sauces, and seasonings.
• They take pride in slicing their fish every day and packaging it with meticulous attention to detail for each and every one of our customers.
• Contemporary environment.
• Takeaway and online delivery services available.
• Located 6 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Heschcher.

11644,Alenbi Kitchen,"

A dressy late night restaurant in Brooklyn, NY.

column2: • Glatt Kosher restaurant.
• Situated in the Crown Heights neighbourhood of Brooklyn, Alenbi serves the food of modern day Israel.
• Their menu is influenced by the cultures of Jewish kitchens from across the Middle-East and Europe.
• At the front of the restaurant is a six-seat chef bar which overlooks an open kitchen, giving the guests a unique view of the hustle & bustle of the kitchen.
• Offering a ""dressy"" environment, formal and good for businessmen and couples.
• Check their menu here.
• Located 5 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Heschcher.

12216,Mendy's Crown Heights,"

Famous for their juicy mouth-watering hamburgers served with homemade fries.

column2: • Glatt Kosher delicatessen and restaurant serving the New York City area for over 25 years.
<li>Largest chain of Glatt Kosher restaurants in the country, known for perfecting the art of deli in this branch and in their other four locations:
• Mendy’s Deli & Restaurant.
• Mendy’s Grand Central.
• Mendy’s Atrium.
• Mendy’s Rockefeller Center.
• Whether it's a business lunch, quick bite, or celebration, they are always ready to serve you.
• They offer takeaway, delivery and catering services. 15% OFF in your first online order.
• Try their juicy mouth watering hamburgers served with homemade fries. Make it a King David and beef it up with some freshly sliced hot corned beef.
• To organise an event with them, email at: mendysevents@gmail.com.
• Check their menu here.

13085,Corner Café,"

Italian and American breakfast, lunch & dinner. Casual environment.

column2: • Dairy.

• Since the year 2000, they have been offering casual dairy dining at Corner Cafe. This is a family-friendly restaurant, located on Ditmas Ave in Boro Park,  a convenient stop between Flatbush and Boro Park.
• Recently remodeled and expanded.
• Check their menu here.
• Heschcher.

11749,The New Pizza Professor of Brooklyn,"

Cholov Yisroel pizzeria, family-friendly and casual environment.

column2: • Dairy Cholov Yisroel and Kemach Yoshon.
• A few years back the neighbourhood lost a great pizza joint. So the owners decided to reopen the same great pizza place.
• Great for families and friends, casual environment.
• Takeaways and deliveries available
• Check their menu here.
• Heschcher.
• Located 9 miles south of downtown NYC.

12026,Jerusalem Steak House II - Avenue J,"

Family-friendly steak house with casual environment.

column2: • Glatt Kosher restaurant.
• This place is good for solo dining with healthy options and good for a quick bite too.
• They offer delivery and takeaways. Family-friendly, casual environment.
• Located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Kehilah Kashrus (Flatbush Community Kashrus Organization) Rabbi Zechariah Adler. 718-951-0481 / 1294 E. 8th St. Brooklyn, NY 11230.

11489,Shlomy's Bake - 12th. Avenue,"

High-scale quality bakery, no seating available.

column2: • Dairy.

• This shop is located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.
• They are also located in 13 Green Ave Ext Woodridge NY (Summer only) and 54712 16th Ave Brooklyn.

11984,Kosher Bagel Hole - Coney Island Av.,"

Traditional bakery offering homemade bagels, and more.

column2: • Dairy. Parve.

• For over 25 years, the family-run Kosher Bagel Hole has provided the greater Brooklyn community with delicious bagels, fresh vegetable salads and a large selection of mouth-watering fish and cheese products.
• They also offer a variety of sandwiches, wraps, and soups that satisfy the most discerning tastes and preferences.

• With two convenient locations in the heart of Flatbush, Coney Island Av. and Avenue J in Brooklyn, New York, the Kosher Bagel Hole’s customers can be found ordering breakfast/lunch/supper, purchasing a quick snack or even just running in to buy one of their multi-flavoured (hot or ice) coffees!
• Located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Kehilah Kashrus (Flatbush Community Kashrus Organization) Rabbi Zechariah Adler. 718-951-0481 / 1294 E. 8th St. Brooklyn, NY 11230.

11854,Sophie's Bistro,"

Dairy Cholov Yisroel and Glatt Kosher separate menus, fireplace and patio.

column2: • Dairy Cholov Yisroel,  Pat Yisroel,  Kemach Yoshon and meat menus available.
• Having an outdoor patio seating, rustic fireplace, and gourmet cuisine, Sophie’s Bistro and Lounge is designed to be a comfortable yet sophisticated eatery.

• When you first walk in there is an open kitchen on your left and bar stool-like chairs for quick dining on your right. Stroll through the main dining room to the backyard garden, and you will see iron-wrought furniture and lush landscape, giving the feeling of a peaceful retreat during a hectic day. The ambience indoors is equally charming, especially if you pick a table near the aquarium.
• Great formal contemporary environment, but family friendly.
• Check their dairy menu here.
• Glatt Kosher menu.
• Located 9 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Kehilah Kashrus (Flatbush Community Kashrus Organization) Rabbi Zechariah Adler. 718-951-0481 / 1294 E. 8th St. Brooklyn, NY 11230.

column2: • Dairy.
• Traditional pizzeria offering takeaway and delivery services.
• Casual and  family-friendly environment. Seating available inside.
• Located 7 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Heschcher.

column2: • Glatt Kosher takeaway and grocery store.
• Pomegranate is a premier Kosher supermarket dedicated to homemade foods and honest ingredients, they offer a selection of freshly prepared Kosher foods.
• Located at Coney Island Av.  9 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Kehilah Kashrus (Flatbush Community Kashrus Organization) Rabbi Zechariah Adler. 718-951-0481 / 1294 E. 8th St. Brooklyn, NY 11230.

column2: • offering delicious, homemade baked goods straight from our family to yours

• our kosher bakery offers homemade baked goods straight from our family to yours. Whether you’re stopping by for breakfast before work in the morning or picking up a few treats to bring home at night, Kaff’s Bake Shop has something for everyone to enjoy!

<li>At Kaff’s Bake Shop, we use only the finest ingredients as we prepare our pastries, Danishes and cakes fresh each morning. Additionally, we also offer a variety of salads, sandwiches and coffee for breakfast, lunch and take-out throughout the day. Our specials include rotating daily breakfast, weekly cakes and featured Shabbat items.

column1: We invite neighborhood residents and visitors alike to stop by and taste the delicious baked goods we have to offer! Please give us a call with any questions or special orders, then stop by one of our three area locations today to experience Kaff’s Bake Shop for yourself!

11635,The Musket Club,"

Undisclosed location. Dinners. Pioneer in the Kosher supper club industry.

column2: • Glatt Kosher.

• This Kosher gourmet dinner club operates on word-of-mouth. Called, The Musket Club, dinner is served at a different location once monthly. The address is disclosed to diners 72 hours before the event.
• The Musket Club can accommodate 20 guests per dinner. All events are to be announced on their Instagram account and a reservations page will go live on their website following the announcement.

• Spots will be given to the first 20 people to reserve. They do not accept reservations for more than 2 people per party. If you have a large party and would like to experience The Musket Club, please contact them at info@themusketclub.com for more information.
• The menu only comes at the end of the meal.

• All food served by The Musket Club is prepared under strict supervision in accordance with the Kosher dietary laws. Kosher certification is given by a modern Orthodox rabbi who serves in a pluralistic way.
• Menu sample.
• Kashrus.
• The given location directs to the Rabbi's office.

11729,Ice Cream House - Williamsburg,"

Casual store with a huge selection of Kosher ice cream, toppings, bagels and a salad bar.

column2: • All dairy products are Cholov Yisroel.
• Ice Cream House has two other locations: Flatbush and Boro Park.
• Each of the three stores offers a large selection of soft ice cream flavours, with an array of customised toppings.
• Fruits and milkshakes are on their menu too.
• You can choose from non-dairy, dairy, fat-free or sugar-free ice cream.
• Famous for its vegan approved ice creams that are ideal for lactose intolerant consumers.
• In addition to the ice cream, they also offer a buffet-style salad bar and fresh sandwiches.
• Heschcher / Heschcher.

13024,Schnitzi - Coney Island Av.,"

Casual and friendly schnitzel specialist.

column2: • Glatt Kosher restaurant and food truck.
• Schnitzi was established in 2007.
• Their meals are based on childhood lunches and dinners.
• They offer grilled chicken, steak, pastrami, roast beef, and homemade sauces.
• Modern, casual and family-friendly in a contemporary decoration.
• Located 7 miles south of downtown NYC.
• They have another location at Boro Park and a food truck. Check their location clicking the link.
• Heschcher.

11873,Schreiber Home Style Bakery - Boro Park,"

Traditional bakery. Cholov Yisroel dairy.

column2: • Cholov Yisroel dairy. Parve.
• Outstanding bakery with two other locations in Brooklyn: Flatbush and Midwood.
• Check their products here.
• This store is located at 14th av., Boro Park, 10 miles south of downtown NYC.
• No seating available.
• Offering takeaway and delivery services.
• Kehilah Kashrus (Flatbush Community Kashrus Organization) Rabbi Zechariah Adler. 718-951-0481 / 1294 E. 8th St. Brooklyn, NY 11230.

column1:
11762,Pescada Carne - Brooklyn,"

Fine dining restaurant with Glatt-focused menu.

column2: • Glatt Kosher menu.
• Brooklyn's newest fine dining restaurant. Part of the Pescada New York family, offering an extensive and well developed menu.
• Formal environment, good for business meetings and couples.
• Located 9 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Hechsher.

11503,Kaff's Bake Shop - Brooklyn Flatbush Ave. M,"

Traditional dairy, Yoshon bakery.

column2: • Dairy. Yoshon traditional bakery.
• They sell all baked favourites.
• No seating. Takeaway only.
• They have other two locations: Boro Park and Flatbush Ave. J.
• Heschcher.

11557,Kingston Bake Shop,"

Cholov Yisroel bakery and sushi. Family-friendly environment.

column2: • Cholov Yisroel and Pas Yisroel.
• A bakery on the corner of Crown, offering good knishes, pastries, and even sushi.
• Casual environment suitable for families.
• Located 5 miles southeast of downtown NYC.
• Hechsher.

12979,Chocolatte - Eastern Pkwy Brooklyn,"

Modern cafe offering roasted coffee, smoothies, breakfast & sandwiches.

column2: • Dairy.
• Serving Brooklyn since 2013, Chocolatte is a cafe and espresso bar offering locally roasted coffee and fresh, gourmet Kosher food.
• Modern and contemporary environment, great place for family, groups or solo dining.
• Located 6 miles south-east of downtown NYC.
• They have another store at Av. J Coney Island, Brooklyn.
• Heschcher.

13095,Bagels n greens - 18th. Avenue,"

Unfortunately, this business closed due to the COVID-19 Pandemic.

column2: • Dairy.
• This place is an exclusive Kosher café and salad bar chain providing a healthy & European style experience with a rich and varied menu.
• They prepare gourmet goodies styled with elegance and distinction, such as the artistically crafted prestige baskets that you can give as gifts for your dear and beloved ones.
• Check their menu here.
• Heschcher.

12877,Orchidea,"

Popular lunch buffet, all you can eat, late night service.

column2: • Dairy. Parve.
• Orchidea is at Borough Park but feels like a five-star Manhattan restaurant.
• The establishment is decorated with style and bursting with substance.
• Everything is done with class and quality. Waiters in white gloves welcome you and read off the menu specials with diligence. Every dish is designed with dazzling creativity and presentation.
• Great decoration, dressy environment.
• Located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Hashgacha.

column2: • Dairy.
• Nu Cafe is a casual dining restaurant. Serving for more than 8 years.
• They offer a romantic atmosphere and home-like setting.
• Offering from familiar comfort foods to restricted diet specialities.
• Here you can enjoy breakfast, soup, pasta, panini, salad, fish, appetisers, pizza, and desserts.
• Reservations are not recommended as seating is ample.
• Located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Heschcher.

13047,Deli 52,"

Casual and family friendly, deli and Chinese restaurant.

column2: • Glatt Kosher restaurant.
• At this place, you can eat-in, takeaway or have a free delivery.
• Casual environment and a basic lunch deli.
• They serve big hefty sandwiches,  wings & a variety of Chinese dishes.
• You can have a breakfast too.
• Located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Heschcher.

12033,Jerusalem Pizza - Brooklyn,"

Traditional Kosher pizzeria, established in the 80's.

column2: • Dairy restaurant with a varied menu.
• Delivery and takeaway services available.
• Located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Kehilah Kashrus (Flatbush Community Kashrus Organization) Rabbi Zechariah Adler. 718-951-0481 / 1294 E. 8th St. Brooklyn, NY 11230.

11912,Olympia Pita,"

Glatt restaurant with a contemporary environment.

column2: • Glatt Kosher.

• Great decoration and contemporary environment.
• Their menu includes speciality items such as Moroccan cigars, lamb chops, Yemenite soup, grilled steaks, and more.
• Check their menu here.
• Located 9 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Kehilah Kashrus (Flatbush Community Kashrus Organization) Rabbi Zechariah Adler. 718-951-0481 / 1294 E. 8th St. Brooklyn, NY 11230.

11946,Masbia Soup Kitchen Network - Masbia of Flatbush,"

Non-profit organisation.

column2: • Glatt Kosher.
• Masbia is a nonprofit soup kitchen network and food pantry.
• Providing hot, nutritious meals every day for hundreds of New Yorkers in desperate need of food.
• Alongside their hot-meal programme, they also give out bags of much-needed groceries every week to those with not enough at home, through their weekend take-home package program.

• Masbia works to not only feed the hungry, but to provide free, wholesome, and delicious meals for people in a restaurant-style environment, with volunteer waiters serving each person with respect and dignity.
• For information on dinner guidelines, click here.
• For donations, click here.
• This store is located 8 miles south of downtown NYC.

• Located 9 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Hechsher.

11968,Kosher Hut of Brooklyn,"

Casual pizzeria suitable for families.

column2: • Dairy. Parve.
• This place is a casual pizzeria with fairly good food.
• Based on customers' reviews the pizza is pretty good when it's fresh from the oven, but not as good when it gets reheated.
• They also have a special offers, such as a family deal. You can get a pie with a few portions of french fries.
• Located 10 miles south of downtown NYC.
• Kehilah Kashrus (Flatbush Community Kashrus Organization) Rabbi Zechariah Adler. 718-951-0481 / 1294 E. 8th St. Brooklyn, NY 11230.

column2: • This place is permanently closed.

column1:
3389,Lox Cafe,"

A Kosher cafe located inside the Jewish Heritage Museum.

column2: • Enjoy a fresh take on old world favourites with a menu that features in-house cured salmon in a variety of ways including Pastrami-style with a house blend; wasabi, ginger, sake, and soy infused; double-smoked; and more.

• LOX Cafe is located at the Museum of Jewish Heritage overlooking the scenic Battery Park City. It offers a unique combination of old-world Jewish and Russian cuisines created by Chef David Teyf, the owner of LOX Cafe.
• He brings tradition to the forefront highlighting the natural beauty of his ingredients with a wonderfully minimalistic aesthetic, just as his grandfather once did.
• Come in for a quick bite or stay and enjoy outdoor seating with amazing views, either way LOX is sure to be your favourite dining destination.
