3405,La Brochette,"

Upscale steakhouse showcasing dry-aged beef, veal & sushi in an elegant, multifloor setting.

column2: • Avi Cohen has always dreamed of owning an upscale restaurant that serves nothing but the best ingredients.
• His dream came true in December 2013, with his La Brochette steakhouse becoming the latest addition to Manhattan’s fine dining scene.
• The name “La Brochette” which means “skewer” in French, gracefully combines the owner’s Middle Eastern roots with French culinary sophistication.
• La Brochette undertook mulit-million renovations of the space formerly occupied by another Kosher restaurant on Midtown's East side, where upscale Kosher restaurants are hard to come by.
• The elegant restaurant boasts 5 dining rooms on 3 levels with the top floor featuring a skylight.
• Although the restaurant is large, the setting is intimate. The neutrally-hued décor features chandeliers and candle-lit mahogany tables, yet the streamlined design has a contemporary feel to it.

column1: ",,,,https://scontent-iad3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.6435-9/69313953_2409962782420022_2002486286526447616_n.jpg?_nc_cat=110&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=e3f864&_nc_ohc=f82V2h2ibegAX8JYmcb&_nc_ht=scontent-iad3-2.xx&oh=2a77911bc0f78e94cdba818d95038c8c&oe=61D2055A https://labrochetteny.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/202944332_330347338768099_2579520604029908161_n.jpg https://labrochetteny.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/204424045_330347168768116_2914639525184956752_n.jpg,,,,Restaurant,Meat,"340 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA",North America,USA,,New York,Manhattan,,moderate,40.7498553,-73.9774364,OU,https://oukosher.org/restaurants/,+1 212-972-2200,http://labrochetteny.com/,info@labrochetteny.com,https://www.facebook.com/labrochetteny/,https://www.instagram.com/labrochettenyc/,monday,custom,12:00,22:30,custom,"a:1:{i:0;s:5:""12:00"";}","a:1:{i:0;s:5:""22:30"";}",custom,"a:1:{i:0;s:5:""12:00"";}","a:1:{i:0;s:5:""22:30"";}",custom,"a:1:{i:0;s:5:""12:00"";}","a:1:{i:0;s:5:""22:30"";}",closed,,,closed,,,custom,"a:1:{i:0;s:5:""12:00"";}",15/9/2017,20/7/2021,,,,

3355,Mr. Broadway,"

Contemporary deli with a variety of Kosher cuisine including sushi, American & Chinese dishes.

column2: • Mr. Broadway is accordingly Kosher certified O.U. Glatt.

• Since 1922, Mr. Broadway has become a landmark for Kosher food lovers. The cool vibe and contemporary menu offers guests what co-owners Yuval Zarai and Moti Zilber call “a modern twist on traditional Jewish Cuisine”.
• After a gut renovation in 2013 with a new beer & wine bar and flat screen TVs, this restaurant-sports bar is in the centre of all action.
• Whilst lunch is busy with businessmen and women, the service is efficient so you can have a relaxing lunch without the long wait.
• After Lunch, Happy Hour begins at the bar with half priced tap beer and wine accompanied by delicious appetisers such as the Angus Beef Sliders, and  BBQ Boneless Wings.
• Mr. Broadway offers catering for all occasions from simple office gatherings and sheva brachot, to elaborate dinners and elegant events of over 300 people.
• In fact, they are proud to be the official caterer of the Israel consulate and the UN Israeli ambassador office.
• They also have one of the largest delivery businesses in size and popularity, delivering as far out as the Bronx, Long Island City and Jersey City.

3464,Colbeh - Manhattan,"

Kosher Persian kebabs, rice & dips join a full sushi menu at this stylish, multi-room restaurant.

column2: • A couple of years ago, Colbeh Manhattan moved just a few buildings down the block, but it looks like they moved to a different world.
• Beautiful nightclub colours and large, spacious rooms offer patrons an elegant escape from the outside frenetic pace of the Manhattan streets.
• Perfectly located in the centre of Midtown, it is close to all the excitement of Times Square and Broadway theatres.
• With Persian cuisine, Colbeh is a refreshing change of pace.  The menu will tantalise your palate with truly authentic dishes in a harmonious blend of unusual spices and flavours.
• The professional staff greets each customer personally, which immediately makes guests feel right at home.
• They are always attentive and attend to each diner’s personal needs.  This “there is nothing we can’t do” attitude is evident from the very beginning.
• Colbeh aims to offer each client a memorable time for the indisputable quality, expert preparation and beautiful presentation.
• First time clients discover a new meaning to catered Persian cuisine.  Regular customers enjoy the depth of Colbeh's culinary knowledge and imagination.
•  Few eateries in the area can assure guests the romantic ambience and charm found here.
• Other locations: Colbeh - Great Neck and Colbeh - Roslyn.

17437,Patis Bakery,"

Located inside the lobby of the Arthouse Hotel.

column2: • Did we miss anything? Let us know in the comments below!
• Have you been here before? Share your tips with us!
• Are you the owner? Claim your listing!

column1:
3512,Abigael's on Broadway,"

A global Kosher menu spans from short ribs to sushi at this upscale bi-level restaurant.

column2: • Abigael’s on Broadway is one of New York’s oldest and most prestigious Kosher restaurants, emphasising the global flavours of modern America, whilst setting a new standard in Kosher cuisine.

• Abigael’s is a casually elegant two level restaurant that can seat up to 350 guests.  With an array of specialities that are surprisingly Kosher, such as:  American fare, Latin comfort foods, sushi and Pan Asian.
• The restaurant has an impressive following that includes not only Kosher diners, but many non-Kosher clientele as well.
• Abigael’s specialises in supplying many of the areas’ finest restaurants, hotels and arenas with supplemental Kosher meals.
• Their off-premise Supplemental Meals Program is one of the most sought after throughout New York City and nation-wide.
• Click here for the virtual tour!

3525,Taam Tov,"

No-frills Kosher Uzbeki restaurant perched above busy jewellery stalls in the Diamond District.

column2: • Taam Tov offers delicious dining, takeaway and delivery to New York, NY.
• This restaurant is a cornerstone in the New York community and has been recognised for its outstanding Chinese cuisine, excellent service and friendly staff.
• Known for its modern interpretation of classic dishes and its insistence on only using high quality fresh ingredients.

column1: ",,,,https://scontent-iad3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t31.18172-8/330811_263118463798470_1752702945_o.jpg?_nc_cat=103&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=09cbfe&_nc_ohc=7pLuwQ92B-0AX8RvGcB&_nc_ht=scontent-iad3-2.xx&oh=0244cd7490f1f5c0de08bf7b7f9d0359&oe=61D23577 https://scontent-iad3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.18169-9/385928_367202436723405_1973824401_n.jpg?_nc_cat=103&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=9267fe&_nc_ohc=ROCxq-rAEOMAX8P4kDu&tn=8xwR0EZvVxQK3iol&_nc_ht=scontent-iad3-2.xx&oh=f28c74e202d56bd784e12a2422857ce1&oe=61D30C06 https://scontent-iad3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.18169-9/11147179_683588035084842_5777801638369783243_n.jpg?_nc_cat=109&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=8bfeb9&_nc_ohc=L7hu7zpo0lYAX9qqeUp&_nc_ht=scontent-iad3-2.xx&oh=8e7efea918a9ba499b78039e78f878b8&oe=61D31072,,,,Restaurant,Meat,"41 W 47th St, New York, NY 10036, USA",North America,USA,,New York,Manhattan,,moderate,40.7577383,-73.9805065,OU,https://oukosher.org/restaurants/,+1 212-768-8001,http://www.taamtovnyc.com,info@taamtovny.com,https://www.facebook.com/TaamTovNYC/,https://www.instagram.com/taamtovnyc/,monday,custom,11:00,"a:1:{i:0;s:5:""20:00"";}",custom,"a:1:{i:0;s:5:""11:00"";}","a:1:{i:0;s:5:""20:00"";}",custom,"a:1:{i:0;s:5:""11:00"";}","a:1:{i:0;s:5:""20:00"";}",custom,"a:1:{i:0;s:5:""11:00"";}","a:1:{i:0;s:5:""20:00"";}",custom,"a:1:{i:0;s:5:""11:00"";}","a:1:{i:0;s:5:""14:00"";}",closed,,,closed,,14/9/2017,22/7/2021,,,,

3417,Grill 212,"

Unfortunately, this business closed due to the COVID-19 Pandemic.
Low-key spot doles out falafel & other Kosher Middle Eastern eats in a snug basement setting.

column2: • Tucked away on 80th Street between Amsterdam Ave and Broadway on Manhattan’s Upper West Side, there is a quaint little oasis of authentic Middle Eastern and Yemenite cuisine, called Grill 212.
• It is hard to call it a secret oasis though, with so many consistently high ratings from reviewers on Yelp and all over the Web.
• Israeli-born Moshe and Riki Damti opened the restaurant in August 2012, inspired by their love for cooking and baking.
• The traditional menu is complemented by a décor which is both contemporary and rustic, with a brick wall, dark wood furniture and still life paintings on peach-coloured walls.
• The atmosphere is friendly and homey, in a way that only a small family restaurant can offer.
• The restaurant serves brunch menu, with such favourites as Melawach and Shakshoka, and it is a great choice for a tasty Shabbat takeaway.
• In addition, they offer free delivery, online ordering, and can expertly cater your affair, large or small.

3424,Great American Health Bar,"

Healthful food like omelets, wraps & baked potatoes served in a diner-style setting.

column2: • If you're searching for a quick and wholesome meal in Midtown, look no further than The Great American Health Bar.

• It's near Central Park (perfect for a take-out lunch)and just below Cafe Classico. Whether you're in the area catching a live taping of The Late Show with Stephen Colbert, or attending a concert at Carnegie Hall, you don't have too far to schlep to get here.
• The location makes it easy to get to from Columbus Circle, and the Plaza Hotel. And it's just a few blocks from Broadway.

• This place it's been around for over 25 years, it's also one of the only dairy waiter service Kosher restaurants in Midtown. Don't be surprised if you find yourself rubbing shoulders with a big shot.

• Celebrities and models often visit Great American for their meals. During the day, the restaurant gets many individuals from the business world for lunch, and many nearby office buildings order their meals from the Great American Health Bar.

column2: • Chef Michael Gershkovich was born in Rome, Italy in 1974 to Russian parents on their way to the United States. He grew up in Flatbush, Brooklyn as a part of an orthodox Jewish family.

• Chef Michael went to the famed Culinary Institute of America, in Hyde Park, New York. At the CIA, Mike saw and tasted many different cuisines. He mastered techniques from around the world, always with a mind to bend them to his own purposes.

column1: Visiting this restaurant is like coming over to Mike’s house for dinner. Family is everywhere, welcoming you at the door, cooking your food, serving your drinks. Mike visits as many tables as he can each evening, mostly to talk about the food. This is his dream come true, his passion and his life. The fences have been rebuilt, and this grass is definitely greener.

• Have you been here before? Share your tips with us!

Weekday-only Kosher cafe with options ranging from sandwiches & salads to hot entrees & desserts.

column2: •  Glatt Kosher. Pas Yisroel.
• Since 1994, Classico has been providing Manhattan businesses and tourists alike, a place where one can get large portions for reasonable Manhattan prices.
• For lunch, the restaurant’s staff is quick to get out dozens of lunch orders for nearby businesses as well as take care of the patrons who come in for lunch meetings or shopping breaks.
• They are just blocks away from Central Park, Carnegie Hall, MOMA, Trump Tower and all 5th Avenue stores.

• For the evening hours, Classico morphs into a romantic and elegant venue. With soft Italian or French music playing in the background, it’s a perfect spot for a date or an ideal locale for that after-work escape.
• Whether for lunch or dinner, prime seats are the ones near the window where you can overlook busy 57th Street filled with people walking to their next destination.
• A sense of calmness falls over you since you know you’re relaxed and ready for a fantastic meal. They have a large and varied menu, so there something for everyone.

• The restaurant is known for their “Sandwich Board” with dozens of selections of over-sized sandwiches and burgers. In fact, the owners are very passionate about their sandwiches. Each sandwich gets special attention down to the right bread going with the right meat.
• City wide delivery and fine corporate and social catering are a big part of their business. Private parties such as Sheva Brachos and birthdays parties are welcomed and encouraged.
• With your VIP card: Choice of appetiser or soup after 3pm with entree ordered.

13054,Kish Kash,"

No Kosher certification. Opens on Shabbat.

column2: • They do not have a Kosher certification and they open on Shabbat.
• Kish-Kash, the newest concept by New York City’s leading Israeli/Middle Eastern Chef and restaurateur, Einat Admony, opened at 455 Hudson Street on June 18, 2018.

• Named for the sieve traditionally used to make couscous, Kish-Kash is the first-ever couscous bar in New York City specialising in hand-rolled, hand-sieved Moroccan couscous and authentic North African Jewish cuisine.
• Kish-Kash is a casual dining concept with a specialised menu featuring real Moroccan couscous, braised meats, fish, salads, challah, pickled veggies, and wines from Israel and North Africa.
• All meat dishes are Kosher.

3326,Pitopia,"

Vibrant Mediterranean cafe offers pita sandwiches, a hummus bar & a range of self-serve toppings.

column2: • Falafel is taking over New York, one menu at a time. Pitopia’s co-owner, Kevin Cohnen says his hummus bar came about after a visit to Netanya, Israel where a friend had him try his falafel ball recipe and as they say ""the rest is history.""
• In fact, competing with non-Kosher joints in the category, they earned the title of the Best Falafel 2013 in Midtown Manhattan based on readers' voting on MidtownLunch.com.
• While the restaurant is small and perfect for takeaway, its food is huge in flavour. The house speciality is the Israeli-style falafel, which comes with fried eggplant, Israeli salad and pickles.
• Connoisseurs say their falafel is “the real thing”- crunchy on the outside with a flavourful soft center, everything one would want from a falafel ball.
• The salad bar is clean and colourful featuring a wide variety of expected Middle Eastern salads and sides.

• It includes fresh Israeli salad, fried and steamed cauliflower, chickpeas, beets, cabbage and an assortment of others that need to be refilled every half hour due to the hustle and bustle of this falafel oasis.
• The hummus bar is a smorgasbord of toppings to mix into the house-made hummus. You have everything from sautéed onions and peppers to hardboiled egg which is a big hit.

• Another customers’ favourite is the crispy non-oily Sabich, otherwise known as tempura egg-battered aubergine (eggplant) that is fried up and served either in a sandwich or part of a salad/hummus bowl.

3452,Eden Wok,"

Chinese staples like dumplings & Hunan chicken are matched with sushi & sashimi in a casual setting.

column2: • Eden Wok, believe it or not, is the only dine-in, Chinese Kosher restaurant in all of Manhattan, and you will be pleasantly amazed by the taste and efficiency they have been famous for.
• Opened since 2006 by owner Kevin Cohnen, Eden Wok offers authentic Chinese and sushi in a friendly and peaceful environment.
• The restaurant has a simple decor and is perfect for those looking to eat and relax.
• Located in the centre of Midtown, the restaurant has a very reasonable lunch special with plenty of hot meat and vegetarian soups.

• Eden Wok also offers Asian sandwiches in a pita, such as chicken, spice steak and sino steak.  Of course, they have all your favourite Chinese dishes, all of which can be made with your diet requests.
• Since Summer 2016, Eden Wok shares their space with Koshe Poke, a takeaway restaurant considered one of the best places in the city to grab a poke bowl (raw fish salad) for lunch or dinner.

column2: • Prime dry-aged steaks, Japanese-inspired signature dishes and delectable seafood and sushi.
• Award-winning Chef Hok Chin.
• Innovative cuisine. Glatt meat.
• Features lighting displays and ceremonial presentation.
• Wine and liquor/cocktail experience.
• Prime ingredients.

column1: ",,,,https://scontent-iad3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.6435-9/69145459_778326662610445_2481111021016580096_n.jpg?_nc_cat=101&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=2c4854&_nc_ohc=KhWMw1DU8t4AX_jg41Y&_nc_ht=scontent-iad3-2.xx&oh=313f399923001de537271381451f3546&oe=61D0F5E2 https://scontent-iad3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.6435-9/65215104_743493072760471_75393722769997824_n.jpg?_nc_cat=101&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=730e14&_nc_ohc=46SbCxXx10oAX8l5kdP&_nc_ht=scontent-iad3-2.xx&oh=54536732ffeac72a05e4cc9df5ebcc79&oe=61D14741 https://scontent-iad3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.6435-9/69014334_772429456533499_440741246038704128_n.jpg?_nc_cat=104&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=730e14&_nc_ohc=D28Pq-bNnBMAX8yE2GS&tn=8xwR0EZvVxQK3iol&_nc_ht=scontent-iad3-2.xx&oh=fac3a53bb0fd85f751a1a14a70e2307c&oe=61CF6D1D,,,,"Food,Cafe,Delivery/Pickup,Restaurant",Meat,"845 United Nations Plaza, New York, NY 10017, USA",North America,USA,,New York,Manhattan,,ultra,40.7525229,-73.9676966,OU,https://oukosher.org/restaurants/,+1 212-223-1801,http://www.unplazagrill.com/,management@unplazagrill.com,https://www.facebook.com/UNPlazaGrill/,https://www.instagram.com/unplazagrill/,monday,custom,17:00,"a:1:{i:0;s:5:""22:00"";}",custom,"a:1:{i:0;s:5:""17:00"";}","a:1:{i:0;s:5:""22:00"";}",custom,"a:1:{i:0;s:5:""17:00"";}","a:1:{i:0;s:5:""22:00"";}",custom,"a:1:{i:0;s:5:""17:00"";}","a:1:{i:0;s:5:""22:00"";}",closed,,,closed,,,custom,"a:1:{i:0;s:5:""17:00"";}",22/9/2017,20/7/2021,,,,

3499,Bedford on Park,"

Family and social dining featuring community inspired sharable plates and signature cuts of steak.

column2: • With the success and prosperity of Bedford Kitchen in Queens, the Bedford family opened its sister restaurant in midtown Manhattan.
• This luxurious, classy, modern steakhouse located in the back of Mendy’s on 34th street, opened its doors in November 2016.

• Alex Falco is the executive chef and this is his first experience in the Kosher culinary world. A graduate of Oxford Culinary School in England, Falco is bringing a whimsical twist on new American.  His style is called creative New American.
• Signature items like the Smoked Tongue Hash,  and Filet Oscar (eye of rib instead of “filet mignon”) are sure to please your palate.
• With the majority of Bedford on Park’s meat being smoked, you cannot say you have experienced Bedford on Park until you try the Smoked Dino Ribs served with cornbread and coleslaw.

• Stopping by for drinks? Bedford on Park focuses strongly on their craft beer and wine selections. If wine is more your speed they have a full cellar of high-end wines. Perfect for any date night or celebration.

• The owners want their customers to feel like they’re at home each time they walk through their doors. Therefore, they created a relaxed atmosphere that provides for an ideal setting to sit back, relax and enjoy the great meal you’re looking for!

column1: ",,,,,,,,Restaurant,Meat,"61 E 34th St, New York, NY 10016, USA",North America,USA,,New York,Manhattan,,moderate,40.7473863,-73.9816448,OU,https://oukosher.org/restaurants/,+1 212-576-1515,http://www.bedfordkitchen.com,steven@bedfordkitchen.com,https://www.facebook.com/bedfordonpark/,https://www.instagram.com/bedfordonpark/,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,14/9/2017,22/7/2021,,,,

3373,Mike's Bistro,"

A seasonal Kosher menu, plus nightly 7-course & vegetarian tasting menus.

column2: • Mike's Bistro was opened 10 years ago with the intention of bringing the standards of Kosher dining in line with the best restaurants in the city.

• In fact, the restaurant received a “24” in food and “22” in service in the 2013 Zagat Survey stating: “Kosher food gets the ‘gourmet’ treatment at this Upper Westsider where the eponymous chef-owner turns out ‘delicious’ New American dishes; ‘wonderful service’ and ‘Mike going from table to table’ adds value.”
• Indeed, when one visits the new Mike's Bistro location, the primary goal is to relax and trust the Chef to help plan an excellent meal.
• As the restaurant has blossomed over the years, the growth and development of the menu is remarkable.
• Kosher diners bring non-Kosher friends to Mike's tables, demonstrating the fulfillment of Mike's goal with satisfied expressions all around.

• The Bistro is perfect for dates, family get-togethers, parties and weddings. Guests are offered three choices for seating:  a sunny and private atrium, a spacious and stylish dining room and an upstairs area with hidden tables and high ceilings. Each can be rented or reserved for a special occasion.
• If you want a particular table, be sure to let them know early because the Bistro can fill up quite quickly!  There is also an amply stocked bar full of premium liquors and scotches.
• Several top-notch wines have found their way to the list; so one can enjoy a meal with affordable merlot or splurge on exceptional cabernet.

12630,By Chloe,"

Certified vegan restaurant, but opens on Shabbat.

column2: • Vegan restaurants with different locations in the US and UK.
• The UK location is not certified kosher.
• All stores opens on Shabbat and have no mashgiach on premises.
• For all general inquiries and/or immediate assistance, it’s best to email hello@eatbychloe.com for all USA related inquiries.

3382,MexiKosher NYC,"

Fast-casual spot for Kosher Mexican food, including build-your-own tacos, burritos & bowls.
""I did not pick Kosher, Kosher picked me"" - Chef Katsuji Tanabe

column2: • Mexikosher NYC is New York’s first authentic Kosher Mexican restaurant and renowned Chef Katsuji Tanabe’s sequel to his first similarly themed restaurant in LA.

• This hot spot is located in Manhattan’s Upper West Side and opened in August of 2016. The simple space with red and black accents lends itself well to the casual, fast-paced, Mexico City-Meets-Manhattan feel.
• Here, patrons build their own tacos, burritos and Mexican bowls with savoury proteins, vibrant toppings and a surprisingly large array of sauces.

• Your tolerance for heat and whether or not you’re a cilantro-hater or lover matters not, as you are in the driver’s seat and may control how little or how much spice and which herbs are put into your dish.
• Pull up one of the bar-stools and enjoy your meal, or have it packed to-go and make your office mates wonder what smells so wonderful.

3233,Talia's Steakhouse,"

A wide-ranging menu, live music & sidewalk cafe seats lure diners to this Glatt Kosher steakhouse.

column2: • Has a large sidewalk cafe which is a best dining spot during summer.
• Serves Glatt Kosher, prepaid, prix fixe, Friday night Shabbat dinner and Jewish holiday meals.
• Live music with no cover charge every Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday nights.
• Open Saturday nights about 1 hour after Shabbat till 4AM with live music.
• Talia’s Steakhouse is always on the cutting edge ofAll Listings restaurant service, offering perks that keep customers coming back for more.
• From a Kosher “cheese” burger that attracts much media attention, to the spanking new recession-proof menu, owner Ephraim Nagar knows how to give you a good time.
• Mr. Nagar opened the restaurant in 2002 in memory of his daughter Talia, designating it as a centre for constructive gatherings, quality Kosher food and happy memories.

• As you enter, you are greeted by the strains of mellow music, often live, that instantly transforms your mood. Dark woods are accented beautifully with red banquettes and illuminated exposed brick. Combine that with dim lighting and flickering candles and you have the perfect setting for a romantic dinner or a business meeting gone right.
• In addition, paintings with Kabbalistic-looking, whimsical letters that spell out the word Talia in Hebrew add the perfect touch.

3439,Eighteen,"

A no-frills Glatt Kosher restaurant with an eclectic menu of deli favourites, grilled meats & sushi.

column2: • Located on the Upper East Side, Eighteen restaurant is owned by power couple Sidney and Tammy Cohen.
• Renovated in early 2014 and revamped itself into a hip and modern steak, burger, & sushi experience.
• Since opening in May 2010, it has been a memorable spot because of its symbolism in the Jewish religion – “18” numerically in Hebrew is Chai, meaning “Life”.

• Lunch and dinner is served for families, couples, and business hipsters alike. Influenced by the NYC Downtown vibe, contemporary wood décor (custom made and shipped from Mexico) and candle lit tables, the restaurant provides affordability with comfort; you can even ask for the cozy couch seating in the back!

3433,West side wok,"

Gan Asia changed its name to West Side Wok. Still Kosher.

column2: • Gan Asia changed its name to West Side Wok. Still Kosher.
• For two decades, Gan Asia has been tirelessly putting forth the pinnacle of Chinese & Thai Glatt Kosher takeaway.

3401,Le Marais,"

Prime steaks headline a French-influenced menu at this restaurant & butcher shop.

column2: • Without sounding over the top, Le Marais is simply one of the best Kosher steakhouses in the country.
• Approaching two decades, Le Marais, which is named for a Jewish neighbourhood in Paris, has been attracting dates, business people, tourists and theatre goers alike.
• Earning a very good “22” Zagat ranking, the guide exclaims “the quality meats happens to be Kosher...a convenient provider of delicious beef at fair prices.”
• Indeed, their cuisine, especially their steaks, are world renowned as they buy their meat straight from a master butcher who supplies them with the best selections.
• With a specific aging process, their customers are assured of getting the finest quality cuts. They are certainly on par with any non-Kosher steakhouse.

• Owner Jose Meirelles, reflects on the establishment history: “When we opened the restaurant almost 20 years ago, there was a lack of kosher restaurants that knew how to properly age their meats. We offered the Jewish customer something that they never had before.”
• In a turn-of-the-century French style wooden decor, the restaurant offers their guests a casual yet classy atmosphere.
• For your convenience, this rare steakhouse, well done, offers space for private meetings and parties in their upstairs dining room.
• Along with his rustic cooking, Long Island-born, Executive Chef, Mark Hennessey brings his C.I.A. training and years of Kosher restaurant experience to Le Marais.
• What most people come for, Mark says, are the “La Surprise”- their butcher's cut and Tournedos Le Marais with bearnaise sauce.
• Creative daily lunch and dinner specials are commonly found on the menu, so be sure to visit often.
• Le Marais also features one of the largest international wine lists of any Kosher restaurant, including many special bourbons, whiskeys, single malt and scotch selections.

3348,NY Brat Factory,"

Unfortunately, this business closed due to the COVID-19 Pandemic.
Tiny sausage specialist for bratwurst, hot dogs & American favourites like sandwiches & burgers.

column2: • Hankering for some homemade sausage and pastrami? You’ve found your spot at the NY Brat Factory.
• This sausage mecca opened in May of 2016 and is situated in a vibrant section of the Upper West Side, on the corner of West 106th and Amsterdam, just a few blocks front the Broadway subway stop.
• Funny thing about the name - it’s called Brat Factory because, well, it’s an actual Brat Factory! Bratwurst, that is. And its lovable cousin, pastrami.
• The truth is, it is so much more than just a sausage factory. This is a complete deli, elevated with craftsmanship.
• Its small and homey setting lends itself well to relishing a quick and savoury bite or picking up a feast of all things deli.

• Seating is somewhat limited as their focus is takeaway, delivery, and catering, but they do provide a lovely view to people watch as you sit on one of the 8 or 9 seats positioned along a large window.
• The gorgeously rustic décor matches the natural, pure flavours found in their food led by Chef Meir Levy.

• NY Brat Factory fills a niche in the Kosher NYC food scene and fulfills a long-time dream of owner Jon Katz, of creating and serving authentic, fresh sausage and pastrami to Kosher eaters in the New York region.
• Full menu here.

3550,2nd Ave Deli - Midtown East,"

Ask your rabbi if Cup-K is acceptable for you.

column2: • Even though the certifying rabbi is orthodox, we found that most Orthodox Kosher consumers do not trust it.
• Some of the leniencies Rabbi Israel Mayer Steinberg uses are: No mashguiach, and the restaurant being open on Shabbat.
• CUP-K does not have a website.
• Online forums are full of people who had negative experiences with the CUP-K.
• This restaurant's certification does not have an expiration date, which is unusual.
• Please check with your rabbi first.

• Upon arriving in America and not even speaking the language, Abe’s took his first job in a Coney Island deli, where he was employed as a soda jerk. During lunch breaks, he volunteered to help out behind the counter, to better observe the restaurant’s operation. He soon graduated to the coveted position of counterman.
• Over the next few years, he worked in a number of deli kitchens, learning the secrets of superb pastrami and other traditional Jewish delicacies.
• Abe’s dream of success in America was a reality. He loved people, he loved food, he loved his restaurant, he loved New York and New York loved Abe.

• On March 4, 1996, Abe was murdered on route to the bank to make a deposit. All New York mourned his death. Abe’s widow Eleanor, daughter Sharon, and brother Jack decided to keep Abe’s dream alive. The deli remained opened until January 2006 when it closed its doors due to a dispute with its landlord.

7156,Kosher in Midtown,"

Fast-paced restaurant with a variety of cuisines in NYC.

column2: • Kosher in Midtown is a fast-paced Kosher restaurant with a variety of cuisines.
• Available options are: Mediterranean, Chinese, Hawaiian, sushi, Teriyaki chicken, buffalo wings, sushi donuts, and more.
• Located in the middle of Midtown at 43 East 34 street.
• Neighbours of the Empire State Building.
• This restaurant looks like it could become your go-to choice for Kosher food.
<li>They advertise online menus with over 100 dishes from:
• Eden Wok – Offering Chinese cuisine paired with sushi & sashimi.
• Koshe Poke – Preparing Hawaiian customizable poke bowls, burritos & salads.
• Pitopia – Having New York city’s authentic famous falafel, grilled chicken, & schnitzel.
• Buffalo2go – The original Kosher buffalo wing.
• Teriyaki Wok – Japanese teriyaki chicken.
• Sushi Donut Shop – Trendy twist. Sushi Rolls shaped as a donut shape and topped with your choice of vegetables and fish.
• You can contact them directly here.

Exposed brick, dark woods & an open kitchen set a casual backdrop for Kosher steakhouse fare.

column2: • W&L is owned and operated by a Shomer Shabbat family.
• All of our meats are Glatt Kosher (Chassidishe Shechita). All breads are Pas Yisroel. All wines are Mevushal.
• Located in the heart of the Diamond and Hotel districts, Wolf & Lamb Steakhouse is an established and impressive restaurant.
• It is a great find for tourists and the perfect place for business meetings and corporate events.
• Alluringly lit with exposed brick and gilded mirrors, the aroma of grilled meats and the sounds of smooth Jazz greets you at the door.

• Wolf and Lamb's experienced culinary team is led by the talented Chef Luis Escamilla. Presenting a menu of classic dishes, as well as dishes highlighting seasonal flavours reinterpreted with a fresh perspective, Luis leads with a fierce passion for food and hospitality.

• Escamilla is constantly reimagining classics with his unique unparalleled style.  Pastry Chef Marco Alejos, formerly of Tavern on the Green, artfully prepares decadent desserts including fantastic seasonal cakes, tarts and pastries for in house dining as well as special order delivery and catering.

Beyond Sushi in New York City’s leading vegan restaurant chain, best known for our innovative plant-based offerings. Our diverse options are kosher certified and packed with robust flavor and superior ingredients. On the menu, you’ll find globally-inspired dishes that will leave a lasting impact on both your palette and the planet. Beyond Sushi has five locations across Manhattan, offering a full-service dining experience along with takeout and delivery.

column2: • Vegan Restaurant
• Reservations
• Our catering division, City Roots, brings our forward-thinking culinary perspective to events across NYC with full-service and drop-off catering for any occasion.

3493,Bravo Kosher Pizza,"

Basic, no-frills pizzeria with Kosher pies & slices ranging from simple to creatively topped.

column2: • The owners of Bravo Pizza & Poke want to share their family's passion for pizza with you.
• They bring you authentic pizza made from the finest ingredients: fresh basil, olive oil, San Marzano ripe tomatoes & fresh mozzarella.
• Their pastas are homemade and they hope that you will enjoy the quality and great taste of their food as much as the family does.

• In 1985, they created their original recipe and opened a small pizza shop. When their pizza got rave reviews they expanded. As their customers keep coming back for more and spreading the word to others, they continue to grow.
• If you can't make it to them, they'll come to you! Order online and they'll deliver right to your home or office.

15916,Backyard BBQ,"

Smoked ribs & brisket, plus steak & seafood, served in a plank-walled storefront with a bar.

column2: • Walk into Backyard BBQ & Brew and be transported. The long, dark wood bar, wood paneled walls and handcrafted wooden chairs will take you from the middle of Miami to the wild, wild West.
• Just a few blocks away from the beach, this Surfside restaurant is the perfect place to go after a long day of fun in the sun.
• Backyard BBQ and Brew, true to its name, also has an impressive selection of wine and beer, with ten beers on tap, featuring beers from Miami’s own Wynwood Brewing Company.
• Whether you live in Florida or are there on vacation, let Backyard BBQ & Brew take care of you.
• For more information click here.

3755,Zayde's Kosher Kitchen,"

Central Florida's first full-Kosher premier catering service featuring international and American Kosher cuisine.

column2: • No special travel services.
• Located at one of Orlando’s award-winning meeting, convention, and vacation properties, Rosen Plaza Hotel, Zayde’s Kosher Catering is dedicated to delivering the highest quality Kosher catering.

• Offering on-site catering at all seven Rosen Hotels & Resorts, as well as off-site catering options; their talented culinary team led by Rosen Plaza’s Executive Chef Michael McMullen and Rosen Shingle Creek’s Executive Chef Jorge Oliveira, are committed to providing high-end, internationally-inspired Kosher cuisine, all within strict kashrut guidelines.
• Zayde’s state-of-the art Kosher culinary centre includes separate kitchens for Glatt Kosher meat, dairy, and pareve, all supervised by a full time on-site mashgiach.

3688,ABC Commissary,"

Counter-service spot in Disney's Hollywood Studios offers global fast food amidst art deco decor.

column2: • Each of Disney parks contains one non-Kosher restaurant that serves airplane-style Kosher meals.
• This one serves typically hamburgers, hotdogs, macaroni & cheese.
• Overpriced and not very tasty.
• We recommend skipping this option and bring your own sandwiches instead.
<li>Each of Walt Disney World Florida's four parks contains one restaurant that offers Kosher meals without advance notice:
• In Animal Kingdom: Pizzafari (located on Discovery Island).
• In Epcot: Liberty Inn (located in the American Adventure Pavilion of the World Showcase).
• In Hollywood Studios: ABC Commissary (located in the Backlot).
• In Magic Kingdom: Cosmic Ray’s Starlight Café (located in Tomorrowland).
• When you enter one of the above four restaurants, you can ask for a Kosher menu at the counter. Meal choices tend to be hamburgers, hotdogs, macaroni and cheese and the like.
• In addition to the main dish, the meals tend to include a vegetable side dish, starch side dish, roll and dessert. Disney Kosher meals, all Glatt Kosher, come sealed in plastic packaging.
• Since the restaurant workers need to heat each meal individually in a microwave, it can be a bit of wait to get the meals after you order them at the counter.
• So it is a good idea to send one member of the family ahead by 10-15 minutes to order Kosher meals for the whole family.

Contemporary eatery serving up Mediterranean eats in an easygoing atmosphere.

column2: • Back under KCF (Chabad) Hashgacha
• You can find great Israeli style food available for delivery or takeaway.
• Good food, decent prices.

9574,Kosher Quick Service Dining in Walt Disney World,"

Kosher meals to go at Disney parks and hotels!

column2: • Can't plan ahead? Kosher meals, either to dine in or ready to go, are available without advance request in the following restaurants at their respective parks.
• Cosmic Ray’s at Magic Kingdom Park in Tomorrow-land 10:00 AM – 10:00 PM.
• Liberty Inn at Epcot in World Showcase 11:30 AM – 8:30 PM.
• Electric Umbrella at Epcot in Future World 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM.
• ABC Commissary at Hollywood Studios in Commissary Lane 11:00 AM – 8:30 PM.
• Satu’li Canteen at Animal Kingdom in Pandora 11:00 AM – 9:30 PM.
• Kusafiri Coffee Shop and Bakery at Animal Kingdom in Africa 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM.
• World Premiere at All-Star Movies Resort 6:30 AM – 12:00 AM.
• Intermission at All-Star Music Resort 6:30 AM – 11:00 PM.
• End Zone at All-Star Sports Resort 6:30 AM – 11:00 PM.
• Old Port Royale Food Court at Caribbean Beach 6:30 AM – 12:00 AM.
• Everything Pop Dining at Pop Century 6:30 AM – 12:00 AM.
• Sassagoula Floatworks and Food Factory at Port Orleans French Quarter.
• Riverside Mill Food Court at Port Orleans Riverside 6:00 AM – 12:00 AM.
• Artist’s Palette at Saratoga Springs Resort 7:00 AM – 11:00 PM.
• Gasparilla Grill at Grand Floridian 24 hours.
• The Mara at Animal Kingdom Lodge 6:00 AM – 1:30 AM.
• For information on preorders of Kosher meals click here.

• Kosher meals at Disney restaurants are provided by Weberman’s. Pricing varies by what you order, but quick service meals are priced between $9.99-11.99 circa.  Table service meals vary by location and what you choose.
• At Webermans Traditional Foods, all of year-round & Passover products are prepared under the supervision of OU kosher certification.

3762,Kosher Eatery,"

Dairy Kosher Restaurant, Caterer, and Hotel Banquet Meals Purveyor.

column2: • One of the few full service meat Kosher restaurants in the greater Orlando area, also offering Shabbat meals, as well as dairy & pizza takeaway.
• Located in Super Target shopping plaza within a huge parking lot.
• Bulk family style menu in aluminum half sheet pans.
• Cuisine: Middle Eastern/American/Chinese.
• Average price: $18-$25
• Shabbat meals (for pickup Thursday night after 8pm or Friday from 10am to 2pm or delivery on Friday from 11am to 2pm to most hotel bell desks).
• Succah On Succot:
• Open for Pesach: No.
• Located within a short drive from Disney theme parks.
• The restaurant is also near the Chabad of South Orlando, which makes it a convenient daven-and-dine destination.
• Did we miss anything? Let us know in the comments below!
• Have you been here before? Share your tips with us!
• Are you the owner? Claim your listing!

9576,Walt Disney's Parks and Resorts Kosher Preorders,"

INTERNAL NOTE: WE MOVED THIS LISTING TO JUST ONE MORE INCLUSIVE ONE
Kosher meals available in any restaurant at Disney.

column2: • The preorder service works for people who get a holiday package with food included. When you book you can choose the restaurant, and then have the option to request Kosher or other dietary requirements.
•  You need to have a previous reservation, if you call 24 hours before to verify and confirm your option.
• You have up to 180 days before your stay to request Kosher meals and make restaurant reservations.
• Most Walt Disney parks and resorts table service restaurants that accept reservations can accommodate Kosher meals if requested at least 48 hours in advance.
• For pricing, ordering and any other questions about the Kosher meals offered, please call Walt Disney World Dining at 407-WDW-DINE.
• Kosher meals are available at the following Theme Park Food & Beverage locations with no advance notice needed:
• Disney's Animal Kingdom Theme Park: Satu'li Canteen and Tusker House Restaurant.
• Disney's Hollywood Studios: ABC Commissary.
•  Epcot: Liberty Inn and Electric Umbrella.
• Magic Kingdom Park: Cosmic Ray's Starlight Cafe.
• Please note that Kosher meals will also be readily available at Walt Disney World Resort Hotel Table-Service and Quick-Service/Food Court locations.
• For further information about their quick service dining click here.
• There is a link to some products available at their food and beverage locations that may satisfy your needs. Kosher Products:  http://wdw.wdpromedia.com/media/kana/sd/WDW-Kosher.pdf.

• Keep in mind that this is not the full list of all the options available, but represents many of their special dietary products. This means that some items considered ""regular menu offerings"" are not listed on the reference guides, despite still being appropriate for guests with special dietary needs.
• If a location is not listed, this does not mean they are not able to accommodate your request; however, some of the products that are found at other locations may not be available.

• If you have any last minute requests, we encourage you to speak with a Chef or Manager when you arrive at any dining location, and they will be happy to provide you with the most recent information available.
• Kosher menus vary from restaurant to restaurant and are subject to availability. Due to the special care taken to accommodate this dietary request, these meals may take longer to prepare.
• Kosher meals at Disney restaurants are provided by Weberman’s. At Weberman’s Traditional Foods, all of year-round & Passover products are prepared under the supervision of OU kosher certification.

4098,Pantry,"

Miniature take-out joint specialising in prepared vegetarian & fish dishes with eclectic influences.

column2: • Pantry is a dairy caterer, café, food boutique, and speciality ingredient store- in short a pantry. Owner and chef Sam Kanner has brought his vision to life in this interesting space.
• It is an open kitchen concept where customers and diners can see all the behind the scenes action of what goes into their meal and catering preparation.

• The design of the café is a little rustic, a little contemporary, and a lot inviting. With a comfortable vibe and youthful exuberance, guests of all ages are sure to enjoy their experience at Pantry.
• The café offers free WiFi so customers can keep connected while enjoying their meal.
• For more information click here.

11613,Prime on Avenue,"

Nicely decorated contemporary Glatt restaurant.

column2: • Glatt Kosher meat restaurant.
• A new Kosher steak and smokehouse is open at 1960 Avenue Road, Ontario Canada.
• Offering a ""dressy"" environment that can be a good place for businessmen or couples.
• Check their menu here.
• Heschcher.
• This place is permanently closed.

column1: ",,,,,https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1583868161943-29a9ec42256e?ixid=MnwxMjA3fDB8MHxwaG90by1wYWdlfHx8fGVufDB8fHx8&ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1171&q=80,,checked,"Restaurant,Food","Meat,Pareve","3522 Bathurst Street, North York, ON M6A 2C7, Canada",North America,Canada,,Ontario,,,none,43.7291518,-79.4324840,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,25/10/2017,15/7/2021,,,,

4093,The Chicken Nest,"

Casual provider of kosher poultry & rib dishes, plus light American fare like salads.

column2: • Restaurant reviewers describe The Chicken Nest as “the staple of the Toronto Jewish Community.” Since 1993, The Chicken Nest, located at Bathurst and Lawrence, allows you to sit back, and enjoy chicken and ribs done the old-fashioned way in a family-style setting.
• Accommodating up to 70 guests at his restaurant, owner and head chef Carlo prepares and serves each dish using his years of experience at top-rated five star hotels.
• Many of the dishes on The Chicken Nest menu are inspired by Carlo’s father, also a chef with Sephardic Jewish influences.
• The Chicken Nest’s outdoor catering is most popular amongst the neighbourhood shuls for their kiddush on Shabbat.

• Their exclusive Shabbat menu includes kugel, chicken liver, cholent, and a delicious Moroccan fish as well as other dishes that can be found on the regular lunch/dinner menu like the Hot and Spicy Chicken Wings.
• Delivery and catering is available for homes, engagement and office parties, Sheva Brachot, family gatherings, anniversaries, birthdays and private parties.
• For more information click here.

4132,Cafe Sheli,"

Spacious kosher eatery with outdoor seating serving breakfast & baked goods, plus lunch & dinner.

column2: • Cafe Sheli’s is a lovely cafe and bakery tucked into a strip plaza just north of the Promenade Mall.
• For an abundance of tasty selections, Cafe Sheli is a great choice.
• The cozy atmosphere could be lifted right out of your own kitchen, and the service is quick, friendly and attentive.
• The clean and bright decor makes for a pleasant dining experience. Convenience isn’t overlooked at this cafe. There’s ample parking available with an easy to find large sign.
• For more information click here.

4088,Umami Sushi,"

Long-running Kosher takeaway spot making sushi & noodle dishes, plus a petite Japanese market.

column2: • The Japanese word Umami refers to the fifth taste; the combination of the four primary tastes – salty, sour, sweet and bitter.
• Umami Sushi uses only the freshest and finest ingredients, with presentation that simply makes your mouth water.
• They are an important part of the Toronto community, proudly serving sushi at intimate family gatherings, office parties, corporate events and elaborate celebrations – even in remote areas.

• The success of Umami Sushi is due to the meticulous attention to detail provided by owner/manager Andrew Novak. Andrew has been involved with Umami since 2002, and in 2007, together with wife Sarah, bought the company so they could continue to provide Toronto’s consumers with the finest kosher sushi. Umami Sushi has proven itself with an award for “Best Kosher Maki” from North York Post.

• All fish maki are available raw or grilled – just let them know in advance. A house speciality at Umami Sushi is the “T.O. (Toronto)” and their “Sushi Pizza” is a savoury mix of salmon, spicy sauce, sesame seeds, green onion and cucumbers atop a rice patty.  In addition to their delectable sushi menu, Umami Sushi introduced its unique noodle menu, and the early response from consumers has been overwhelming.
• For more information click here.

column1: ",,,,http://www.umamisushi.ca/sites/default/files/imagecache/image_gallery-display/gallery/image_gallery/gallery-image_gallery-20.jpeg http://www.umamisushi.ca/sites/default/files/imagecache/image_gallery-display/gallery/image_gallery/gallery-image_gallery-21.jpeg http://www.umamisushi.ca/sites/default/files/imagecache/image_gallery-display/gallery/image_gallery/gallery-image_gallery-25.jpeg,,,,Restaurant,Pareve,"3459 Bathurst St, North York, ON M6A 2C5, Canada",North America,Canada,,Ontario,,,moderate,43.7286118,-79.4315392,COR,https://www.cor.ca/,+1 416-782-3375,http://www.umamisushi.ca/,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,25/10/2017,15/7/2021,,,,

4111,Marron Bistro,"

Kosher French dishes plus burgers & steak served in a refined dining room with leather banquettes.

column2: • Marron means “chestnut” in French which is reminiscent of the warming aroma which enchants us as we enter Marron Bistro.
• At the start of your meal, you’re served hot bread with a delicious chestnut butter from the friendly and attentive staff.
• Marron does an excellent job of making a high end restaurant into such a welcoming environment. The staff works seamlessly together as a cohesive family.
• This family is composed of many different cultures such as South American, Israeli, Mexican, Korean, Canadian, and more.
• The diverse group works well together to bring you an unforgettable experience. They bring the best of each culture onto the dishes they serve.
• The chef continues to create cultural fusions that draw from her experiences from places like Thailand, London, Malaysia, and more.
• For more information click here.

4120,Jacobs Deli,"

The first Kosher deli in the area with fresh, in-house, smoked meats, turkey, and chicken.

column2: • In the Jewish hub of Toronto, Ontario lies Jacob’s Deli.  The first and only Kosher deli in the area, Jacob’s offers food not available anywhere else; such as, fresh, in-house, smoked meats, turkey, and chicken.

• Sidney and Yanekah Jacobs, native Torontonians, felt a great lacking in Thornhill.  The Jacobs wanted to fill the gap in the market by opening a restaurant that prides itself on serving the freshest and most delicious foods in a warm and friendly environment.

• Jacob’s Deli opened in 2013 and offers artisan sandwiches like Turkey Italiano - smoked turkey, tomato, basil, & dill aioli, and a Black Angus Prime Rib Steak - topped with gravy, sauteed onions, & mushrooms.
• Speaking of black angus prime rib, Jacob’s poutine is a must have, with five varieties from which to choose, including the Black Angus Prime Rib Poutine, Turkey Poutine, and more.

• If you are craving a juicy, meaty, flavorful burger, Jacob’s can satisfy that craving with any of their hand-ground beef burgers.  With a Tex-Mex Burger that’s served with pico de gallo, guacamole, and beer battered jalapeno rings on a toasted bun, this ain’t your average delicatessen.
• The Jacobs have been in the food industry for over 15 years and are perfectionists when it comes to their craft.

• They bake their own bread, butcher their own meat, and make their own sauces from scratch. Jacob’s Deli has that old-school delicatessen vibe where you just want to enjoy the atmosphere and the food until closing, and with their late hours, you can do just that.
• Due to the popularity of Jacob’s Deli, the Jacobs are currently seeking out the perfect location to expand and meet the high demands of Torontonians and visitors alike.
• For more information click here.

column1: ",,,,https://scontent-mxp1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.6435-9/106351270_2852883251489391_7566325147229757826_n.jpg?_nc_cat=104&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=8bfeb9&_nc_ohc=yD7yepYQLeEAX-yx953&_nc_ht=scontent-mxp1-1.xx&oh=a1d2a7f7fb42565f37d1affc80ffc4f9&oe=61CD81D2 https://scontent-mxp1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.6435-9/87034012_2550926115018441_1263530458805698560_n.jpg?_nc_cat=100&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=8bfeb9&_nc_ohc=nB-LVnNDzIUAX8GizAh&_nc_ht=scontent-mxp1-1.xx&oh=8a62e308803a0f2480e53995068f0189&oe=61CED0C1 https://scontent-mxp1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.6435-9/53730304_1929854047125654_958280445814898688_n.jpg?_nc_cat=102&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=e3f864&_nc_ohc=OYLKsx-uL98AX9Wj6pw&_nc_ht=scontent-mxp1-1.xx&oh=0d6979176c0d2c8649560e680dfd91e4&oe=61D017DD,,,,Restaurant,Meat,"1100 Eglinton Ave W, Toronto, ON M6C 2E2, Canada",North America,Canada,,Ontario,,,moderate,43.6998407,-79.4317569,COR,https://www.cor.ca/,+1 905-597-1127,https://www.jacobsfoodcompany.ca/jacobs-takeout,,https://www.facebook.com/jacobsfoodcompany/,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,25/10/2017,15/7/2021,,,,

4107,Milk N' Honey (Tor.),"

Eclectic strip-mall restaurant & catering spot offers Jewish food, pizza & an array of sandwiches.

column2: • Milk ‘N Honey is a cute restaurant and a fan favourite amongst its loyal customers.
• Owned by Moshe Zombeck, the restaurant has a colorful decor, featuring painted murals along the walls.
• Comfortable chairs, cushioned booths and blue tabletops add to the light and casual mood.
• The restaurant features an array of dairy and vegetarian dishes, perfect for lunch or a light, yet, fulfilling dinner.

• For starters, the Mushroom Barley Soup or the French Onion Soup offer robust and filling choices. One can pick from any number of salads and dressings, with an old-time favourite, Caesar Salad leading the way.

• Their healthy sandwiches and wraps are also popular items. However, if you’re not from around the area, you must try the Panzarotti - it’s incredible. The calzone-like pizza-in-a-pocket, is oversized and fun to eat.  Just be careful when you first get it, because that delectable filling inside the pocket can be very hot.
• For more information click here.

12787,MASAeat Food Truck,"

Informal, and friendly late-night Kosher Mexican food.

column2: • Glatt Kosher food truck. Pas Yisroel.
• A food truck with casual meals.
• No seating available.
• Good for couples, groups or solo-dining.
• Located beside the Beth Jacob Synagogue and the TenembaumCHAT Senior High School. 10 miles north of downtown Toronto.
• The menu is based on hot dogs, pitas, and schnitzels.
• Heschcher.

4140,Bistro Grande,"

Smart, casual spot for diverse kosher fare in an elegant cream dining area or on the patio.

column2: • Bistro Grande, located on the busy street of Eglinton Avenue in Toronto, is the nicest dairy restaurant in the area.
• Owner Shlomo Esses, owns Cafe Sheli as well. With an outdoor patio and brightly lit interior, you can enjoy a beautiful day inside or out.
• Here, a casual approach to extraordinary food means kosher dining at its finest, and friends and families alike gather to celebrate their special occasions inside its warm glow.
• For more information click here.

7950,Plant Matter Kitchen,"

Young and modern vegan restaurant.

column2: • Vegan restaurant.
• Offers breakfast/brunch, afternoon and evening meals. Eat-in or takeaway.
• A nicely decorated restaurant, with an outstanding environment.
• For more information on the menu, click here.
• Located in London, 125 miles west of Niagara Falls, Ontario, Canada.
• You can contact them here.

4126,D-Lite's,"

From sushi to pasta to sandwiches, this comfy kosher dairy cafe boasts an extensive, eclectic menu.

column2: • Located in a largely residential area, D-lite’s, which opened in 2007, welcomes you to savour its various tastes from around the world, including Japan, Italy, Israel and Latin America.
• With plenty of free parking in a strip shopping mall, the restaurant features dairy, sushi and vegetarian selections in a bright and cozy environment.

• Thanks to its attentive staff, D-Lite’s is the perfect getaway for a fun occasion with a group of friends or a special night with your family. With its relaxed and casual decor, eating at D-Lite’s is like eating at home.

• Restaurant entrepreneur Armando Cohen has achieved a sophisticated, yet comfortable atmosphere. His philosophy is to provide generous portions of the freshest ingredients in a family setting for a memorable experience each time.
• For more information click here.

13933,Bay St. Deli at Scotiabank Arena,"

Glatt, Kiosk, Pas Yisroel, Take-out.

column2: • Glatt, Kiosk, Meat, Pas Yisroel, Take-out.
• This place is a Kios at the Scotiabank Arena, home of the Leafs and Raptors in Toronto, Canada.
• Opened for the first time on Oct. 3, coinciding with the launch of the Toronto Maple Leafs’ hockey season.

• The prices at the Bay St. Deli are a little higher than those elsewhere in the arena, though you won’t find popcorn on the kosher menu. Instead, one can find a Moroccan spicy sausage, the booth’s unique variant of cholent, marketed as Jewish chili, along with the opportunity to get a cholent dog and their other specialty, potato kugel served on top of a bowl of cholent. (Source)
• Located 1 mile walk toward the south from downtown Toronto.
• Section 105 Second kiosk to the right after entering gate 4 Bay street level 100. Ex-Baldwin St.
• Events and calendar.
• Heschcher.
• Dairy.
• Currently, the only Kosher restaurant in Ottawa JCC (21 Nadolny Sachs Private).
• They serve all day breakfasts, soups, salads, sandwiches, treats (muffins, scones, cookies, and more).
• Daily changing dish-of-the-day.
• Casual restaurant with a terrace.
• Takeaway services available,
• Located 5 miles southwest of downtown Ottawa.
• Heschcher.

7955,Plant Matter Bistro,"

Nice decor, modern, vegan Kosher certified restaurant.

column2: • Vegan restaurant.
• All cheeses served at the restaurant are made from seeds or nuts, and all ingredients are sourced locally.
• A nicely decorated restaurant, with an outstanding environment.
• They offer lunch and dinner dishes including bibimbap, ravioli, sweet potato gnocchi, enchiladas, wild mushroom, and risotto.
• For more information on the lunch menu, click here.
• For more information on the dinner menu, click here.
• Located in London, 125 miles west of Niagara Falls, Ontario, Canada.
• You can contact them here.

4151,Ba-Li Laffa (North),"

Mediterranean grill offering kebabs, hummus & other familiar fare in a casual setting.

column2: • Ba-Li Laffa is a full-service Kosher COR supervised restaurant that offers authentic Middle Eastern cuisine and flavours. ""Ba-Li Laffa"", meaning ""I feel like having a Laffa"" in Hebrew, is a Mediterranean Grill with two locations, (North and South), conveniently located on Bathurst St., home to many of Toronto's Jewish community.

• Ba-Li Laffa also offers a wide-variety of catering services, including, but not limited to, ready-made and customised platters, Shiva meals, catering for small and large functions and events, or as requested.
• Available to rent out for private parties and events on any given Saturday night, within 1 hour of Motzei Shabbat.
• They are also located in Ba-Li Laffa (South).
• For more information click here.

• Located 7 miles southwest of downtown Ottawa.
• Heschcher.

11214,Deli Boyz,"

Burger deli in a shopping mall food court.

column2: • Meat restaurant.
• Deli burger at Quartier Cavendish Shopping Mall food court.
• Burgers, nuggets, deli, sandwiches are sold here.
• Takeaways are available.
• Located 8 miles southwest of downtown Montreal.
• MK Heshcher.

Sushi, Chinese and steakhouse, eat-in in a contemporary environment.

column2: • Glatt Kosher restaurant.
• This place offers a long menu of Chinese & deli favourites, including sushi, in a contemporary decoration.
• Casual, and good for families with kids.
• Check their menu, here.
• Located in Decarie Square shopping mall, 8 miles west of downtown Montreal.
• MK Kosher Heshcher.

11030,Cheskie's Bakery,"

Bakery featuring a variety of pastries, cakes & other goods.

column2: • Parve. All baked goods are Yoshon.
• This bakery is in the old Jewish neighbourhood of Montreal, known as Mile End, where you can find all traditional goodies such as Cheskie's poppy-seed ruggelah, the babka , mille feuille pastry.
• No seating available at Cheskie's.
• Located 2 miles northwest of downtown Montreal.
• MK Hescher.

column2: • Pizzeria located in Quebec.
• Perfect place for friends, tourists, and families with children.
• Takeaway, delivery and catering services available.
• Serving lunch and dinner only.

10956,District Bagel,"

Cholov Yisroel dairy. Yoshon bakery and restaurant.

column2: • Cholov Yisroel dairy bagel bakery.
• District Bagel is located within the neighbourhood of Mount Royal and is the go-to location for hungry local businesses looking for bagels, breakfast, and lunch.
• They could cater your next event so you can try 18 different flavours of fresh wood-oven baked bagels with a choice of 5 different cream cheese shmears.
• Café has variety of sandwiches, wraps, omelets, and salads, that you can eat in or order to takeaway.
• Always Kosher, no additives.
• Check their menu here.
• Located 5 miles west of downtown Montreal.
• MK hechsher.

11121,Metsuyan Sushi Express,"

Sushi store at a shopping mall food court.

column2: • Pareve restaurant.
• Traditional sushi store in a shopping mall food court.
• Located at the Quartier Cavendish, 7 miles west of downtown Montreal.
• MK Heshcher.

column2: • Yakimono is a sushi bar located in Montreal, is known for its casual yet vibrant atmosphere and terrific sushi. Yakimono Sushi Bar is as much a social experience as it is a dining one.
• There is something for everyone at Yakimono. The diverse menu offers a range of cuisines to please everyone’s tastes including sushi, salads, soups, Teriyaki dinners, desserts, coffee and wine.
• For more information click here.

4177,Chez Benny Express,"

Laid-back eatery serving up kosher Mediterranean grilled meats, mostly for takeaway or delivery.

column2: • Chez Benny serves up great Middle Eastern cuisine as well as an extensive Chinese food menu. The variety reflects the diversity of the Jewish community of Montreal.

• Their specialities include Chicken Shawarma with laffa bread, Harira Soup; a traditional Moroccan soup with lentils, noodles, chickpeas, tomatoes, celery, onion, and the Assorted Grill Plate with turkey schwarma, merguez, kefta and chicken brochette.
• The “Shawarma Poutine” is a long standing favourite for its savoury quality. To top your meal off right, order the unique Moroccan sweet cigars which are the perfect fusion of flavours.
• Their test kitchen is always coming up with new delicious items to try so each experience can be unique.

column2: • Pareve.
• Homemade Kosher Bakery has been working for over 30 years now,  baking the products made in the purest Kosher tradition.
• They bake bread, rolls, cookies, cakes, danishes, and muffins.
• Located 3 miles northwest of downtown Montreal.
• No seating available.
• MK Hechsher.

11126,Le Plezl,"

Cholov Yisroel dairy, cosy and friendly place.

column2: • Cholov Yisroel dairy and Parve restaurant.
• This place is a vegetarian café (some fish) with a modern Mediterranean menu. Soups, sandwiches, salads, panini, wraps, etc.

• Le Plezel (little place in Yiddish) embraces the flavours from the many countries of Mediterranean region from Italy to Israel, with a slight detour through the vibrant flavours of California and its Mexican-inspired cuisine.
• Everything is made in house, from pickles to yoghurt.
• Located in downtown Montreal. Beside La Maison Chabad.
• MK Hescher.

11188,Jewish General Hospital,"

Hospital where all the restaurants are Kosher.

column2: • Hospital where all the restaurants are certified concessionaires. A variety of dairy, meat, vegetarian, and pareve.

column1: The Atrium Café, Pavilion G, RC (ground level):

column2: • Monday to Thursday, 8:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m.
• Friday, 8:00 a.m. - 2:30 p.m.
• Closed on Saturday and Sunday.
• A public lounge adjoins the Atrium Café. It can be used to eat food from outside the hospital.
• This travelling food cart visits many clinics and waiting-room areas throughout the hospital, selling a variety of sandwiches, salads, pastries, and drinks.

column1: The Link coffee shop, Pavilion E, 1st floor:

column2: • Monday to Friday, 7:30 a.m. - 3:00 p.m.
• Closed on Saturday and Sunday.

column1: Second Cup, Pavilion B, 1st floor (Côte Sainte-Catherine entrance):

column2: • Monday to Thursday, 24 hours.
• Friday, 6:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.
• Closed on Saturday and Sunday.
• Monday to Thursday, 7:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.
• Friday, 7:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.
• Closed on Saturday and Sunday.
• 24 hours, except closed from Friday 4:00 p.m. to Saturday 8:00 p.m.
• DAVIDs TEA Pavilion K, main floor (level S1).

column1: There is another food area, The Food Court in the Carrefour Lea Polansky:

column2: • Located at the Pavillion K - 1st floor.
<li>Opening hours by store:
• Kebab Shop: Sunday to Thursday, 11:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m. Friday 11:00 a.m.- 2:00 p.m. Menu.
• Cafe Sofia: Monday to Thursday, 11:00 a.m. - 3:00 p.m. Menu page 1, page 2, lunch menu, drinks.
• Ben'Jing: Monday to Thursday, 11:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m. Menu.
• Gare 18: Monday to Thursday, 11:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m., Friday 11:00 a.m. - 2:00 p.m. Menu page 1, Menu page 2.
• Beso Pret-a-manger : Monday to Sunday, 7:00 a.m. - 7:00 p.m. Menu.
• Note that the food court opening hours are approximate, depending on the beginning of the Jewish Sabbath on Friday afternoon.
• All of the eateries are closed during Jewish High Holy days, as well as on regular statutory holidays, except for Beso Prêt à Manger.
• Please note that food purchased at one restaurant may not be consumed in any of the other restaurants.
• There are vending machines located throughout the hospital that supply certified hot and cold drinks and snacks 24 hours a day.
• The hospital is located 4 miles west of downtown Montreal.

column2: • Pareve. All baked goods are Yoshon.
• This place is a bakery and grocery store.
• Nice decoration and a great place to find what you need to prepare a quick bite.
• Located 4 miles west of downtown Montreal.
• MK Hechsher.

10935,Kosher Quality,"

Kosher supermarket with butcher and bakery.

column2: • Bakery, grocery, deli, butcher, takeaway platters, and more.
• Located 4 miles west of downtown Montreal.
• MK Heschcher.

Dairy Cholov Yisroel indoor and outdoor restaurant, casual and contemporary.

column2: • Cholov Yisroel dairy restaurant.
• Exception Bistro Resto is a Montreal based Kosher dairy & parve restaurant opened for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
• Includes French breakfast, fresh pizza, fish, sushi, pasta, dessert, wine, coffee, and much more.
• Great decoration in a contemporary environment, with outdoor and indoor dining areas.
• Check their menu here.
• Located 4 miles west of downtown Montreal.
• MK Hescher.

10922,Montreal Kosher Bakery,"

Traditional bakery in downtown Montreal.

column2: • Pareve.  Yoshon.
• Founded in 1976, Montreal Kosher Bakery has been serving the Montreal community ever since with amazing baked goods.

• With their trademark knishes, ""extra special"" challahs, fancy cakes and cookies, old-style bread and much much more, keeping the tradition, while adapting standards to meet the needs of the 21st-century consumer.

• Bread and pastries: Rye bread, black bread, Hungarian bread, multi-grain bread, kimmel bread, Russian bread, toast bread, whole wheat bread, bagel sesame white, bagel poppy black, bagel whole wheat, bagel all dressed, bagel multi-grain, challa extra special, bread bulka square, challa raisin, challa brioche, roll twisted challa, roll whole wheat, roll white (sesame) lindies, roll vienna, roll onion, and much more.
• Located 4 miles west of downtown Montreal.
• MK Hechsher.

column2: • Parve restaurant.
• This place has a great contemporary decoration.
• All foods and ingredients used at Saizen Sushi Bar are 100% Kosher.

• They prepare all dishes both in sushi bar and kitchen following strict Kosher guidelines under the supervision of Mr. Joseph Bodokh, co-owner of the restaurant who has over fourteen years of experience in food in the industry.
• Check their menu, here.
• Located 4 miles west of downtown Montreal.
• MK Hescher.

11327,Traiteur Paradise Kosher,"

Kosher catering for all occasions, takeaway food, grocery store and restaurant.

column2: <li style=""list-style-type: none;"">
• Meat, dairy, and parve options.
• This place offers three options: Montreal Kosher catering, Montreal Kosher bakery goods, and Montreal Kosher meals.
• They carry a complete line of Kosher bakery goods, meat, and dairy products and have a full-size Kosher kitchen where speciality cooking takes place daily.
• Working since December 2003.

• At Paradise Kosher you can shop online or in store for takeaway, fresh baked bread pastry and pizza, refrigerated and frozen products, deli counter and home cooked meals, Moroccan and Israeli salads, and grilled meats.
• Day to day eating; Shabbat meals, holiday meals, private parties.
• A quick lunch to eat-in or grab-and-go.
• For information on their menus, click: Shabbat, Takeaway, Pizza n' Grill.
• Located 15 miles west of downtown Montreal.
• MK Heshcher.

11242,Café de l'avenue,"

Cholov Yisroel café restaurant, grab 'n' go, eat-in or terrace.

column2: • Dairy café and quick-bite restaurant.
• They are MK certified and all of their dairy is Cholov Yisroel without exception.
• They offer breakfast, lunch, deli sandwiches, desserts, and more in a modern place with a great decoration.
• You can go for a morning cup, spend the afternoon studying, or meet up with friends for a cappuccino on their terrace.
• Located 7 miles west of downtown Montreal.
• MK Heshcher.

11084,Pizza Pita,"

After being in the same spot since 1989 they moved to 5345 Vézina St.
Traditional pizzeria with an indoor seating area.

column2: <li style=""list-style-type: none;"">
• Dairy restaurant.
• Pizza Pita is a family-friendly restaurant.
• Offers a casual environment with a contemporary decoration.
• Pizza Pita began in 1989. It is a family owned and operated business.
• The menu goes beyond just pizza and pita, with a Moo Moo ice cream section, an extensive pasta bar, salad section, assorted fish selection and Mediterranean dishes.
• Located 5 miles west of downtown Montreal.
• MK Heshcher.

11222,City Grill,"

Casual burger, falafel and pita place with indoor and outdoor seating.

column2: • Meat restaurant.
• Casual and friendly restaurant, with a family menu. Burgers, falafels, and Mediterranean specials.
• Located 4 miles west of downtown Montreal.
• MK Heshcher.

11114,Restaurant Mozart,"

Cholov Yisroel dairy contemporary restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating.

column2: • Cholov Yisroel dairy and Parve restaurant.
• Offering an exquisite environment with a contemporary decoration.
• Their menu includes a delicious selection of pizzas, sandwiches, pastas, Israeli dishes, fish, and more. Check their menu here.
• Located 5 miles west of downtown Montreal.
• MK Hescher.

11037,Beso Traitueur,"

Bakery, patisserie and meals to go.

column2: <li style=""list-style-type: none;"">
• Parve. Glatt. Dairy. All baked goods are Yoshon.
• They can offer Cholov Yisroel products, but their facilities and equipment are not.
• This place is a bakery, patisserie, and also sells meals to go and Kosher products.

• For years Montrealers have enjoyed the premium foods available at Exception on Robert Burns in Côte Saint-Luc. Now challah, fresh danish, desserts, handmade chocolates and delectable ready-to-go meals will continue to be available at the exact same address, simply adorned by their new name, Beso.
• Located 6 miles southwest of downtown Montreal.
• Check their Shabbat menu, here.
• The hot menu, here.
• MK Heshcher.

11229,Chiyoko Sushi Bar & Steakhouse,"

Japanese fine dining sushi and steakhouse.

column2: • Fish and meat restaurant.
• This place is all about fine Japanese cuisine, enjoyed in a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere.
• A bold and diverse menu features a variety of meat dishes.
• Offering a pleasant and exquisite environment.
• Located 9 miles west of downtown Montreal.
• Check their different menus, here.
• MK Heshcher.

11204,ELNA Bistro,"

Cozy and casual, dairy and vegetarian restaurant.

column2: • Cholov Stam dairy restaurant.
• Great cozy environment, modern decoration.
• This place serves breakfast, lunch, and coffee. Is good for groups and family with kids.
• Takeaways are available.
• Located at Decarie Square Shopping Mall. 7 miles west of downtown Montreal.
• MK Heshcher.

7533,"Yotvata Restaurant in Rome, Italy","

Traditional Roman-Jewish cuisine.

column2: • Dairy restaurant.
• The only Kosher restaurant in Rome serving milk products and they also produce their own cheese.
• Daily checks by a Rabbi are a further guarantee of the quality of the fresh produce.
• Yotvata is the name of an oasis in the desert of the Negev in Israel, just a few kilometres from Eilat. This oasis is mentioned three times in the book of Deuteronomy.
• The menu shows a very interesting variety of choices. For more information click here.
• No delivery options, reservations are required.
• Catering services are offered.
• You can contact them directly here.

6947,"Ba´Ghetto Milky Via del Portico d´Ottavia, Rome","

Pizza, fish, milk and cheese restaurant with seating available outside.

column2: • Dairy restaurant. Chalav Yisrael.

• In this classic restaurant, you can find the best of the kosher food and both the milk and dairy versions of the Judeo-Roman cuisine: you can taste delicious pizzas, dishes based on fish, milk, and cheese.
• For more information about the menu, click here.
• Ba'Ghetto Milky restaurant is strictly Kosher and they follow the Shabbat and the Jewish Holidays rules. The regular service is not available on these days.
• You can contact them directly at bamilky@baghetto.com.

7331,"Grand Hotel Parker's Naples, Italy","

This hotel is beautiful and elegant, the staff are polite and helpful and will make your stay a relaxing one.

column2: • Overlooking the Bay of Naples, this 19th-century stately hotel is a 5-minute walk from the Amedeo metro stop and 2.3 km from the Royal Palace of Naples.
• The rooms are luxurious and feature period furniture, marble bathrooms, free Wi-Fi, flat-screen TVs, minibars and 24-hour room service.
• Upgraded rooms have balconies with city or ocean views, while suites add whirlpool tubs and living rooms. Children under 13 years old (included) stay for free with their parents.
• Buffet breakfast and parking are included. There is also a rooftop restaurant, a bar with panoramic sea views, a gym and a spa with Turkish bath, sauna, and hot tub.
• The restaurant is extremely elegant and beautifully decorated.
• The menu offers excellent choices. For more information click here.
• For reservations, you can contact them directly here.

column1:
4186,Ghimel Garden,"

Restaurant with cozy interior room design and a large garden with pomegranate trees.

column2: • Meat and vegan restaurant. Located in beautiful Venice where Eruv is available.
• All the food is Bishul Israel. On Shabbat the meals are Besari, the meat is Kasher-le-Mehadrin Maran-Bet-Yosef and Glat-Halaq.
• The menu has been arranged nicely, for more information click here.
• You can contact them directly here.

NOT KOSHER

column2: • NOT KOSHER

column1:
5002,Denzel Ristorante Kosher,"

Kosher burgers and fish dishes in the middle of Milano.

column2: • Meat restaurant. Small with classic decoration. Simple but elegant.
• Whilst they have a wide variety of meals, they are known for their burgers and fish dishes.
• For more information on their interesting menu, click here.
• Located in a very nice neighbourhood of Milano and close to Chabad.
• You can contact them directly here.

column1:
7416,"Ba'ghetto Ristoranti in Via Livorno, Roma","

Genuine and tasty food. Wonderful surroundings.

column2: • Meat restaurant. Chalav Yisrael.
• They have kept alive the Judeo-Roman cuisine and Middle Eastern traditions.
• Innovative and contemporary cuisine in dairy-free Kosher catering.
• For more information about the menu, click here.
• Ba'Ghetto restaurant is strictly Kosher and follows the Shabbath and the Jewish Holidays rules. The regular service is not available in these days.
• You can contact them directly at balivorno@baghetto.com.

column1:
7520,Fonzie The Burguer's House in Roma,"

Casual burger spot in Rome.

column2: • Meat restaurant.
• The menu is based on burgers and sandwiches, but you can order salads too. For more information click here.
• Certainly a place suitable for families.
• Fonzie offers three different locations in Rome, all within walking distance to Rome's main attractions.

7449,Daruma Sushi Kosher,"

Great restaurant with quality sushi, excellent choice!!

column2: • Kosher restaurant sushi specialists.
<li>They have seven different locations in the city of Rome, all conveniently located and near the city's attractions:
• Ponte Milvio, Ristorante, view on the map here.
• Portico D´Ottavia, Takeaway,  view on the map here.
• Parlamento, Ristorante, view on the map here.
• Prati, Ristorante, view the on map here.
• Eur, Ristorante, view on the map here.
• Rione Monti, takeaway, view on the map here.
• Euclide, Ristorante, view on the map here.
• The Kosher menu can be seen here.
• For more information, you can contact them directly here.

column1:
7496,Su ghetto Restaurant,"

A restaurant with Roman dishes, influenced by flavours from around the world.

column2: • Meat restaurant.
• In the heart of the Jewish ghetto in Rome, this is the place to enjoy the excellence of Kosher food without milk.
• Elegant, historic, but also young and dynamic.
• Serves breakfasts, business lunches, and dinners.
• Being in the Jewish Ghetto is the perfect place to eat traditional food, Mediterranean Kosher and Jewish – Roman.
• For Shabbath service RESERVATION IS REQUIRED. Shabbath meal cost 40€ for adults and 30€ for children under 8 years old.
• Take a peek at their menu.

7324,Dolcevita Panificio & Pasticceria,"

High quality bakery. Great customer service. Must try!

column2: • Nice bakery with plenty of good reviews on their Facebook page.
• Well located not too far from Milan's main attractions.
• Deli offering sandwiches and takeout meals.
• Great choice for tourists and families.
• Catering is available, but they do not offer delivery.
