5040,Gam Gam Kosher Restaurant in Venice,"

Meat restaurant with excellent customer reviews.

column2: • Meat restaurant.
• Located in beautiful Venice, lost in one of its old narrow streets.
• A well rounded menu, very appropriate when visiting Venice. For more information click here.
• This place should be considered as stop on your trip because it has excellent customer reviews.
• You can contact them directly here.

column1:
7589,"C'è Pasta e Pasta in Rome, Italy","

Great restaurant with qualified staff. Talk of the town Lasagna. All fresh and good.

column2: • Homemade pasta Chalav Israel.
• Restaurant with takeaway, catering, and delivery available.
• Located 15 minutes away from hotels and Rome's attractions.
• Displaying a very Italian menu, click here for more information.
• You can contact them directly here.

column1: ",,,,https://www.google.com/maps/uv?pb=!1s0x132f6026c755d893%3A0x83bd59966b92ef1b!3m1!7e115!4shttps%3A%2F%2Flh5.googleusercontent.com%2Fp%2FAF1QipPLr8Ro-adJJ3aUJIuHo4MCRZ1AxbNo_A4joImL%3Dw234-h176-k-no!5sC%27%C3%A8%20Pasta%20e%20Pasta%20in%20Rome%2C%20Italy%20-%20Google%20Search!15sCgIgAQ&imagekey=!1e10!2sAF1QipPLr8Ro-adJJ3aUJIuHo4MCRZ1AxbNo_A4joImL&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjSzbCU2L30AhXSTDABHS5PC9YQoip6BAhZEAM https://www.google.com/maps/uv?pb=!1s0x132f6026c755d893%3A0x83bd59966b92ef1b!3m1!7e115!4shttps%3A%2F%2Flh5.googleusercontent.com%2Fp%2FAF1QipPLr8Ro-adJJ3aUJIuHo4MCRZ1AxbNo_A4joImL%3Dw234-h176-k-no!5sC%27%C3%A8%20Pasta%20e%20Pasta%20in%20Rome%2C%20Italy%20-%20Google%20Search!15sCgIgAQ&imagekey=!1e10!2sAF1QipPdlg1yeKDoikRi-GfGfr8wEvZ1fiUddobSBnpx&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjSzbCU2L30AhXSTDABHS5PC9YQoip6BAhZEAM,,,,"Catering ,Restaurant,Delivery/Pickup",Dairy(Cholov Yisroel),"Via Ettore Rolli, 29, 00153 Roma RM, Italia",Europe,Italy,,,,,moderate,41.8741725,12.4678019,Beth Din Rome,http://www.jewisheurope.org/detail.asp?ID=503,+39 06 5832 0125,http://cepastaepasta.it/kosher/,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,10/4/2018,1/11/2020,,,,

5030,My Kafe,"

Kosher Chalav Israel bar coffee & gelateria.

column2: • Coffee, pastry and ice cream store. Serves breakfast, lunch, coffee, and drinks.
• Combining a modern feel characterised by comfortable seating & free wireless internet.
• Just one hour walk away from Piazza del Duomo, the city's main attraction.
• You can contact them directly here.

column1: ",,,,https://scontent-bos3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.18169-9/17498687_1376051705772015_7682336681834197786_n.jpg?_nc_cat=108&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=8bfeb9&_nc_ohc=deMC51isDH4AX9kIyaE&_nc_ht=scontent-bos3-1.xx&oh=d489df729fc160d1f06b8ff99acb3aab&oe=61CA2694 https://scontent-bos3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.6435-9/52109939_2155496287827549_6832296406674309120_n.jpg?_nc_cat=111&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=8bfeb9&_nc_ohc=9Z7y2l7hIwQAX_bGf6e&_nc_ht=scontent-bos3-1.xx&oh=33c62d2f644db881dce432a5089ba99c&oe=61CB973F https://scontent-bos3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.30808-6/248426318_4556378234405997_4062589773957270603_n.jpg?_nc_cat=109&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=a26aad&_nc_ohc=ewrk3rzNvrwAX-XIYYJ&_nc_ht=scontent-bos3-1.xx&oh=3b98b891ffb2eec1405b7ae2dd263e63&oe=61A9196B https://scontent-bos3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t39.30808-6/251579304_4581655308544956_5345977583515276413_n.jpg?_nc_cat=105&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=a26aad&_nc_ohc=gaTgYmB7GboAX_FVIlx&tn=8xwR0EZvVxQK3iol&_nc_ht=scontent-bos3-1.xx&oh=680d24c71b9e3508ce9d86ab2af4696d&oe=61A90ACC,,,,Cafe,Dairy(Cholov Yisroel),"Via Luigi Soderini, 20146 Milano MI, Italia",Europe,Italy,,,,,moderate,45.4559037,9.1399727,Rabbinato Centrale di Milano,http://www.rabbinato-milano.it/,+39 02 3823 2748,http://my-kafe.business.site/,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,8/4/2018,1/11/2020,,,,

7461,La Reginella D´Italia Kosher Restaurant,

This restaurant is not Kosher anymore.

,,,,,,,,Restaurant,,"Via del Portico d'Ottavia, 65, 00186 Roma RM, Italia",Europe,Italy,,,,,moderate,41.8927414,12.4776034,,,+39 06 6880 1607,https://www.lareginella.it/,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,12/4/2018,1/12/2020,,,,

7373,Flour Farina e Cucina,"

Beautiful pizza place and bakery.

column2: • Chalav Israel on request.
• A nice bakery with plenty of good reviews on their Facebook Page.
• Beautifully decorated and located in a very nice neighborhood of Rome, close to the city's main attractions.
• An excellent deli in Rome, Italy. They serve pizza, sandwiches, fresh pasta, cakes, cornettos, beer, and wine. A great place to eat whether for breakfast, lunch or dinner.
• A great bakery, good pizzas, cooked food, and pastries. Kosher certified and good prices, convenient and helpful for tourists.

column1:
7574,"Kosher Cakes in Rome, Italy","

Fantastic flavours, gentle and professional staff. The store is a beautiful treasure.

column2: • A beautifully decorated bakery, located only 15 minutes away from hotels and Rome's main attractions.
• Specialises not only in cakes, but also cookies, and all sort of desserts.
• They offer takeaways, deliveries, catering services, parties, and all kinds of events.

column1:
7539,"Dolce Kosher in Rome, Italy","

The first Kosher restaurant in Rome.

column2: • Kosher Halavi.
• Established in the year 2000, this restaurant has grown over the years.
• It is located in the neighbourhood Monteverde Vecchio in Rome.
• The restaurant has lovely decor featuring a well-cared-for indoor space and a beautiful outdoor area.
• The menu includes many Judeo-Roman delicacies.
• Dolce Kosher claims to be the first Kosher restaurant in Rome with a cuisine out of the Ghetto.
• For more information click here.

column1:
7436,Bellacarne Ristorante Kosher Roma,"

This is really a great restaurant for everyone!

column2: • Meat restaurant.
• It is beautifully decorated with elegant style.
• Their menu can be viewed here.
<li>Located in Europe's oldest ghetto. Its Kosher kitchen caters for all tastes:
• Homemade cold cuts
• Certified meat
• Spit and spit roast
• Cooking without dairy products
• Meals for coeliacs
• Homemade cakes
• Shabbat Meals
• Saturday breakfast
• Mishmarot
• Glatt Kosher Cuisine
• Bishul Yisrael
• Pat Israel

column1: ",,,,https://www.bellacarne.it/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/bellacarne-ristorante-kosher-roma-gallery-20.jpg https://www.bellacarne.it/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/bellacarne-ristorante-kosher-roma-gallery-18.jpg https://www.bellacarne.it/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/bellacarne-ristorante-kosher-roma-gallery-6.jpg ,,,,Restaurant,Meat,"Via del Portico d'Ottavia, 51, 00186 Roma RM, Italia",Europe,Italy,,,,,moderate,41.8926159,12.4778746,Beth Din of Rome,,+39 06 683 3104,https://www.bellacarne.it/,,https://www.facebook.com/bellacarne?fref=ts,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,12/4/2018,1/12/2020,,,,

7392,Little Tripoli Cucina Kosher,"

Restaurant suitable for families, friendly service and, above all, excellent cuisine.

column2: • Meat and vegan restaurant.
• Located in a nice Roman neighborhood not too far from the city's main attractions.
• Casual place with plenty of good reviews.
• Their menu offers light vegetarian lunches or dinners, but you can find one or two meat dishes as an option.
• For more information click here.

column1:
7307,"Capri Tiberio Palace hotel and restaurant, Capri, Italy","

Stunning interior, great views of the island from the hotel. Outstanding service with its natural friendliness and its attention to detail.

column2: • Fancy and glamorous rooms. Beautiful place to stay if you are planning to go to Capri.
• The restaurant is on the terrace with spectacular views.
• Kosher-Glatt (meat only) dishes certified by the Orthodox Union are served in a reserved area.
• Proposing an innovative menu which blends Kosher rules and typical Italian recipes for lunch, dinner, and Shabbat.
• Halal meat, rarely found in such an international dining context, is also available on request.
• The extensive wine list offers a selection that highlights best labels from each region of Italy, as well as a variety of Kosher wines from Italy and Israel.
• Cookery classes can be held on premises.
<li>Open daily from April 13th to October 15th
• The Kosher restaurant will be open everyday from May 3rd to September 2nd, 2018.

column1: Dinner: from 7 pm to 10 pmGuests are recommended to reserve their table in advance.

7511,Kosher Bistrot Rome Italy,"

Very friendly staff. Huge variety of food with excellent quality.

column2: • Meat restaurant.
• Located very close to the major synagogue and Rome's main attractions.
• Their menu is based on light options, such as small meals, salads and sandwiches.
• They also sell ice cream, soft drinks, coffee and muffins.
• Nice and cozy Italian spot.

6954,"Ba´Ghetto Ristoranti Portico D´Ottavia, Roma","

Meat restaurant with seating available outside.

column2: • Meat restaurant. Chalav Yisrael.

• A place where you can eat outside enjoying the view of a monument installed by Emperor Augustus in honor of his sister, the famous Portico di Ottavia, which once marked the boundary that Jews could not cross at night.
• Innovative and contemporary cuisine in Kosher dairy-free catering.
• For more information about the menu, click here.
• For Shabbat, they provide a special service on Friday night and Saturday lunches for pre-ordered meals. For more information or reservations click here.
• You can contact them directly at baghetto57@baghetto.com.

column1: ",,,,https://www.baghetto.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/carne-2-.jpeg https://www.baghetto.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SHISH-KEBAB-CON-SALSA-AL-SESAMO-min-scaled-700x500.jpg https://www.baghetto.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/COSTOLETTE-DI-ABBACCHIO-ALLA-GRIGLIA-5-min-scaled-700x500.jpg,,,,Restaurant,"Dairy(Cholov Yisroel),Meat","Via del Portico d'Ottavia, 57, 00186 Roma RM, Italia",Europe,Italy,,,,,moderate,41.8927150,12.4777640,Rabbinical Office of Rome,,+39 06 6889 2868,https://www.baghetto.com/it/index.html,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,26/4/2018,31/1/2020,,,,

7298,David Gelateria,"

If you have the time we highly recommend stopping by for a scoop or 3 of their one-of-a-kind flavours.

column2: • Great ice cream store that has been family run for three generations.
• Certified by Rabbi Kosheritaly.it.
• Their high-quality products, years of experience, and a friendly staff brings you extraordinary choices of gelato.
• Great and friendly staff.
• They are also an ice cream school and they teach classes there. For more information click here.
• Excellent choice when visiting Sorrento.

column1:
6276,La Taverna del Ghetto Ristorante,"

NOT A KOSHER RESTAURANT.

column2: • Not a Kosher restaurant.
• New owners. Website not yet updated, we confirmed over the phone.

column1:
7473,Cantina Giuliano Kosher Lodge & Restaurant,"

If you're visiting Tuscany and looking for unbelievable food, great company, and a relaxing atmosphere, then look no further.

column2: • A kosher lodge and restaurant. It is a wonderful place that can't be missed.
• Apartments with 1 to 3 bedrooms, rustic and welcoming.
• Inside a beautiful farmhouse dating back to the 15th century, located in the middle of over 40 acres of woodland and olive fields.
• Panoramic pool, tennis court, and games for the kids make this location the perfect destination for families.
• The restaurant is Kosher Halavi Le’Mehadrin Halav Yisrael and Pat Yisrael, under the supervision of Rav Didi, Chief Rabbi of Livorno.
• Shabbat catering is Glatt Kosher Bassari Le’Mehadrin, meat is strictly Halak Beit Yossef, also under the supervision of Rav Didi, Chief Rabbi of Livorno.
• Rooms and apartments for rent. For more information click here.
• Plenty of things to do and enjoy. For more information click here.
• Amazing reviews on their Facebook page.

7341,Re Salomone Meat Restaurant,"

Great choice of dishes. Fantastic advice from staff for those who don't know Kosher cuisine. Quiet and clean environment.

column2: • Meat restaurant.
• Located in the city of Milan, Italy. Near the city's main attractions
• A good choice when visiting this city. For businessmen or couples.

column1:
7354,Ouazana Kosher Delight Market,"

Butcher for 30 years. Kosher meats in Rome.

column2: • Kosher supermarket.
• Delivery specialists. You can order online directly to your hotel. You can order and pick up yourself too.
• They have four different locations in the City of Rome: On silvestro gherardi 16/18, silvestro gherardi 44, the portico of Octavia 11 and Giacomo Boni 16/18.
• Serving most of the hotels in the area without any problems.
• Awesome choice for picking up cold cuts or cheese for fixing sandwiches during your trip.
• Great wine selection.
• Imported Kosher products, including already made meals to take out and cook in a microwave oven.
• You can contact them directly here.
• This place is permanently closed.

column1:
17657,Schwartz Bakery - Valley Location,"

Kosher bakery in Burbank.

column2: • Did we miss anything? Let us know in the comments below!

column1:
4401,La Gondola Ristorante,"

Swanky restaurant offering a mix of Italian dishes, steaks & sushi, plus Shabbat takeaway.

column2: • After almost a decade in one location, La Gondola moved just a few miles west on Wilshire Blvd. in 2008.
• They are situated in the heart of Beverly Hills, just minutes from Rodeo Drive, all hotels and walking distance from the North Beverly Hills community.
• The restaurant boasts a full bar featuring premium spirits and live piano music every Saturday night in their Lounge area.
• At La Gondola, a warm sumptuous decor is surpassed only by the superb menu, offering the very finest in Italian cuisine.

• From spicy tuna crisps to BBQ ribs, steaks and poached citrus salmon, their menu offers a wide spectrum of delicious choices for all ages. At La Gondola, the food is freshly prepared to order daily.
• Their wine list will also impress and satisfy the most discriminating palate and their extraordinary desserts will complete your ultimate dining experience.

• La Gondola is also well known for their catering. They are pleased to provide all the necessary services in order to transform a special occasion into an unforgettable event, including gourmet cuisine, lavish buffets, carving stations, ice and fruit carvings, art decorations and sweet tables.
• They can also help with arranging florists, photographers, valet service, music, limo service and coordinators.
• In fact, they will cater your affair at any hotel, temple, or location you desire from San Diego to Las Vegas to San Francisco.
• For more information click here.

4390,Orange Delight and Grill,"

Schnitzels, kebabs & burgers are mainstays at this casual spot, serving up a variety of kosher fare.

column2: • A true little-known gem. With an expansive menu including special favourites for kids, there’s something for everyone. Orange Delite also offers catering for any size event.
• Walking into the Orange Delite on Ventura Boulevard, you’ll get a great vibe of a diverse group enjoying good meal together with friends.
• The food is seasoned, high quality, varied and inventive food. You’ll immediately see that customer service means a lot to the owner and staff to make you feel like you’re at a home away from home.
• They're attentive, generous and helpful to ensure a wonderful experience.
• For more information click here.

4421,Fish Grill Malibu,"

No-frills seafood eatery serving grilled kosher selections, on a sunny outdoor patio.

column2: • As far back as anyone can remember, Aharon Klein has loved grilling. At family barbeques, he was always the man behind the grill.

• This life-long passion inspired him to open the first Fish Grill Restaurant in 1986. His idea was to serve simply the freshest fish, grilled to perfection over mesquite coals, with the tastiest side orders, in a warm atmosphere.
• Aharon knew that mesquite wood burns hotter and cleaner than most other fuels and would seal in the fish's juices and bring out its succulent taste.  The rest is history.
• When you walk into the Fish Grill, you'll notice the quaint atmosphere and delicious aroma of freshly caught fish grilling over mesquite coals.

• You are no longer in the big city, but find yourself transported to the colorful setting of an old fisherman's hangout of the 1920's or 30's, in Monterey, Cape Cod, or the Florida Keys. You can almost imagine Steinbeck or Hemingway dining at one of the wooden tables before heading back out to sea.

• Of course a lot has changed since then, but at the Fish Grill, their mission has been the same for the last two decades. They pride themselves on serving the freshest fish available and won't compromise their standards.
• For more information click here.
• Other locations: Fish Grill Pico and Fish Grill Beverly.

4203,Meshuga 4 Sushi Pico,"

Snug & casual sushi spot offers range of kosher hand rolls & Japanese bites for eating in or to takeaway.

column2: • Since 2011, Los Angeles has been going “crazy” or in Yiddish terms, “Meshuga” 4 Sushi! They have been going so crazy that after one successful location in La Brea, the owners, The Bloch family (made up of a creative team of Mark, Laura and son Moshe) opened a second on West Pico Blvd.
• Deriving from Mark’s lifetime passion for fishing and after years of private catering to their local shul, these two all-parve sit-down restaurants came to fruition.
• Meshuga 4 Sushi’s three locations all serve up the same great taste, while meeting all your different atmospheric needs.
• At all three restaurants, you get the same fresh menu with personal attention and curbside pickup availability.

• You will find that Meshuga 4 Sushi is very busy in its takeaway and delivery, as they send platters to LA’s business district as well as big hotels around the city. Shabbos plates are also available to decorate your Friday night table.
• For more information click here.
• They are also located in Mega 4 Sushi La Brea and Mega 4 Sushi Encino.

4451,Haifa Restaurant,"

Casual restaurant doling out generous servings of homestyle Mediterranean fare.

column2: • Haifa Restaurant has been in business since 1978, was taken over in 2008, and continuing the tradition of serving extraordinary Middle Eastern and Mediterranean delicacies.
• The restaurant is owned and operated by David and Raita Tibi, who moved from Tahiti, of all places, to start this new adventure in Las Vegas.

• They have spruced up the restaurant’s appearance, making it more upbeat and colorful.  Haifa Restaurant has been awarded the prestigious Cuisine 100, the Top 100 Restaurants in Las Vegas Award - as well as being rated the Top Mediterranean Restaurant in Las Vegas by John Bonds - a radio personality and food critic for the Last Word on City Dining on his Taste of Vegas Show.
• Centrally located in Las Vegas, they are just minutes away, being the closest glatt kosher restaurant from the “Strip” and Las Vegas Convention Center.
• The dining room is spacious and you will often find a mixed crowd: whether it be local residents, families driving from Los Angeles for a quick get-away or young couples on vacation.

• The restaurant offers all the Middle Eastern favourites such as couscous, falafel, shawarma and beef kebabs with the highest quality cuts of meat along with the freshest fruits and vegetables, and they have recently added a full Chinese menu too.
• For more information click here.

4379,Shanghai Diamond Garden,"

This casual kosher eatery offers a menu of popular Chinese comfort food, plus sushi & sashimi.

column2: • Fans on the wall and green plants along the dining area surround you in Shanghai Diamond Garden, a traditional and original Chinese American restaurant.

• With a fully stocked liquor bar in the center, a massive sushi bar to the side and sporting three large and elegant dining rooms, Shanghai Diamond is an extremely spacious and well run establishment.

• The restaurant’s popularity has the owners feeling a sense of pride.  Being the only full service Chinese kosher restaurant in the Pico-Robertson area, Shanghai has welcomed its Chinese and sushi-loving patrons, ever since their November 2004 opening.
• In an always busy but inviting atmosphere, you will find some of Hollywood regulars dining here at their favorite spot, like Saturday Night Live star comedian, Jon Lovitz.
• For more information click here.

6450,Museum of Tolerance (P.S. Café),"

Coffee bar and restaurant in the Museum of Tolerance.

column2: • P.S. Café is a Glatt Kosher meat restaurant inside the Museum of Tolerance.
• Due to special security regulations, there are no photos of certain places inside the museum, including the coffee bar and restaurant area.
• The Museum of Tolerance (MOT) invites us to understand the Holocaust in a historic and contemporary context, to confront all forms of prejudice and discrimination.
• Located at Beverlywood, 14 miles west of downtown Los Angeles.
• P.S. Café Teudah.

4433,Fish Grill Pico,"

Family-friendly restaurant serving kosher seafood in a nautically themed space with a patio.

column2: • As far back as anyone can remember, Aharon Klein has loved grilling. At family barbeques, he was always the man behind the grill.

• This life-long passion inspired him to open the first Fish Grill Restaurant in 1986. His idea was to serve simply the freshest fish, grilled to perfection over mesquite coals, with the tastiest side orders, in a warm atmosphere. Aharon knew that mesquite wood burns hotter and cleaner than most other fuels and would seal in the fish's juices and bring out its succulent taste.  The rest is history.

• When you walk into the Fish Grill, you'll notice the quaint atmosphere and delicious aroma of freshly caught fish grilling over mesquite coals. You are no longer in the big city, but find yourself transported to the colorful setting of an old fisherman's hangout of the 1920's or 30's, in Monterey, Cape Cod, or the Florida Keys.

• You can almost imagine Steinbeck or Hemingway dining at one of the wooden tables before heading back out to sea. Of course a lot has changed since then, but at the Fish Grill, their mission has been the same for the last two decades. They pride themselves on serving the freshest fish available and won't compromise their standards.
• For more information click here.
• Other locations: Fish Grill Beverly and Fish Grill Malibu.

column2: • Pareve, Pas Yisroel, Yoshon.
• Traditional handcrafted baked goods made fresh daily, such as bread, cakes, pastries, and cookies.
• Continental Kosher Bakery is a peanut-free store, that also offers vegan and sugar-free options.
• Located at Valley Village, 14 miles northwest of downtown Los Angeles.
• Teudah.

column1:
6340,Unique Café,"

Local bakery, coffee shop and restaurant. Chalav Yisrael.

column2: • Dairy coffee shop and restaurant, Chalav Yisrael.
• Unique Pastry Bakery is a family owned and operated business, and has been servicing the Jewish communities in the greater Los Angeles area and beyond, for the last 20 years.
• All bakery products are pareve (Pas Yisroel and Yoshen).
• Cakes, bread, cookies, and other baked goods are baked fresh every day and prepared without any added preservatives.
• There is a coffee shop next to the bakery with a separate dairy kitchen (Cholov Israel), where customers can buy beverages and choose an option from their menu.
• Dining in or take-out available.
• Located at Encino, 22 miles west of Los Angeles.
• For more information about the menu, click here.
• Teudah.

6491,Fish in the Village Fish Market,"

Friendly fish market and restaurant.

column2: • Pareve restaurant.
• Fish in the Village Fish Market is also a restaurant where you can eat-in or takeaway cooked and uncooked meals.

4406,Kohla Farangi,"

Comfortable restaurant with kosher Persian foods like kebabs & Chinese dishes like stir-fries.

column2: • Kohla Farangi came into existence back in 1993 when a middle aged baker from Iran was offered a rare opportunity to open a kosher restaurant on Pico Blvd in Los Angeles.
• Not having much experience in the restaurant business or with kosher food for that matter, he set out to share the food of his native land with the Jewish community in LA.

• Knowing that American Jews were not necessarily used to the aromatic herbs and spices blends of the Middle East he sought to please their palates by adding Chinese food to his menu as well. He adapted the name ""Kohla Farangi"" literally translated as ""foreign hat."" He felt the name evoked a sense of uniqueness, something special, extraordinary and new.

• Some years later this traditional Persian establishment has become ""bread and butter"" for both Iranians craving for a taste of home and Jews from all walks of life hoping to find a unique taste of kosher LA.
• The wood paneled walls and the expansive dining room at Kohla Farangi set the stage for the ultimate Persian feast.
• For more information click here.

4210,Meshuga 4 Sushi La Brea,"

Known for takeaway, this small eatery specialises in kosher sushi & other Japanese-influenced dishes.

column2: • Since 2011, Los Angeles has been going “crazy” or in Yiddish terms, “Meshuga” 4 Sushi! They have been going so crazy that after one successful location in La Brea, the owners, The Bloch family (made up of a creative team of Mark, Laura and son Moshe) opened a second on West Pico Blvd.
• Deriving from Mark’s lifetime passion for fishing and after years of private catering to their local shul, these two all-parve sit-down restaurants came to fruition.
• Meshuga 4 Sushi’s three locations all serve up the same great taste, while meeting all your different atmospheric needs.
• At all three restaurants, you get the same fresh menu with personal attention and curbside pickup availability.

• You will find that Meshuga 4 Sushi is very busy in its takeaway and delivery, as they send platters to LA’s business district as well as big hotels around the city. Shabbos plates are also available to decorate your Friday night table.
• For more information click here.
• They are also located in Mega 4 Sushi Pico and Mega 4 Sushi Encino.

4411,Harissa Restaurant / Got Kosher Cafe,"

This Restaurant used to be Got Kosher Cafe. Different name but same owner.
Bright spot with a diverse glatt kosher menu plus baked goods, vegetarian items & Shabbat takeaway.

column2: • The vibrant cuisine at Got Kosher? Café & Bakery reflects the heritage of chef-owner Alain Cohen, in both his authentic, centuries-old Tunisian dishes, and in his refined French techniques, with many of the dishes rarely found outside of Paris.

• Upon arriving in Hollywood and after a series of culinary jobs, Alain began a successful wholesale gourmet sandwiches and salad operation, and created a catering kitchen in 2005. His small provision shop Got Kosher? opened in 2009 and was remodeled and expanded into a full-service café in 2012, following the owner’s desire to open a place to reflect his passion for delicious food that “just happens to be kosher.”

• Got Kosher? has established itself as a popular spot for a casual lunch or dinner, available for dine-in or take-out. Fridays are especially jam packed with customers from all over town coming for Shabbat provisions, with lines for their award-winning challahs reaching to the corner of the block. The café offers table and bar seating inside as well as outside, perfect for the LA weather almost year-round.
• For more information click here.

4384,Pat's Restaurant,"

Restaurant serving Italian dishes with a Californian influence in a white-tablecloth setting.

column2: • Regarded by many as the ""reigning"" queen of kosher, this ""upscale"" Pico-Robertson Cal-Ital kitchen makes everything from pasta to rib-eye steak so deliciously, you would never know there were cooking restrictions, is how the Zagat Survey describes Pat’s.
• Errol Fine, along with his wife, Pat, hence the name, have been able to create a unique charm that make customers always feel at home.

• The Fines have this incredible passion for the culinary arts, service and hospitality.  Delicious food (a “22” in Zagat), excellent service (“21”) and a welcoming ambiance have always been a given, but it’s the personal attention to their clients that make them and their restaurant special.

• That’s probably the reason why most of their staff members have been with them for over a decade.  In fact, the staff have learned the special tastes and preferences of their customers- whether it’s remembering a certain drink or a desired table.  It is that consistency, and always creating the best experience for the client that makes their time unforgettable.
• With a soaring popularity and lines out the door, reservations are recommended. The restaurant is decorated with a home and garden, English country feel.
• For more information click here.

8562,Eilat Bakery Café,"

Friendly and welcoming bakery, deli restaurant.

column2: • Pareve, Pas Yisroel, Yoshon, and dairy Cholov Yisroel items available.

• Uses Cholov Israel and Yachan flour for dairy products.
• Serving Los Angeles and its surrounding communities for over 35 years.
• Located at Pico-Robertson, near the Museum of Tolerance, 12 miles west of downtown Los Angeles.
• For more information about the menu, click here.
• Teudah.

6458,Le Sushi,"

Small but modern sushi bar with available seating outside.

column2: • Meat restaurant.
• Small but welcoming sushi bar.
• For more information about their dinner menu, click here.
• Located at Valley Village, 14 miles northwest of downtown Los Angeles.
• Teudah.

column1:
4214,Meshuga 4 Sushi Pico,"

Known for takeaway, this small eatery specialises in kosher sushi & other Japanese-influenced dishes.

column2: • Since 2011, Los Angeles has been going “crazy” or in Yiddish terms, “Meshuga” 4 Sushi! They have been going so crazy that after one successful location in La Brea, the owners, The Bloch family (made up of a creative team of Mark, Laura and son Moshe) opened a second on West Pico Blvd.
• Deriving from Mark’s lifetime passion for fishing and after years of private catering to their local shul, these two all-parve sit-down restaurants came to fruition.
• Meshuga 4 Sushi’s three locations all serve up the same great taste, while meeting all your different atmospheric needs.
• At all three restaurants, you get the same fresh menu with personal attention and curbside pickup availability.

• You will find that Meshuga 4 Sushi is very busy in its takeaway and delivery, as they send platters to LA’s business district as well as big hotels around the city. Shabbos plates are also available to decorate your Friday night table.
• For more information click here.
• They are also located in Meshuga 4 Sushi La Brea.

8586,Classic Le Palais Pastry,"

Traditional bakery that has been open for 15 years.

column2: • Pareve, Pas Yisroel, Yoshon.
• Classic Le Palais Pastry provides high-quality affordable pastries and baked goods.
• Offers dairy free, parve delights at reasonable prices.
• In addition to being a French bakery, Classic Le Palais Pastry also sells traditional Persian and Jewish pastries, challah, cakes and ice creams.
• They can provide pastries for large events, small events, restaurants, corporate events and can meet the needs of any special order.
• Available to eat-in or for takeaway and delivery.
• Located at Pico-Robertson, 10 miles west of downtown Los Angeles.
• Teudah.

column2: • Pareve.
• Sangak Express is a Persian sangak bread bakery. They bake Kosher whole wheat bread on site and sell fresh bread daily. Also available pre-cut fresh or frozen.
• Takeaways only.

• From their site: We opened this location in July of 2012, and already serving almost 4000 customers per month. The waiting time can be up to 30 minutes at our service counter. Our client base is about 70% Iranian, 15% Asian and Latino, 15% White and other.
• Located at Valley Marketplace in Reseda, 22 miles northwest of Downtown Los Angeles.
• Heschcher.

Southern California's premiere gluten-free, egg-free, and dairy-free bakery.

column2: • Pareve.
• Offers a wide variety of gluten-free, vegan, and kosher baked goods.
• They have everything you need, either if you want a sandwich, a cupcake, some cookies, muffins or bread.
• Located in Culver City, 11 miles west of Downtown Los Angeles.
• Teudah.

column2: • Large supermarket with Kosher products.
• Teudah.
• All fresh meat and chicken have the RCC seal on the front and back of the package.
• Meats are Glatt Kosher.
• Deli with cooked meals available for takeaway.
<li>
• Bakery.
• Cheese counter.
• Kosher food.
• Liquor.
• Meat department.
• Online deli/Bakery ordering.
• Starbucks
• Sushi
• Located in Encino, 20 miles west of Downtown Los Angeles.
• All meat items are Glatt Kosher (chasidishe shechitas only) and all baked products are Pas Yisrael.
• Offers a mediterranean cuisine alongside an expansive craft beer and cocktail menu.
• It has a casual environment in a very nice contemporary decoration. Good for groups and families.

Glatt kosher falafel, hummus & more served in a strip-mall with a walk-up counter.

column2: • In Hebrew slang, the word sababa means ""all right,"" ""good,"" ""no problem.""
• ""Everything is cool"" has always been the attitude of Sababa Mediterranean Grill in Las Vegas, Nevada.

• The restaurant got its monikor when the original owner called his brother to ask some advice on their new restaurant. The customary response to the ""How are you"" inquiry is to answer with, ""Sababa,"" and when the brothers exchanged salutations, the proverbial light bulb went off, and their new restaurant had a name! When current owner, Effie Shencher bought SMG in 2005, he liked the story and agreed with the philosophy, so he kept the name, Sababa.

• Effie’s first culinary journey began in his mother’s kitchen as a young boy. It was there that his love for cooking grew. He pursued his passion and graduated from Tadmor Culinary School in Israel. Effie has been in the industry for 27 years, operating and owning restaurants and catering businesses in Las Vegas and Israel.
• Sababa looks forward to serving you with ""Everything is cool"" and “all is good” dining experience.
• For more information click here.

7286,Waffles on Maple,"

Casual and friendly waffle store with seating available outside.

column2: • All products are Kosher and Chalav Stam, not Chalav Yisroel.
• Waffles on Maple has changed certification, from the Louisiana Kashrut Commission to oversight by Rabbi Gabe Greenberg of the Orthodox congregation Beth Israel in Metairie. More info here.
• Friendly and welcoming waffle joint, a great place for friends and families to enjoy a meal together.
• Specialises in gourmet waffles, from sweet to savoury and everything in between.
• Offering breakfast, lunch or dinner with many options to choose from.
• For more information about their menu, click here.
• Located at Maple St., 6 miles west of the French Quarter.
• You can contact them directly here.

4466,Kosher Cajun NY Deli & Grocery,"

New York-style deli for classic meals like Reubens & matzo ball soup, plus kosher grocery staples too.

column2: • Kosher Cajun continues its position as the one-stop kosher food establishment in the South.  It all started back in 1987, when owner Joel Brown began bringing kosher edibles to the area, which up until then had been unknown.

• The restaurant which is just three blocks from the Lakeside Mall, also acts as a deli and grocery offering local residents and travellers a wide selection of quality food, large portions at wallet-friendly prices.

• With a very good “21” in food and “20” in service, The Zagat Survey says it best: “There's no place in town more like a New York deli than this awesome Metairie nosh shop serving Jewish favourites, from corned beef on rye with Dr. Brown's cream soda, to matzo ball soup you'll love to kosher gumbo (don't know how they do it!). Groceries by the pound and domestic and imported kosher wines enhance the offerings of this family-operated eatery.”
• For more information click here.

• Milt's is the only kosher restaurant serving lunch and dinner (under CCR supervision) in Lakeview.

7882,Shallots Bistro,"

Glatt Kosher meat restaurant with outstanding environment.

column2: • Glatt Kosher meat.
• Shallots Bistro is a full-service restaurant featuring extensive lunch, dinner, and drink menus. Ranging from sushi and sandwiches to gourmet steaks.
• Nice and well-decorated restaurant with an outstanding environment.
• For more information on their menu, click here.
• Located in Skokie, 14 miles north of Downtown Chicago.

column1:
7757,Bebe's Kosher Deli,"

Grab and go Kosher deli.

column2: • Glatt meat. Yoshon. Mashgiach on site.
• Bebe’s Kosher Deli is one hundred percent traditional Jewish deli fare.
• All prepared deli sandwiches and tossed salads are made to order in addition to deli favorites including matzo ball soup, knishes, bagels, lox, cream cheese and more.

• Meats are Glatt Kosher, and baked bagels and bread are Yoshon. There is a Mashgiach on-site who inspects and supervises the handling and preparation of all products to ensure the highest level of quality and kashrus.
• Located in the French Market in downtown Chicago, Bebe’s Kosher deli is the perfect stop for hungry commuters, local professionals, and students.
• Bebe’s delivers throughout the day and caters for every Simcha.
• For more information on their daily menu, click here.
• Located inside the Chicago French Market, 1 mile northwest of Downtown Chicago.

With over 50 retail locations, the Cincinnati-based company remains family owned and operated while continuing to create 2 1/2 gallon batches of French pot ice cream.

4481,Ken's Diner,"

Longtime kosher eatery with '50s-era flair serving burgers, sandwiches & other American basics.

column2: • Ken’s Diner has become a landmark in Chicago over the past 30 years. In 1976 owner Ken Hechtman first found himself coming to 3353 W. Dempster Street in Skokie, Illinois.
•  Once called Kosher City, Ken’s Diner is now the most popular Kosher-eating establishment in the area.

• This grocery, deli and sandwich shop was the first of its type on the North Shore of Chicago. Ken did not have a fluent understanding of Kosher when he began, but felt that it was by far an underdeveloped industry for such a large Jewish marketplace.
• Inspired by a little deli in Whitefish Bay, Wisconsin called the “Pop or Shop” Ken had the idea of creating a 50’s diner and grill for the Jewish community.
• As a child, Ken use to frequent the Pop or Shop and sit for hours playing music on the jukebox while downing French fries and milk shakes.
• For more information click here.
• Pas Yisroel. Yoshon.
• North Shore Kosher Bakery offers freshly baked bread and a wide variety of appetising treats.
• Family owned.
• Their products are all Yoshon as well as certified  Kosher by the Chicago Rabbinical Council.
• You can walk in and choose from a variety of freshly baked goods; gourmet cookies, delicious pastries, muffins, custard eclairs, chocolate filled croissants, brownies, and cupcakes.
• Located 13 miles north of Downtown Chicago.

column2: • Bienvenido a Argentina! Evita Steakhouse has just recently joined the Chicago Kosher restaurant scene and is offering an array of home-style dishes one might find bubbling over a hot stove or roasting inside an oven somewhere in a kitchen in Argentina.
• Evita is located in Chicago, wedged between Peterson Park and Lincolnwood.
• Lots of brick, hard wood and warm lighting surround you as you step into the rustic dining space.

• The mood: sophisticatedly relaxed. The friendly and attentive owner, Michael Barnatan, is a native Argentinian and excited and passionate to introduce you to his homeland's authentic flavours and delicacies.
• He plans to frequently switch up the menu in order to cover all the distinct flavours from the various regions in the large country.
• The Chefs, Argentinian born-and-raised Joaquin and Gustavo, also a South American native, work diligently to highlight the flavours being showcased in each dish.
• For more information click here.

4490,Hamachi Sushi Bar,"

Intimate, sleek spot for kosher & vegetarian sushi, including maki, plus other Japanese fare.

column2: • Hamachi’s menu constitutes original dishes that were created by their Taiwan-trained head chef, Tee Shakya.
• Hamachi Sauces now sold in Jewel-Osco.
• Hamachi was rightfully nominated for Best New Sushi by Time Out Chicago in 2013.
• Prime fish shipped from Hawaii, New Zealand, Japan and Canada.
• Dairy Cholov Yisroel. Some items contain aged parmesan cheese.
• Pas Yisroel. Bishul Yisroel.
• Soul Cafe is a new Kosher restaurant and gathering space. Their menu has a selection of soups, salads, pizzas, gourmet sandwiches, and more!
• Check their menu here.
• Located 28 miles northwest of Detroit.
• K-COR Heschcher.

Cosy and family-friendly bakery with seating available inside.

• The place to go if you have a dairy allergy.

• Great decoration and outstanding environment.
• Located 15 miles northwest of downtown Detroit.

column1: ",,,,,,,,Cafe,Meat,"215 W Nine Mile Rd, Ferndale, MI 48220, USA",North America,USA,,Michigan,,,none,42.4604597,-83.1365119,KM,https://koshermichigan.com/kosher-certified-businesses/,(248) 206-7510,https://greenspacecafe.com/,info@greenspacecafe.com,https://www.facebook.com/GreenSpaceCafe/,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,10/2/2020,21/1/2021,,,,

column2: • Vegetarian. Non-Orthodox Rabbi certification.
• Kosher Without Borders is designed to help you find Kosher food made to Orthodox standards anywhere on Earth.
• We also list non-Orthodox providers and closed establishments to clear up any doubts you might have, if you come across them while searching online.
• Their commitment is to serve locally sourced and fresh plant-based, custom-crafted meals and beverages.
• Located 18 miles north of downtown Detroit.
• From Kosher Michigan’s website:

column1: “All ingredients used in food production at establishments under Kosher Michigan’s certification must be approved by Rabbi Jason Miller and bear an approved kosher symbol (hechsher). No new ingredients or products may be introduced with prior approval from Rabbi Jason Miller. In most cases, only cheeses with a reliable kosher symbol are used in the production of food. If cheeses that do not bear a reliable kosher symbol are used, they must be USDA-approved cheeses made in the U.S.and the kosher certification letter must stipulate this. These cheeses are approved as kosher by the Conservative Movement through a legal ruling by the International Rabbinical Assembly’s Committee on Jewish Law and Standards (Yoreh Deah 87:10; Rabbi Kassel Abelson 1994).”",,,,,https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1599508704512-2f19efd1e35f?ixid=MnwxMjA3fDB8MHxzZWFyY2h8NHx8cXVlc3Rpb258ZW58MHx8MHx8&ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=800&q=60,,checked,Restaurant,,"32867 Woodward Ave, Royal Oak, MI 48073",North America,USA,,Michigan,,,moderate,42.5306962,-83.1991228,Kosher Michigan,http://koshermichigan.com/,(248) 850-8500,https://greenspaceandgo.com/,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,14/8/2018,20/1/2021,,,,

10583,Zeman's Kosher Bakery,"

Traditional bakery. Pas Yisroel, Yoshon.

column2: • Pas Yisroel, Yoshon (most items - see list in store)
• Established in 1927.

• At Zeman's, they offer the best in artisan, traditionally baked goods. Their top-notch bakers have decades of experience, using the simplest ingredients to make the most delectable baked goods imaginable. Zeman's can prepare shiva appropriate platters to takeaway.
• Located 15 miles northwest of downtown Detroit.
• K-COR Heschcher.
• 360 Image.

column1:
12178,Earthen Jar Restaurant,"

Non-Orthodox certification. Open on Shabbat.

column2: • Vegetarian. Non-Orthodox Rabbi certification.
• Kosher Without Borders is designed to help you find Kosher food made to Orthodox standards anywhere on Earth.
• We also list non-Orthodox providers and closed establishments to clear up any doubts you might have, if you come across them while searching online.

• Earthen Jar Restaurant is a mostly vegan Indian buffet in Ann Arbor. Earthen Jar, Ann Arbor Michigan’s only Kosher restaurant, can be a place for a quick, inexpensive meal for dining in or takeaway.
• From Kosher Michigan’s website:

column1: All ingredients used in food production at establishments under Kosher Michigan’s certification must be approved by Rabbi Jason Miller and bear an approved kosher symbol (hechsher). No new ingredients or products may be introduced with prior approval from Rabbi Jason Miller. In most cases, only cheeses with a reliable kosher symbol are used in the production of food. If cheeses that do not bear a reliable kosher symbol are used, they must be USDA-approved cheeses made in the U.S.and the kosher certification letter must stipulate this. These cheeses are approved as kosher by the Conservative Movement through a legal ruling by the International Rabbinical Assembly’s Committee on Jewish Law and Standards (Yoreh Deah 87:10; Rabbi Kassel Abelson 1994).""",,,,https://www.google.com/maps/uv?pb=!1s0x883cae3e9b7f0747%3A0xdc72fe3f09affe80!3m1!7e115!4shttps%3A%2F%2Flh5.googleusercontent.com%2Fp%2FAF1QipM-g1ubNM1ckIrA3Al-cVGuZmp5vzgMC2Ux8saX%3Dw213-h160-k-no!5sEarthen%20Jar%20Restaurant%20-%20Google%20Search!15sCgIgAQ&imagekey=!1e10!2sAF1QipM-g1ubNM1ckIrA3Al-cVGuZmp5vzgMC2Ux8saX&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwiY5v3Gu6_0AhXrj3IEHTEhCAIQoip6BAhDEAM,https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1599508704512-2f19efd1e35f?ixid=MnwxMjA3fDB8MHxzZWFyY2h8NHx8cXVlc3Rpb258ZW58MHx8MHx8&ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=800&q=60,,checked,"Delivery/Pickup,Restaurant",,"311 S 5th Ave, Ann Arbor, MI 48104, USA",North America,USA,,Michigan,,,moderate,42.2790952,-83.7458727,Kosher Michigan,http://koshermichigan.com/,+1 734-327-9464,http://www.earthenjar.com/,,https://www.facebook.com/Earthen.Jar,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,13/8/2018,20/1/2021,,,,

10587,Dave's Gourmet Restaurant,"

Casual Kosher dining in the heart of Oak Park selling burgers, sandwiches, Chinese and vegetarian cuisine.

column2: • Meat/Mehadrin.
• Burgers, chicken, Asian (meat, Glatt Kosher).
• Dave’s Gourmet is located in the heart of Oak Park and serves the community by providing Kosher food in Metro Detroit.
• Dave’s Restaurant is a family establishment that caters to fast-casual diners and people of all ages. Whether you dine-in or order to takeaway, Dave’s menu has options for everyone.
• Check their menu here.
• K-COR Heschcher.

column1:
10711,7-Eleven (Coolidge),"

Convenience chain with grab-&-go bites and beverages. Assorted newstand items.

column2: • Only the left Slurpee machine is under K-COR supervision.
• K-COR Heschcher.

column2: • Dairy. Non-Orthodox Rabbi certification.
• The Original Bagel Factory is working since the mid 1970's! Offers over 25 varieties of bagels, over 10 cream cheese that they make.
• Kosher Without Borders makes it easy to find Kosher food certified by Orthodox standards only. We list non-Orthodox to satisfy and attend to everyone's needs.
• From Kosher Michigan’s website:

column1: All ingredients used in food production at establishments under Kosher Michigan’s certification must be approved by Rabbi Jason Miller and bear an approved kosher symbol (hechsher). No new ingredients or products may be introduced with prior approval from Rabbi Jason Miller. In most cases, only cheeses with a reliable kosher symbol are used in the production of food. If cheeses that do not bear a reliable kosher symbol are used, they must be USDA-approved cheeses made in the U.S.and the kosher certification letter must stipulate this. These cheeses are approved as kosher by the Conservative Movement through a legal ruling by the International Rabbinical Assembly’s Committee on Jewish Law and Standards (Yoreh Deah 87:10; Rabbi Kassel Abelson 1994).""",,,,https://www.google.com/maps/uv?pb=!1s0x8824b79b4994cda1%3A0x1067bd0bd8914b1d!3m1!7e115!4shttps%3A%2F%2Flh5.googleusercontent.com%2Fp%2FAF1QipMSRgX0QsJFNoo0n_UWRJAMfZy0m-tvHAiKuFXk%3Dw213-h160-k-no!5sBagel%20Factory%20%2024551%20West%2C%2012%20Mile%20Rd.%20Southfield%2C%20MI%2048004%20-%20Google%20Search!15sCgIgAQ&imagekey=!1e10!2sAF1QipMQ8y1fjZoFBzAYOtUVOVvvAcDE6uFkxNsyriWN&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwiD1vy7ua_0AhVNgnIEHShSChcQoip6BAhJEAM,https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1599508704512-2f19efd1e35f?ixid=MnwxMjA3fDB8MHxzZWFyY2h8NHx8cXVlc3Rpb258ZW58MHx8MHx8&ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=800&q=60,,checked,Restaurant,"Dairy(Cholov Yisroel),Pareve","24551 West, 12 Mile Rd. 10684,Bake Station Too-Farmington Hills,"

Cosy and family-friendly bakery with seating available inside.

column2: • Pas Yisroel. Yoshon (most items - see list in store).
• All nut and dairy free.
• This place is a traditional bakery and offers a wide variety of treats.
• The place to go if you have a dairy allergy.
• Located 23 miles northwest of downtown Detroit.
• K-COR Heschcher.

column1: ",,,,https://www.google.com/maps/uv?pb=!1s0x8824b09fc5afc58f%3A0x97cf75802aa3e6a2!3m1!7e115!4shttps%3A%2F%2Flh5.googleusercontent.com%2Fp%2FAF1QipP6pNymjRekmwosXEvS3F7UOJ7Gk2Cybm9lL7Ez%3Dw120-h160-k-no!5sBake%20Station%20Too-Farmington%20Hills%20-%20Google%20Search!15sCgIgAQ&imagekey=!1e10!2sAF1QipP6pNymjRekmwosXEvS3F7UOJ7Gk2Cybm9lL7Ez&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwir3_GLua_0AhUzrHIEHU7HBbkQoip6BAhLEAM https://www.google.com/maps/uv?pb=!1s0x8824b09fc5afc58f%3A0x97cf75802aa3e6a2!3m1!7e115!4shttps%3A%2F%2Flh5.googleusercontent.com%2Fp%2FAF1QipP6pNymjRekmwosXEvS3F7UOJ7Gk2Cybm9lL7Ez%3Dw120-h160-k-no!5sBake%20Station%20Too-Farmington%20Hills%20-%20Google%20Search!15sCgIgAQ&imagekey=!1e10!2sAF1QipONsZ333l2BkHPgLdRxkcz4BEPWTrR1Z-LQGsHI&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwir3_GLua_0AhUzrHIEHU7HBbkQoip6BAhLEAM,,,,Bakery,,"29581 Orchard Lake Rd, Farmington Hills, MI 48334",North America,USA,,Michigan,,,moderate,42.5152669,-83.3600928,K-COR / Council of Orthodox Rabbis of Greater Detroit,http://cordetroit.com/k-cor/,(248) 626-9000,https://bakestation.com/,,https://www.facebook.com/bakestation/,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,7/8/2018,19/1/2021,,,,

12274,Gold 'n' Greens Vegetarian Restaurant,"

Restaurant located on student campus.

column2: • Vegetarian (dairy, Non-Cholov Yisroel).
• Located at the campus of Wayne State University on Anthony Wayne Drive north of West Warren (see map for entrance location).
• Gold 'n' Greens offers all-you-can-eat meals for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. It is open to the public, as well as students and faculty.
• 4 miles north of downtown Detroit.
• K-COR Heschcher.

column1: ",,,,,,,,Restaurant,Pareve,"695 Williams Mall, Detroit, MI 48202",North America,USA,,Michigan,,,moderate,42.3567059,-83.0714381,K-COR / Vaad Harabonim of Detroit,http://cordetroit.com/k-cor/,(313) 577-4200,https://www.facebook.com/pages/Gold-N-Greens/136889076455848?hc_ref=ARQHPH3RPffdeOlWxJEx78COxXOWEKj8f1fD2um3412nq8t6RJZtDCi2Jo1ryEiwf2k&fref=tag,,https://www.facebook.com/pages/Gold-N-Greens/136889076455848?hc_ref=ARQHPH3RPffdeOlWxJEx78COxXOWEKj8f1fD2um3412nq8t6RJZtDCi2Jo1ryEiwf2k&fref=tag,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,9/8/2018,20/1/2021,,,,

10566,Dragonmead Microbrewery,"

Microbrewery with Kosher Certified products, casual and friendly environment.

column2: • Dragonmead was founded in 1997, well ahead of the craft beer revolution in Michigan. Visitors to the Taproom can enjoy over 40 different styles of beer served along with over 15 selections of Dragonmead made wine and mead.
• Sampler platters are available for either beer or mead and wine.
• The staff is knowledgeable regarding the beer styles and can make recommendations based on your taste preferences.
• Located 16 miles north of downtown Detroit.
• List of certified products is on the Letter of Certification, available on the premises.
• K-COR Heschcher.

12161,Krishna Catering and Restaurant,"

Non-Orthodox certification. Open on Shabbat.

column2: • Vegetarian. Non-Orthodox Rabbi certification.
• Krishna is a major deity in Hinduism.
• Kosher Without Borders is designed to help you find Kosher food made to Orthodox standards anywhere on Earth.
• We also list non-Orthodox providers and closed establishments to clear up any doubts you might have, if you come across them whilst searching online.
• Home-style Indian food. All vegetarian and vegan. Lunch buffet with dessert every day until 3:00 pm.
• Located 24 miles northwest of downtown Detroit.
• From Kosher Michigan’s website:

column1: All ingredients used in food production at establishments under Kosher Michigan’s certification must be approved by Rabbi Jason Miller and bear an approved kosher symbol (hechsher). No new ingredients or products may be introduced with prior approval from Rabbi Jason Miller. In most cases, only cheeses with a reliable kosher symbol are used in the production of food. If cheeses that do not bear a reliable kosher symbol are used, they must be USDA-approved cheeses made in the U.S.and the kosher certification letter must stipulate this. These cheeses are approved as kosher by the Conservative Movement through a legal ruling by the International Rabbinical Assembly’s Committee on Jewish Law and Standards (Yoreh Deah 87:10; Rabbi Kassel Abelson 1994).""",,,,https://www.google.com/maps/uv?pb=!1s0x883b4b7045ffe15f%3A0x51aab2ae3e7b9882!3m1!7e115!4shttps%3A%2F%2Flh5.googleusercontent.com%2Fp%2FAF1QipOo3IEFdH9LmsNamIGZ2UolruCaI8apA7D0vga8%3Dw160-h160-k-no!5sKrishna%20Catering%20and%20Restaurant%20-%20Google%20Search!15sCgIgAQ&imagekey=!1e10!2sAF1QipOo3IEFdH9LmsNamIGZ2UolruCaI8apA7D0vga8&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjzjJurtq_0AhXQmHIEHamgBBsQoip6BAhIEAM https://www.google.com/maps/uv?pb=!1s0x883b4b7045ffe15f%3A0x51aab2ae3e7b9882!3m1!7e115!4shttps%3A%2F%2Flh5.googleusercontent.com%2Fp%2FAF1QipOo3IEFdH9LmsNamIGZ2UolruCaI8apA7D0vga8%3Dw160-h160-k-no!5sKrishna%20Catering%20and%20Restaurant%20-%20Google%20Search!15sCgIgAQ&imagekey=!1e10!2sAF1QipPdnzLAyVJ3rIP7wxPQnCNurlH9p5b8tzyU8YxK&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjzjJurtq_0AhXQmHIEHamgBBsQoip6BAhIEAM,https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1599508704512-2f19efd1e35f?ixid=MnwxMjA3fDB8MHxzZWFyY2h8NHx8cXVlc3Rpb258ZW58MHx8MHx8&ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=800&q=60,,checked,Restaurant,"Dairy (Cholov Stam),Pareve","29206 Orchard Lake Rd, Farmington Hills, MI 48334",North America,USA,,Michigan,,,moderate,42.5110683,-83.3584438,Kosher Michigan,http://koshermichigan.com/,(734) 513-3663,http://www.krishnacatering.com/2001.html,,https://www.facebook.com/Krishna-Catering-Restaurant-277020872309103/,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,13/8/2018,21/1/2021,,,,

10668,Chazzano Café Ebraica,"

Kosher Pareve coffee bar. Cholov Yisroel available upon request.

column2: • All coffee products are pareve. Cholov Yisroel available upon request.
• At Chazzano, they have speciality roast coffee beans.
• Most Chazzano Coffee is organic with no harmful additives, so you can drink it all day.
• This is a coffee bar where you can choose from different flavours. Check them here.
• Located a11 miles northwest of downtown Detroit.
• K-COR Heschcher.
• 360 Image.

10572,Cookies & Cupcakes By Design,"

Franchise chain for cookies and cupcakes. Takeaways and gifts.

column2: • Dairy Non-Cholov Yisroel.
• This place offers unique food gifts, including cookies, cupcakes, pretzels, popcorn, candy, dog treats, gluten-free cookies, and special containers for gifts.
• It is a franchise chain selling handcrafted arrangements, opening hours are based on franchise policies.
• You can enjoy cupcakes and other treats in the store, takeaway only.
• Located 24 miles northwest of downtown Detroit.
• K-COR Heschcher.

• We also list non-Orthodox providers and closed establishments to clear up any doubts you might have, if you come across them whilst searching online.

10674,Bloom's Kosher Carryout and Catering,"

Catering since 1952, Kosher takeaway in Metro Detroit.

column2: • Meat/Mehadrin.
• Established in 1952, they have been exclusive caterers in numerous synagogues throughout the area.
• You can find their fresh Kosher food in the freezer section at this Busch’s Fresh Food Market, check here to find it.
• Check their menu here.
• Bloom's kitchen is Located 15 miles northwest of downtown Detroit.
• K-COR Heschcher.

12194,Birmingham Chocolate – Schakolad Chocolate Factory,"

Non-Orthodox certification. Open on Shabbat.

column2: • Dairy. Non-Orthodox Rabbi certification.
• Kosher Without Borders is designed to help you find Kosher food made to Orthodox standards anywhere on Earth.
• We also list non-Orthodox providers and closed establishments to clear up any doubts you might have, if you come across them whilst searching online.
• They offer chocolates ""made fresh on premises,"" using a three-generation European style family recipe.

• The ""made fresh on premises"" concept means that chocolate items do not come pre-packaged from headquarters, rather than items are prepared and dipped at each individual retail location allowing their franchise owners the flexibility to be creative and customise their fresh products to the customer's request.
• Their products are sold in a very cosy and friendly environment.
• From Kosher Michigan’s website:

column1: All ingredients used in food production at establishments under Kosher Michigan’s certification must be approved by Rabbi Jason Miller and bear an approved kosher symbol (hechsher). No new ingredients or products may be introduced with prior approval from Rabbi Jason Miller. In most cases, only cheeses with a reliable kosher symbol are used in the production of food. If cheeses that do not bear a reliable kosher symbol are used, they must be USDA-approved cheeses made in the U.S.and the kosher certification letter must stipulate this. These cheeses are approved as kosher by the Conservative Movement through a legal ruling by the International Rabbinical Assembly’s Committee on Jewish Law and Standards (Yoreh Deah 87:10; Rabbi Kassel Abelson 1994).""

column2: • Certification letter.

10618,The Spot / The Fishbowl Kosher Food Truck,"

Food truck moving weekly and offering fish and chips, shawarma, and falafel.

column2: • Meat/Mehadrin.
• The Fish Bowl and The Spot is a food truck that serves English style fish and chips, falafel and shawarma.
• Check out the where's and when's  on their weekly posts on their Facebook page!
• K-COR Heschcher.

column1: ",,,,,,,,"Food,Delivery/Pickup,Restaurant",Meat,"6800 Drake Rd, West Bloomfield Township, MI 48322",North America,USA,,Michigan,,,moderate,42.5376602,-83.4019343,K-COR / COUNCIL OF ORTHODOX RABBIS OF GREATER DETROIT,http://cordetroit.com/k-cor/,(248) 770-6521,http://www.chefcari.com/index.html,,https://www.facebook.com/chefcaristreeteats/,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,8/8/2018,19/1/2021,,,,

4512,Prime 10,"

Elegant, contemporary restaurant serving steaks, seafood, burgers & wraps for lunch.

column2: • Meat Restaurant.
• Located between the Southfield and Oak Park communities, Prime 10 lives up to its name with its address on 10 Mile Road.
• Open since May 2014, this steakhouse that seats 50, features American and Middle Eastern cuisine.
• Also included in this prime location is an adjacent 1,700 square foot banquet room that hosts events including sheva brachot, bridal showers, and weekly Torah learning for up to 120 guests.
• Owners Scott Cohen and Morgan Mansour started out as silent partners but soon found themselves running the restaurant as the active partner bowed out.
• They had no experience in the restaurant business but were businessmen who worked hard and paid attention to detail, understanding their client’s needs and listening to their suggestions.
• The result is a beautifully appointed space with a pretty ceiling from which they hung crystal chandeliers to add to the ambience.
• The tables are made from a dark hardwood and the washing stations have interesting ceramic tile and beautiful glass bowls.
• For more information click here.

10592,"One Stop Kosher Market, Detroit","

Kosher supermarket, pizzeria and bakery.

column2: • Kosher grocery store and deli.
• Cleaned and checked Romaine lettuce available.
• Pizza Stop - Pas Yisroel, Cholov Yisroel.
• Bakery - Pas Yisroel, Yoshon (most items - see list in store).
• Certified Candies - when bearing the K-COR symbol only.
• One Stop Kosher carries a variety of Kosher groceries and has an in-house bakery, deli, and butcher.
• The food prepared on site is supervised by the Vaad Harabonim of Detroit, and the packaged products are certified by a wide range of kashrut organizations.
• Located 14 miles northwest of downtown Detroit.
• K-COR Heschcher.

• Casual and friendly, with seating available outside.
• Located 15 miles northwest of downtown Detroit.

column2: • Dairy. Non-Orthodox Rabbi certification.
• Kosher Without Borders is designed to help you find Kosher food made to Orthodox standards anywhere on Earth.
• We also list non-Orthodox providers and closed establishments to clear up any doubts you might have, if you come across them while searching online.
• At Peteet’s Cheesecake every one of their gourmet Kosher cheesecakes is made entirely from scratch, with fresh and natural ingredients.
• Located 15 miles northwest of downtown Detroit.
• From Kosher Michigan’s website:

column1: All ingredients used in food production at establishments under Kosher Michigan’s certification must be approved by Rabbi Jason Miller and bear an approved kosher symbol (hechsher). No new ingredients or products may be introduced with prior approval from Rabbi Jason Miller. In most cases, only cheeses with a reliable kosher symbol are used in the production of food. If cheeses that do not bear a reliable kosher symbol are used, they must be USDA-approved cheeses made in the U.S.and the kosher certification letter must stipulate this. These cheeses are approved as kosher by the Conservative Movement through a legal ruling by the International Rabbinical Assembly’s Committee on Jewish Law and Standards (Yoreh Deah 87:10; Rabbi Kassel Abelson 1994).""",,,,https://scontent-lga3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.6435-9/156758386_3802596033158300_128975154991400574_n.jpg?_nc_cat=102&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=8bfeb9&_nc_ohc=p1jRdp5YmiwAX9HNNVy&_nc_ht=scontent-lga3-2.xx&oh=12485e9ad223cb28193a405cb2f4f0fd&oe=61C18357 https://scontent-lga3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.6435-9/163654964_3843279829089920_5610165481049605858_n.jpg?_nc_cat=105&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=a26aad&_nc_ohc=NazYPxO-7GMAX_FMnaD&_nc_ht=scontent-lga3-2.xx&oh=12ad425663c9680a979886f7f515f0bc&oe=61C384A2 https://scontent-lga3-2.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.6435-9/185348148_3999769160107652_8617782563867627126_n.jpg?_nc_cat=110&ccb=1-5&_nc_sid=a26aad&_nc_ohc=K4PeY9g2rbUAX9GSLWT&_nc_ht=scontent-lga3-2.xx&oh=4e81a563b4f0b70c72e0e396c88862ce&oe=61C15D1B,https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1583868161943-29a9ec42256e?ixid=MnwxMjA3fDB8MHxwaG90by1wYWdlfHx8fGVufDB8fHx8&ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1171&q=80,,checked,"Bakery,Food",,"13835 W Nine Mile Rd, Oak Park, MI 48237, USA",North America,USA,,Michigan,,,moderate,42.4593635,-83.1851847,Kosher Michigan,http://koshermichigan.com/,+1 248-545-2253,http://peteetscheesecakes.com/,,https://www.facebook.com/peteetsfamouscheesecakes,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,13/8/2018,20/1/2021,,,,

column2: • Gluten-Free Bakery. Non-Orthodox Rabbi certification.
• Kosher Without Borders is designed to help you find Kosher food made to Orthodox standards anywhere on Earth.
• We also list non-Orthodox providers and closed establishments to clear up any doubts you might have, if you come across them while searching online.
• Ethel's produces gluten-free cookies available for takeaway and gift wrapping. Great decoration.
• Located 14 miles northeast of downtown Detroit.
• From Kosher Michigan’s website:

column1: “All ingredients used in food production at establishments under Kosher Michigan’s certification must be approved by Rabbi Jason Miller and bear an approved kosher symbol (hechsher). No new ingredients or products may be introduced with prior approval from Rabbi Jason Miller. In most cases, only cheeses with a reliable kosher symbol are used in the production of food. If cheeses that do not bear a reliable kosher symbol are used, they must be USDA-approved cheeses made in the U.S.and the kosher certification letter must stipulate this. 4543,Six Thirteen,"

Bright, modern bistro serving kosher eats, craft beer & cocktails, with a fireplace & shaded patio.

column2: • Six Thirteen restaurant in Stamford, Connecticut is your home for kosher comfort food.

• Even though it's a thoroughly modern American bistro, the name is to signify those who are in the know, that it is in fact, a kosher establishment that follows the laws of the Torah and is therefore, certified by the Orthodox Union.
• Six Thirteen, currently owned by Moshe Morrison, has been open since 2014 and is staffed with members of the community.
• Because everyone is from the neighbourhood, all the guests are treated like family and welcomed joyously into their ""second dining room.""
• For more information click here.

4538,Soosh,"

Restaurant with an innovative menu, and choice of select Sake, Japanese beers and wine.

column2: • Soosh is a labour of love spearheaded by founder Ari Lieberman.
• Ari’s ambition in building Soosh was to offer much more than simply sushi – it was to offer a culinary experience at its finest!
• Guests settle into a warm and comfortable space either at the sushi bar or at the cozy tables and can enjoy a relaxing bite with friends or family, or dine with a colleague for a business meal.
• Ari handpicked every detail of Soosh, from selecting the freshest ingredients to hiring the most experienced and friendly staff.
• Soosh’s innovative menu, and choice of select Sake, Japanese Beers and Wine, makes every meal a truly extraordinary culinary experience.
• For more information click here.

column1:
4518,Milk Street Cafe,"

Casual and healthy kosher spot with breakfast & lunch options for varied restricted diets.

column2: • Milk Street Cafe first opened its doors in Boston on November 21, 1981 and has been proud to serve the finest home-made foods ever since.
• This cafe has evolved from a vegetarian one to become a prominent force in corporate catering in Boston.
• They are known for an unmatched commitment to beautifully prepared, delicious, healthy and wholesome foods as well as their famous Brownie Points Program.
• The culinary standards of Milk Street Cafe are very high and non negotiable. Their menu contains both regional and international dishes pleasing to a large crowd.
• Flavours are balanced, clean and always delicious, while presentation is fresh, simple, and beautiful.
• Whenever possible they work with local (and organic) farmers for their produce and specialty items.
• The owners are committed to freshness and to giving back, so much so that at the end of each day, any suitable leftover food is donated to the Boston Food Bank and local soup kitchens.
• For more information click here.

4558,Espresso Cafe & Sushi,"

Kosher kitchen serving an varied menu from Israeli sandwiches & fish to sushi rolls & cappuccinos.

column2: • When owner Sharon Abergel wanted to take his wife to celebrate an occasion or have an enjoyable dairy meal in their Philadelphia neighbourhood, they had no place to go. So he did something about it. He opened up Espresso Cafe & Sushi Bar in June 2004.
• Today, everyone in Philadelphia has a place they can go to, thanks to Sharon.
• Sharon is an easy going guy who believes that if you’re genuine and give customers what they want, they’ll appreciate it and come back.
• He guarantees that every customer that comes for the first time, will undoubtedly come for a 2nd, 3rd and 4th time.
• The food is excellent. Everything is made on premises with the freshest ingredients.
• For more information click here.

11597,The Kosher Wok,"

Traditional Chinese restaurant with a story to tell.

column2: • Glatt Kosher restaurant.
• A Kosher restaurant loved by locals where one of the partners was accused of filming patrons in the bathroom. We are not kidding! Read more about it here and here.
• Allowed to remain open with conditions. New management.
• Co-owner said he is also working on buying out the restaurant and renovating the bathroom.
• You can either eat in or order to takeaway.
• Located 4 miles west of downtown Boston.
• Did we miss anything? Let us know in the comments below!

• Make your own pizza!

Speciality grocery store, butcher, and deli.

column2: • Speciality grocery store.
• Murray Avenue Kosher contains a large selection of Kosher food.

• Catering services available.
• Located 4 miles east of downtown Pittsburg.
• Heschcher.

4563,Citron & Rose Tavern & Market,"

Restaurant offering a modern twist on Eastern European Jewish classics in a posh, sleek setting.

column2: • Glatt kosher, under the supervision of the Community Kashrus of Greater Philadelphia (Keystone-K).

• The restaurant is a re-opening and re-imagining of Citron & Rose, the restaurant launched in 2012 by Philadelphia philanthropist David Magerman and James Beard Award-winning chef, Michael Solomonov.
• The new incarnation of C&R has a broad American menu with traditional comfort food, great steaks, bar food, and a delicious non-dairy dessert menu.
• They also have a large bar stocked with local beers on tap, speciality cocktails, and a broad selection of wine and liquor.
• For more informaton click here.

11021,Van Gough Cafe,"

One of Baltimore's finest Kosher cafes. Cholov Israel available. B&B available on site!

column2: • Located in a 150 year old building in Historic Fells Point.
• NOT everything is Cholov Yisroel, but they do have some products. Ask before ordering.
• Paninis, sandwiches, vegan and vegetarian dishes.
• Ice cream, breakfast, and lunch.
• Check out their menu.
• They run a B&B on site for about $80 a night with a $20 breakfast credit.
• Rabbi Weiss is a local rabbi in Ohr Hachaim.

4529,Cocoaccino's,"

Kosher Jewish restaurant providing all-day breakfast, salads & sandwiches alongside coffee & smoothies.

column2: • Cocoaccino's is conveniently located in the Greenspring Shopping Center in the Pikesville area of Baltimore Maryland.
• It is part of the trifecta of sister restaurants Serengeti and Accents.
• Cocoaccino's is best known for their quick service and reliability despite how busy it can get.
• Many will refer to this restaurant as the go to, best kosher breakfast place in Baltimore.
• For more information click here.

11002,Sapori (Dairy Kosher Restaurant Baltimore),"

A restaurant you shouldn't miss on a visit to Maryland.

column2: • New and delicious Italian restaurant.
• Cholov Yisroel.
• Modern, well maintained place with great service.
• Highly recommended.
• Star K Kosher.
• Related to 3 other well-run Kosher restaurants.
• Located in the Greenspring Shopping Center, next to Shoppers.
• The Knish Shop is a Kosher deli located in Pikesville Maryland, minutes from the Beltway on Reisterstown Road.
• Star-K certified.
• Great Shabbat takeaway, meat or dairy trays and business lunches and delicous holiday meals.
• The Knish Shop was purchased 9 years ago by Mosi and Emily; a husband and wife team. Together they run the deli, each bringing their own talents and energy into the business.
• Sushi platters.
• Take a walk inside the Knish shop!

column2: • Seasons is a Kosher supermarket that invites you to shop for a wide variety of gourmet Kosher foods available at their stores. Including online shopping and delivery
• They offer Kosher grocery and gourmet food, fresh meat and fish, deli, bakery, fresh fruits and vegetables, dairy, yoghurt, cheese, ice cream, and more.
<li>They have seven other locations:
• Lakewood.
• Express Lawrence.
• Lawrence.
• Queens.
• Clifton.
• Manhattan.
• Scarsdale.

column1:
4525,Dougie's Baltimore,"

Laid-back kitchen serving kosher sushi rolls, BBQ, burgers, sandwiches, kebabs & steaks.

column2: • Dougie's BBQ & Grill is an American Jewish original; the United States only kosher barbeque food chain.
• They serve popular cuisine as kosher as it is American.
• Burgers and steaks, salads and soft drinks, hot dogs and fries, deli sandwiches and onion rings, wraps and laugh-it-up good times with family and friends, Dougie's got it all.
• Other locations: Dougie's BBQ Teaneck and Dougie's Express Woodbourne.

11093,Pariser's Kosher Bakery (Baltimore),"

A Kosher bakery open since 1889.

column2: • Kosher, Parve, Yoshon bakery based in Baltimore, Maryland, continuously operating since 1889.
• Pariser's is a scratch bakery with all products made on site to cater to your customisable needs.

• Pariser's Bakery sells everything from challah, breads, pita, cakes, danish, and cookies to knish and bourekas. Pariser's Bakery also makes to-order Kosher speciality cakes for all occasions, whether weddings, graduations, birthdays, anniversaries, bar and bat mitzvahs, or other celebrations.
• Email: orders@parisersbakery.com.
• Giant stores:

column1:
11017,Ofishel Catering,"

Kosher Catering Company that caters to travellers. Very useful tips.

Since 1979, O’Fishel Kosher Caterers has been delighting customers throughout the Mid-Atlantic and beyond! Whether it’s for an intimate gathering at a downtown hotel, a corporate function at a bowling alley, a Simcha of any kind, or a convention for hundreds, O’Fishel offers fresh, delicious, creative Kosher catering and food service. With friendly, experienced staff tending to your every need, it’s no wonder that our clients have been making it O’Fishel for almost 40 years!

column2: • Shabbos takeaway menu.
• Great option for travellers. They deliver to hotels and offices.
• Check out the other menus.
• info@ofishel.com.

The daily special restaurant is going through some management changes at this time, please look out for updates on when we will resume service.
A modern and slick restaurant in downtown Baltimore.

column2: • Meat restaurant.
• Clean modern, with unique dishes.
• Located in downtown Baltimore.
• Sit-down, takeaway and delivery.
• A new dish every day!
• Kosher certificate.

4533,Accents Grill Atrium,"

The all-kosher menu at this shopping-centre eatery features burgers, salads, sushi, beer & wine.

column2: • With over 23 years of experience, owners Larry and Lara Franks opened Accents out of a need for great kosher food in the market.
• Accents has been serving up family style food to the community of Baltimore since 2005.

• With a contemporary ambience and an exciting menu which includes char-grilled meat and traditional American entrees as well as a large variety of salads, sandwiches, and soups, Accents appeals to every member of the family.
• The restaurant’s name describes their attention to detail in the accents of the food they’re preparing for you.
• Great customer service is embedded into the framework of the restaurant which makes it such a pleasant environment to be surrounded by while enjoying a great meal.
• For more information click here.

10635,"MIlk & Honey Bistro, MD","

Cholov Yisroel restaurant and caterer. Casual environment.

column2: • Dairy Cholov Yisroel.
• Located in Pikesville, Milk & Honey Bistro is renowned for its culinary excellence and internationally inspired Kosher dishes.
• They offer dairy and fish platters. With experience in the Baltimore and Washington areas, catered from simple to elegant.
• Casual and friendly environment.
• Check their menu here.
• Teudah.

11098,KB Grill & Wok - Kosher Bite/KB Szechuan (Baltimore),"

A no-nonsense Kosher grill in Baltimore.

column2: • Meat - Glatt Kosher, Pas Yisroel, inquire for Yoshon information. Caterer, restaurant with takeaway.
• KB Grill has been serving local families delicious Kosher food for over 25 years. There is ample seating in the dining room for almost any size party.
• KB Grill & Wok maintains one of the largest selections of Kosher wine, liquor and beer in the State of Maryland.
• The staples of Jewish food in America; Chinese and sushi menu available.
• located 7 miles northwest of downtown Baltimore.
• Star-k Heschcher.
• The best Kosher Chinese takeout in the DC metro area and the only kosher Chinese restaurant from Atlanta to Baltimore.
• Holy Chow offers great food for you and your family.
• The restaurant is 100% kosher.

10998,Eden Cafe Kosher,"

A no-frills dairy restaurant located in the JCC. Cholov Yisroel.

column2: • All items are Yoshon, Pas Yisroel and Cholov Yisroel.
• Email them at: EdenCafe2@gmail.com or call 410-542-5185.
• Lunch and dinner choices include: falafel, pastas, soups, salads, calzones, wraps, paninis, knishes, fish, pretzels with toppings, and a great variety of pizzas. Don't miss the French fries!
• Desserts include soft and hard ice cream, sundaes, milkshakes, cheesecake and ice cream cake (by special order).
• Visitors will also find many Kosher packaged goods from Israel, including lots of yummy Mediterranean treats.

column2: • Sender’s Smoke Joint strives to bring something special to the kosher world.
• The food is loaded with smoky, perfectly seasoned flavor, and some dishes, like wings and hot dogs, come LOADED with added toppings.
• Sender's is also famous for its daily specials, such as the Chef's Soup, in flavors such as mushrooms, beef, barley and brisket, split peas.

12356,D-Lux Family Restaurant,"

Glatt restaurant and sushi spot, great decoration.

column2: • Glatt restaurant.
• Opened in 2008 as a modest Kosher family restaurant, D-Lux has now expanded to accommodate their ever-growing popularity.
• Now in a brand new beautifully designed location, D-lux has seating for 210 and offers a variety of menus and services.
• With D-lux family restaurant, D-lux Sushi and D-lux catering all under one roof, they’ll satisfy every member of your family.

• Whether it’s American style, Chinese, or sushi you crave, D-Lux is the place for you. With their in-restaurant dining, extensive takeaway menu, out of restaurant catering, or beautiful party room, D-Lux has you covered whatever the occasion.
• Contemporary decoration, family-friendly environment.
• Check their menu here.
• Located in Gourmet Glatt Plaza, 2 miles north of downtown Lakewood.
• Heschcher.

12375,The Pizano,"

Italian-style restaurant and sushi place. Seating availble.

column2: • Dairy.
• This place is an Italian-style café and sushi spot.

column2: • Located just minutes from Newark Airport, Jersey Gardens, and easily accessible from Staten Island, Avenue Grill & Sushi is the only sit-down kosher restaurant in Elizabeth, NJ at your service.

• It is supported by Glatt Star Catering and the One Stop Kosher Market in the building to its right offering the largest food shopping experience with departments in deli, bakery, dairy, butcher, fruits, vegetables, frozen foods, candy, and party goods.
• Avenue Grill & Sushi’s establishment has been owned and operated by Pinchas Kasirer since the middle of 2005.
• Along with the restaurant manager Ben, Mr. Kasirer leads the way to ask his customers what dishes they like and adds it to the menu.
• The restaurant is quite unique in that it provides a combination of delectable cuisines:  from Middle Eastern to Sushi, delicatessen sandwiches to burgers and schnitzels, the restaurant has it all!
• For more information click here.
